    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23609771/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/women-leading-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23609771\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined Amani Radman: an amazing woman on two very special missions. To provide reliable, cost-effective transportation services through her own logistics brand; and, to champion the power of diversity in supply chain.</p>\n<p>Born in Somalia, Amani moved to the US and achieved a degree in supply logistics, management and leadership from Portland State University before going on to establish a successful corporate career. Having gained extensive experience across supplier management, business process and operations, Amani went on to found her own business, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/malao-logistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Malao Logistics</a>, Minnesota’s premier logistics company specializing in freight brokerage and transportation services.</p>\n<p>Today Amani will be talking to us about her career so far; moving out of the corporate world to found her own business; taking a family approach to logistics; and the importance of diversity in industry. Plus, she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in supply chain, as well as her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR: </strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://emergemarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Emerge</a>. As a company focused on empowering and growing meaningful supply chain relationships, Emerge is proud to sponsor Women In Supply Chain™. Through its freight procurement platform, Emerge offers solutions that enhance the spot and contract procurement process, enabling shippers and carriers to make more strategic decisions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[08.37] Amani’s background growing up in Somalia, and her brave decision to move to the USA to start a new life at age 18.</p>\n<p>[10.32] How Amani found supply chain, and why she’s so passionate about it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Coming from Somalia, I want to be able to connect the dots… and what is the best way to do that? With logistics, because there’s always transport.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.25] Amani’s experience at global outdoor brand Columbia Sportswear Company, and how the woman-led business inspired her.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Coming from a male-dominated company, all the leadership… everybody was a woman!&#8230; It really showed me what it is to be a woman in supply chain, and how to take it to the next level.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.47] Amani’s previous role at Boeing, the importance of supplier diversity and how businesses should approach it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Think of it like a mentorship program… the more you mentor us, the more we get bigger and the more we can support you – you can literally customize us the way you want to!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.35] The differences between corporate and small business, and why Amani made the decision to start her own company, Malao Logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In corporate, things move so slow… and the supply chain doesn’t wait!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.09] A closer look at Malao, what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<p>[25.21] Some of the challenges Amani has faced whilst establishing Malao Logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The hardest part is being accepted in the community… I know the journey is hard, but I have to do this for all the women… I want to be the woman they look up to and say ‘well she did it, why can’t I?’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.22] Amani’s experiences at large industry events, particularly as a woman who wears a head scarf.</p>\n<p>[32.56] How Amani found, and embraced, her voice, and her advice for others.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Don’t give up on your dreams, because if you give up on yourself, don’t expect anyone else to believe in you.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.47] The future for Amani, and for Malao Logistics.</p>\n<p>[38.42] Amani’s final words of wisdom for the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with Amani over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/amani-radman-74253684/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>If you&#8217;d like to hear more from Amani, check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode265/\">Episode 20 of Blended – DEI in the Workplace – Not Just The Smart Thing To Do, But The Right Thing To Do</a>. And if you want to find out more about another incredible woman building her own logistics firm, check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode205/\">Episode 205</a>, where Kristy Knichel reflects on her journey and the numerous benefits of working with a certified woman-owned and operated business.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23534516/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/ai-and-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23534516\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.argo.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Argo AI</a>, a forward-thinking transport technology business who are on a mission to make the world’s streets and roadways safe, accessible and useful for all, through the power of self-driving technology.</p>\n<p>With a team of self-driven engineers, strategists, product managers, and more – from over 50 countries – Argo are utilizing self-driving products and services to transform the movement of people and goods, benefiting communities around the world, and empowering both people and businesses to be more successful.</p>\n<p>Today Lehren MacKay, Head of Business Development at Argo AI, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the landscape of autonomous technology; embracing a culture of safety; and why self-driving technology has profound potential to transform the way we live and move.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.23] The current landscape when it comes to autonomous vehicles, and why it&#8217;s a growing focus for many businesses.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s really exciting times – we are seeing a lot of investment in the autonomous vehicles space and a focus on a lot of diverse applications of the technology, ranging from delivery to ride share to trucking.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.29] An overview of Argo – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We have had a really collaborative process with our customers, creating relationships that drive mutual benefits and ultimately thinking about how we can future proof their businesses.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.59] Mapping, sensing, planning and acting – the four key steps in how Argo&#8217;s autonomous technology works.</p>\n<p>[14.18] The relationship between AI and people, and why it’s important to harness the power that comes from both working seamlessly together.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;We often think about ‘how are we designing products, with people and customers in mind?’ And so for us, our key purpose is ‘how do we think about reimagining the human journey?’</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.26] A closer look at Argo’s Autonomous Delivery service, and the value it’s bringing to both the middle and last mile for customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re seeing a re-emergence of the urban middle mile… and as part of this change, we’re seeing new delivery middle mile use cases.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.04] From tackling efficiency issues to addressing sustainability goals, the positive impact autonomous vehicles can have on the industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There are a lot of driver shortages impacting delivery schedules, and we think autonomous vehicles can actually become that reliable driver supply to meet increasing volume and demands.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.53] Why safety is a core value at Argo, and why autonomous vehicles have the potential to revolutionize the safety of our roads.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We are ultimately designing a driver that never gets tired, never gets distracted – and never drinks too much!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.07] Argo’s ethos of benefiting communities, and empowering both people and businesses.</p>\n<p>[27.11] The ideal client for Argo.</p>\n<p>[29.09] A case study, showing how Argo supported a key client with store-to-store rebalancing, in order to help them meet changing customer demands.</p>\n<p>[32.56] The future for Argo, and for autonomous vehicles.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Argo AI’s <a href=\"https://www.argo.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Argo and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/argo-ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/argoai\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a> or <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/argoai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Instagram</a>, or you can connect with Lehren on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lehren-mackay/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23479646/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/freight.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23479646\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.pando.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Pando</a>, a global logistics software brand and the world&#8217;s first open-market freight management platform, which brings together an economic network of delivery stakeholders.</p>\n<p>Pando is a market leader in supply chain technology, building the world’s fastest, and highest ROI driven networked‑Transport Management System. Pando is the TMS of choice for Fortune 500 manufacturers, retailers, and logistics companies globally, with a presence across Southeast Asia, the Middle East and North America. Pando’s network‑powered SaaS platform for supply chain execution helps enterprises digitalize, automate, and scale their logistics operations across all modes and legs of movement.</p>\n<p>Today Nitin Jayakrishnan, co-founder and CEO at Pando, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the key challenges in global logistics; the power of collaborative optimization; and why businesses need to look beyond cost saving, towards improved accuracy, responsiveness and predictability</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.57] Nitin’s founder story, and the journey that led him to establish Pando.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We set out to build a marketplace for domestic freight – Uber for freight!&#8230; Along the way something interesting started happening: our customers&#8230; started asking us if we could expand our tech into other freight and warehousing providers.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.20] An overview of Pando – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Most management solutions were built before the year 2000… The tech that sustains global supply chains is completely archaic!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.57] A look at some of the key challenges Pando’s customers are facing right now, and Pando’s approach to solving them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;These are brands that we love and live with… these brands ultimately serve you and me, so the mission for Pando, of course is to solve supply chain issues and logistics inefficiencies, but really is to serve the brand we love to help those brands serve us better!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.21] The importance of good data, and Pando’s game-changing control tower capabilities.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;You don’t put the control tower at the top, you put it at the bottom – it’s the foundational layer of data that feeds into these systems… the input is controlled, so you’re not only able to solve the data problem, but you’re able to predict and prevent the challenges.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.00] A closer look at Pando’s TMS solution, and how it can revolutionize dispatch planning and decision-making.</p>\n<p>[30.25] Integration, and how Pando work with their network of partners.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Companies are now realizing that what was once called back end operations is now coming front and center of their global strategies.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.22] Sustainability, how Pando facilitates a reduction in carbon footprint for their customers, and why clients increasingly expect their suppliers to be an active part of helping them achieve their own ESG goals.</p>\n<p>[40.25] The onboarding process with Pando, and their mission to deliver fast and effective integration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“With Pando, the time to value is 90 days – and that’s a gamechanger. It’s a gold standard when it comes to enterprise technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[43.43] The ideal client for Pando.</p>\n<p>[45.21] Two key case studies, illustrating how Pando helped one customer reduce supply chain costs and achieve end-to-end visibility, and another solve shipping efficiency issues in order to realize an additional $2.5 million in revenue.</p>\n<p>[48.39] The future for Pando.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Pando’s <a href=\"https://www.pando.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Pando and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/pandocorp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Nitin on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nitinjayakrishnan/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "56a77b89-da06-4c36-8bf0-6b1c46d33a29",

    "title": "272: Blended &#8211; Boost Your Bottom Line: Why You Should Be Retaining Diverse Talent",
    "slug": "episode272",
    "date": "2022-06-15T04:00:42",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23430713/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/equality-and-diversity-in-the-workplace.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23430713\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />It’s episode 21 of Blended! I’m joined by another incredible panel of guests and we’re talking about diverse talent in the workplace, and how to keep it. From labor shortages to issues around retention, I’m having more and more conversations about talent on Let’s Talk Supply Chain, and it really was time to bring that conversation over to Blended. Ensuring you have diverse talent in your business could be the difference between surviving and thriving, so it’s something everyone should be taking seriously.</p>\n<p>Today, our guests will be discussing the current landscape in supply chain when it comes to talent; sharing their own personal experiences; tackling how to successfully hire and retain talent; and discussing exactly how we navigate bias to improve company culture.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[00.45] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Bryant – Digital Content Marketing Manager, Corporate Communications at Blue Yonder</li>\n<li>Meredith – Senior HR Director at DHL Supply Chain</li>\n<li>Heidi – Founder of Diversity Study Group</li>\n<li>Sugathri – Program Director, Women In Supply Chain™s at Digital Supply Chain Institute</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“The landscape is transforming like never before.” Sugathri</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.50] The group dives into the current landscape in supply chain when it comes to talent, and reflects on the truth behind the headlines around ‘talent shortages’ and the ‘great resignation.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Is there a difference between talent and labor shortages?</li>\n<li>Working with the right recruiter</li>\n<li>Changing the face of the wider industry you work within</li>\n<li>Selling your brand</li>\n<li>Understanding the changing market and needs of the next generation</li>\n<li>Robust retention plans</li>\n<li>Culture work</li>\n<li>How does leadership need to change?</li>\n<li>Making DEI a business case</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Ensuring that you have the right wages and the right benefits have become really important – if you’re not hitting the mark on that, and if your culture is not right, people aren’t going to come and work for you. Or they’ll come, and then they’ll leave.” Meredith</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.56] The panel reflects on the step before retention – hiring the right talent.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Are talent shortages a result of dated and exclusionary hiring practices?</li>\n<li>Driving diversity of thought, which leads to innovation</li>\n<li>Crafting diverse teams</li>\n<li>How do we ensure diverse voices are heard equally?</li>\n<li>Allyship and elevating others&#8217; voices</li>\n<li>Why it’s not just an HR issue</li>\n<li>Unconscious bias</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a candidate driven, employee market, and its absolutely essential that organisations are pitching themselves right.” Heidi</p></blockquote>\n<p>[40.47] The group shares their personal experiences and dive deeper into unconscious bias: what it means, the impact on retaining talent and how we successfully navigate through it in the workplace to help retention.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Giving regular feedback</li>\n<li>Creating boards and panels instead of making things one person’s responsibility</li>\n<li>Communication and conversation</li>\n<li>Sharing of personal experience and perspective</li>\n<li>Taking accountability for our own bias</li>\n<li>How we can help others to make it personal, connect and understand</li>\n<li>Creating working communities</li>\n<li>Address it head-on</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Anybody who has been ‘othered’ is always asking themselves those questions – do I have an unconscious bias? And it’s terrifying when you have to come face to face with yourself and admit it.” Bryant</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.13.14] The panel summarizes their thoughts on how organizations can successfully retain talent.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Flexibility</li>\n<li>Being proactive instead of reactive</li>\n<li>Ensure people feel accepted, included and valued</li>\n<li>Visible leadership</li>\n<li>Intention</li>\n<li>Building the right culture</li>\n<li>Overhaul your hiring processes to better onboard diverse employees</li>\n<li>Support the creation of communities within your organization</li>\n<li>Train managers to lead diverse teams</li>\n<li>Make it all transparent</li>\n<li>Create mentorship and sponsorship opportunities</li>\n<li>Develop a formal retention plan</li>\n<li>Stand in solidarity with diverse employees</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[01.27.23] The group sums up their thoughts from today’s discussion.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/bryantjmiller/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\"   {
    "uuid": "029c3c25-f0ee-48b1-8a33-2c1bd19952d1",
    "episode_number": 271,
    "post_id": 13704,
    "title": "271: How Klaus Imping is Helping Business Leaders to Make Digital Process Transformation Sustainably Successful",
    "slug": "episode271",
    "date": "2022-06-13T04:00:15",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23403857/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/process-improvements.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23403857\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.klausimping.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Klaus Imping</a> – best-selling author, entrepreneur, innovator, thought leader and CEO all rolled into one.</p>\n<p>With an education in Business Administration, Klaus worked for almost a decade in various organizational, IT and process re-engineering roles before making the move to consulting, where he has worked with numerous clients and projects for almost three decades. As an author, entrepreneur and the CEO of mSE PointOut Group, Klaus operates in the magic triangle of information technology, processes, and strategy, with a focus on supply chain management in a global context.</p>\n<p>Today Klaus joins me to chat all about his impressive career so far; his new book; his passion for making business process digitalization effective; and why tribal workflows are undermining digital transformation.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.54] Klaus shares his background and career journey, from his early employed roles to where he is today.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“This was the first time that I got the idea that the strength and resilience of processes is a result of three factors and the technical enablement is only one – the process design and the process adherence are equally important.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.03] How his father’s workplace experiences helped to shape Klaus’ mindset and approach to his own career.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You always find enough reasons to declare yourself a victim of circumstance, that’s easy. The hard way is to raise your hand, take influence and bring things to the right direction.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.18] Klaus’ position in ‘the magic triangle of information technology, processes, and strategy’ – what he means by that, and why it’s the ideal place to be.</p>\n<p>[16.27] An overview of Klaus’ upcoming book ‘Tribal F*cks Up Digital.’</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I truly think that digitalization and digital transformation is the next industrial revolution – it’s not a nice to have… it’s a do it or die type of thing.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.52] Why Klaus wrote the book, the process of writing it and his passion for transforming the way we think about digitalization.</p>\n<p>[23.18] A closer look at digital transformation, and why technology isn’t the answer.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It might work technically – but the process, the people, the workflow just doesn’t adopt it… and it’s the famous Excel spreadsheet that survives!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.20] Tribal workflows, and how they neutralize digitalization.</p>\n<p>[32.31] The importance of effective adoption, and how it’s different to traditional change management.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Digital transformation is not limited by technology. Digital transformation is limited by adoption.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.54] Klaus’ reflections on what the next couple of years are going to bring for the industry.</p>\n<p>[39.03] A look at Klaus’ organization, <a href=\"https://www.mse-pointout.com/home\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">mSE PointOut Group</a>, recently named a 2022 GARTNER Cool Vendor in Supply Chain Technology.</p>\n<p>[41.29] What the future holds for Klaus.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Klaus’ <a href=\"https://www.klausimping.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more, pre-order his book and to discover how he could help you too. You can also connect with Klaus on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/KlausImping/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5468, 5388],
    "tags": [

      5661, 5539, 5611, 5612, 6716, 7419, 7418, 5603, 7098
    ],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/process-improvements.png",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/process-improvements.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/process-improvements-300x201.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/process-improvements-300x201.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/process-improvements.png 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "e0470603-3ffe-459a-803f-6275798115af",
    "episode_number": 270,
    "post_id": 13676,
    "title": "270: Women In Supply Chain™, Sneha Kumari",
    "slug": "episode270",
    "date": "2022-06-06T04:43:26",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23323994/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-women-leaders.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23323994\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />\n<p>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by the supply chain program manager at Amazon, Sneha Kumari.</p>\n<p>A Six Sigma Green Belt certified professional, who boats over a decade of experience leading quality supply chain and operational programs at several companies, Sneha is recognized as Operations Women Leaders by McKinsey and Co. Which doesn&#8217;t happen often! She pours her passion into making the circular economy happen.</p>\n<p>Today Sneha will be talking to us about her career so far, how she went from engineering to supply chain, her experience growing up in India,  and why it&#8217;s so important to highlight diverse voices. Plus, she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, as well as her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h1>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://emergemarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Emerge</a>. As a company focused on empowering and growing meaningful supply chain relationships, Emerge is proud to sponsor Women In Supply Chain™. Through its freight procurement platform, Emerge offers solutions that enhance the spot and contract procurement process, enabling shippers and carriers to make more strategic decisions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h1>\n<p>[01.27 ] Sneha&#8217;s background, her childhood in India, and how she came to the U.S.</p>\n<p>[05.18] How Sneha went from technology to a successful career in supply chain and her experience in both male-dominated industries.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Even though I was putting in more hours, I still wasn&#8217;t seen&#8230; As women, we feel the urge to put in more hours because [our] confidence is already shattered.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.34] Sneha&#8217;s journey in sales and marketing.</p>\n<p>[14.48] How <a href=\"http://www.cranevalve.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Crane Fluid Handling</a> helped Sneha fall in love with supply chain and what others can learn.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;I have to give it to [them] for believing in me, supporting me, and letting me lead multiple facets of supply chain.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.45] Sneha&#8217;s Six Sigma Greenbelt; what it is, why she went for it, and how it&#8217;s impacted her career.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you think from a quality lens, I think it&#8217;s worth it! It helped me. It&#8217;s a method to give an organziation the tools to improve their capabilities.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.45] What Sneha is up to now and what she&#8217;s doing for the next generation of supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;I&#8217;m super deep into circular supply chains.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.23] Sneha&#8217;s recent passion project.</p>\n<p>[26.33] Sneha&#8217;s perspective on the importance of elevating diverse voices.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I still don&#8217;t see a lot of companies walking this talk. Great—we&#8217;re talking about [diversity] more now, but I think it needs to be a part of business views. Otherwise, it&#8217;s going to be very hard.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.31] How mentorship and women played a role in Sneha&#8217;s journey.</p>\n<p>[34.10] What the future holds for Sneha.</p>\n<p>[35.19] Sneha’s words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h1>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with Sneha over on <a href=\"http://www.linkedin.com/in/snehakumari\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>If you enjoyed finding out more about female leaders in supply chain, why not <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/women-in-supply-chain/wisc-podcast/\">check out our other WISC episodes </a>where I&#8217;m joined by powerful women who work at powerful companies like, <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode250/\">Crocs</a> and <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode212/\">Starbucks</a>. And if you&#8217;re interested in hearing about diversity and inclusion &#8211; and why we need to talk about it &#8211; <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/diversity-and-inclusion-blended/\">there&#8217;s a whole podcast on that, too. </a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/lets-talk-supply-chain/\">Check out our other supply chain podcasts here.</a></p>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5468, 5388, 5515],
    "tags": [5350, 7414, 6790, 5437, 5346, 5641],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/supply-chain-women-leaders.png",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/supply-chain-women-leaders.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/supply-chain-women-leaders-300x201.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/supply-chain-women-leaders-300x201.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/supply-chain-women-leaders.png 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "745896d2-d31a-4054-a9b9-8dfa9f4970b8",

    "title": "269: The Best-Kept Secret For Vendor Relationships ",
    "slug": "episode269",
    "date": "2022-05-30T04:00:19",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23253653/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/vendor-relationships.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23253653\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />We’re continuing to put the spotlight on our incredible family of Let’s Talk Supply Chain live shows, bringing you special guests and exclusive content that you don’t want to miss.</p>\n<p>Last week, we featured First Things First, with Mercado in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode262/\">episode 262</a> and Coming In Hot, with Abby Baird in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode264/\">episode 264</a>. And now it’s Sarah’s turn with Thoughts and Coffee.</p>\n<p>Known as &#8220;The Best 30-Minutes on a Tuesday&#8221;, this weekly show brings you the hottest supply chain topics currently brewing in the industry, every Tuesday at 10am EST.</p>\n<p>In this episode, Sarah is joined by special guest Brad Blomstrom, Chief Financial Officer at Emerge, to talk about increasing corporate social responsibility through procurement, 2022 supply chain predictions – and to share the best-kept secret for better vendor relationships.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[08.27] Sarah recaps on recent episodes, and shares what’s new with Let’s Talk Supply Chain, Blended and the Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ family of live shows.</p>\n<p>[11.43] An introduction to special guest Brad Blomstrom and his role at Emerge.</p>\n<p>[13.59] Sarah and Brad chat about the poll of the week: do you drink coffee?</p>\n<p>[17.48] Sarah reveals the topic of her Monthly Hustle newsletter, podcast tips and tricks.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Smile, have fun, speak to what you know&#8230; and it’s usually a pretty good conversation.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.08] Sarah and Brad discuss the first of three trending supply chain articles: supply chain predictions for 2022, and the growing investment in delivery technology.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“To procure capacity inside your network and get goods shipped on time, shippers need a solution like Emerge to be able to manage those capacity relationships in real time.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.38] Sarah and Brad chat about the white paper released by Emerge and Reuters all about enhancing relationships in logistics through data and collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You need to get use out of your data… previously, there’s been a lot of unstructured, single-purpose data that sits in a silo &#8211; and people lose a lot of the value that comes out of monitoring and utilizing the insights that come from their normal behavior.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.01] Sarah and Brad reflect on the third and final article of the episode, focusing on the importance of procurement to CSR initiatives.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/brad-blomstrom-47801b9/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Brad</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>If you want to find out more about Emerge, why not check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode243/\">episode 243</a>, where George Abernathy chats all about the company: what they do; bringing accountability to logistics; and why it’s so important to bring all the industry players together in order to build positive and mutually beneficial networks.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://youtu.be/vXLoBY6oPv8\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Watch the full episode here!</a></p>\n<p>You can find previous episodes of Thoughts and Coffee over on the <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/thoughts-and-coffee/\">live show</a> page, or you can check out other Let’s Talk Supply Chain podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    ],

  {
    "uuid": "c87a7ee0-915f-4a55-a224-56db65fbc367",
    "episode_number": 268,
    "post_id": 13554,
    "title": "268: Unstuck Yourself from Spreadsheets: Driving Collaboration and Productivity – Level Up with Quickbase",
    "slug": "episode268",
    "date": "2022-05-26T04:00:15",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23232485/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-project-management.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23232485\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />This is the fourth and final episode of our mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Quickbase</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode266/\">Episode 3</a>, “Connect,” I was joined by Jacob MacIntrye to explore the complex world of construction; the challenges of keeping projects on time and budget, amidst supply chain and labor disruption; the importance of building stakeholder trust; and exactly how Quickbase can equip your team with real-time information to streamline processes, ensure compliance and improve communication.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, “Level Up,” I’m joined for the second time this series by Peter Rifken. We’ll be discussing the ins and outs of complex project management; explaining how you can level up information to leadership, so you can make the best decisions for your operations; and exactly how Quickbase can help.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[01.54] The landscape of project management in a post-COVID environment: how companies are working, and how a focus on this area can help businesses to thrive in this period of recovery.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You’re seeing a lot of new technology in the project management space… but a lot of the themes are still the same. You’re still going to find people working in silos, with whatever tool they’re working in – and, a lot of the times, in tools that aren’t customized for their workflows.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.58] The increasing complexity in project management, and some of the main challenges involved in trying to keep quickly moving parts on track.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“A lot of the challenges with project management is bringing all of those pieces together, and making sure that all your business partners can collaborate around that same information.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.52] Supplier diversity – why you need to make it a project in itself, and how to manage complexity and adjust processes to set yourself up for success.</p>\n<p>[11.13] Why visibility means different things to different people, and how businesses can make that visibility meaningful and actionable.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Visibility always starts with a conversation of ‘who are my stakeholders?’ and that visibility will be different depending on where in the business you’re having that conversation.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.33] A closer look at Quickbase’s Project Management Software, what it does and how it helps to address key industry challenges.</p>\n<p>[16.40] The importance of customizable solutions in helping to level up a business’s project management success.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When you don’t customize, it means you’re now conforming to a process that was defined for you, with some assumptions&#8230; Any time you make somebody change how they work to match how your tool works, you’re adding an inefficiency.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.04] Leadership priorities, and how visibility and integration within project management can help them make better strategic decisions.</p>\n<p>[25.08] The challenges of labor allocation during project planning, and how Quickbases’s solution can help businesses to address the wider staffing challenges happening in the industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I can’t tell you the amount of people I’ve spoken with that actually quit jobs because their leadership didn’t invest in modern technology – especially with younger generations coming out of school, it’s just an expectation.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.35] The growing importance of material management.</p>\n<p>[30.52] A look at how Quickbase works with construction brands to help build trusted connections and systems to bring all stakeholders successfully together.</p>\n<p>[34.39] What the future holds for project management, and for Quickbase.</p>\n<p>[36.25] Peter’s key takeaways from today’s discussion.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Quickbase’s <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Quickbase and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a> and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a>.</p>\n<p>If you missed them, why not check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode261/\">episode 1</a>, featuring Peter Rifken, and <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode263/\">episode 2</a>, featuring Alex Pederson, of our Quickbase mini-series.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/lets-talk-supply-chain/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

libsyn_item_id=\"23144924\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by Mark Raffan, serial entrepreneur, procurement veteran and expert in negotiation, influence, and persuasion.</p>\n<p>He’s the founder of <a href=\"https://www.negotiations.ninja/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" negotiation, sales, and procurement thought leaders and shares the tools, strategies and tactics you need to succeed.</p>\n<p>Today Mark joins me to chat all about Negotiations Ninja: what they do;   {
    "uuid": "cf8b9de0-3214-46a3-9d33-d16770771502",
    "episode_number": 266,
    "post_id": 13552,
    "title": "266: Unstuck Yourself from Spreadsheets: Driving Collaboration and Productivity – Connect with Quickbase",
    "slug": "episode266",
    "date": "2022-05-19T04:00:06",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23144747/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/construction.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23144747\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />This is the third episode of our mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Quickbase</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode263/\">Episode 2</a>, “Control,” I was joined by Alex Pederson to talk all about the solar industry. We discussed the increasing importance of generating renewable energy sources; the challenges of ensuring efficiency and connectivity, whilst meeting high demand; the power of low-code development in complex industries; and exactly how Quickbase can centralize scattered workflows to help scale your operations quickly, safely and securely.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 3, “Connect,” I’m joined by Jacob MacIntrye to explore the complex world of construction; the challenges of keeping projects on time and budget, amidst supply chain and labor disruption; the importance of building stakeholder trust; and exactly how Quickbase can equip your team with real-time information to streamline processes, ensure compliance and improve communication.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[02.05] An introduction to Jacob, his background and experience in the construction industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“With that job comes a lot of software… whether you like it or not – and a lot of folks don’t like it!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.24] How Jacob discovered Quickbase, why he decided to join them, and his passion for combining his industry experience with Quickbase technology to help others.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Difficulties in the supply chain come down to difficulties in the communication – when you want to track pipe, what you’re really wanting to do is track the information and communication between the parties.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.56] From supply of materials to rising costs, a closer look at the challenges the construction industry is facing right now.</p>\n<p>[12.20] The impact of fines and compliance violations, and Jacob’s thoughts on how the industry could start to better predict project delays.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The planners need better tools: a lot of times you’ll find them just tracking things in spreadsheets. They’ve got their major systems but the only other thing they have are spreadsheets, so there’s nothing in the middle to give that robust connection.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.10] A closer look at Quickbase’s Construction Management Software, what it does and how it helps to address key industry challenges.</p>\n<p>[19.47] The types of customer that Quickbase works with.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’ve been around a long time, so we have owner-operators that have 10 employees, and we work with half of the fortune 100 &#8211; we have a huge range of customers that need that flexible middle.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.41] The complexity of documentation and data management, and how Quickbase achieves the balance of being flexible, but also robust enough to house and manage complex, ever-changing data in a secure and easy to use way.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When people get nervous about where their data goes, I always remind them ‘well, it’s all going into Excel right now!’ … People are taking data out of their ERP, dumping it into Excel and sharing it with people – that’s not secure or governed in any way, but people seem to overlook that!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.11] Quickbase’s approach to trust and collaboration, and the importance of building long-term relationships.</p>\n<p>[27.41] A customer case study detailing how Quickbase software was able to connect multiple stakeholders to achieve project success.</p>\n<p>[30.46] The next steps for working with Quickbase, or giving their software a try.</p>\n<p>[31.57] Jacob’s thoughts on where he sees the most challenge and opportunity in the future, as the construction industry continues to grow.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The planning and sourcing of materials is only going to get more difficult – the pandemic gave us a window into how interconnected our world is and the big challenges there aren’t over.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.30] Jacob’s key takeaway when it comes to the importance of connecting people, workflows and materials when it comes to project success.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Quickbase’s <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Quickbase and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a> and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a>.</p>\n<p>If you missed it, check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode261/\">episode 1</a> of our Quickbase mini-series, in which Peter Rifkin takes a closer look at people: the workers on the front line of the industry right now; the challenges; the opportunities; and exactly how Quickbase can optimize and automate to connect people and workflow together.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/lets-talk-supply-chain/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "bcc0d57e-08d3-4861-8188-bc7b43f758e0",
    "episode_number": 265,
    "post_id": 13527,
    "title": "265: Blended – DEI in the Workplace – Not Just The Smart Thing To Do, But The Right Thing To Do",
    "slug": "episode265",
    "date": "2022-05-18T04:00:45",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23141996/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/dei-in-the-workplace.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23141996\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />It’s episode 20 of Blended: I’m joined by another fantastic panel of guests and we’re talking about the business benefits of DEI. Previously on the show, we’ve talked to underrepresented groups and specific communities – whether it be women, people of color, trans folks – and, as part of our discussions, we’ve heard them passionately share their stories and illustrate why, of course, they’re such an integral part of successful teams. So we thought it was time to really put a focus on that and dedicate a whole show to the importance of embracing DEI in your business.</p>\n<p>Today, our guests will be exploring what DEI means to them; sharing their own personal experiences; reflecting on issues such as creating safe spaces, ongoing education and authenticity; and discussing the importance of supplier diversity.</p>\n<h2></h2>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[00.49] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“DEI encompasses the relationship, philosophy and culture of acknowledging, embracing, supporting and accepting those of all racial, sexual, gender, religious and socio-economic backgrounds (among other differentiators).” Gennifer</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Shay – Senior Event Manager at S&amp;P Global</li>\n<li>Asheley – Director of Customer Success at Flowspace</li>\n<li>Gennifer – Founder/Executive Director at TransNewYork</li>\n<li>Amani – Director Of Operations at Malao Logistics</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[06.41] The group discusses DEI: what it means; why it’s important; the challenges; and real-life examples of who’s doing it right and who’s doing it wrong.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Companies that adapt their strategies and their policies around the different groups of people they have working in their organization and don’t treat it just like a blanket initiative, and really get down into the details of who their people are and what challenges they face&#8230; that’s when you can really look at whether your environment is inclusive or not.” Shay</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Creating the right environment and culture</li>\n<li>Accepting people for who they are</li>\n<li>Representation</li>\n<li>Burden of tokenism</li>\n<li>Impact of Gen Z</li>\n<li>Education and training</li>\n<li>Budgets and investment</li>\n<li>Advocacy and mentorship</li>\n<li>Creating safe spaces</li>\n<li>Celebrating awareness days and months, and finding the right balance</li>\n<li>Intention and authenticity</li>\n<li>Consistency</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not about just the [awareness] month – because I’m going to be black every single day, not just in February!” Asheley</p></blockquote>\n<p>[01.10.21] The panel takes a closer look at both the obstacles and benefits of supplier diversity.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Increasing customer demand for diversity</li>\n<li>Barriers for small businesses, eg extended payment terms, expensive tables at events etc</li>\n<li>Making it equitable</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[01.20.19] The group sum-up their learnings from today’s discussion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a way of living, it’s a collective thing. If I want people to know my culture, I also need to show my culture… if I know my team isn’t super aware, it’s also my job to educate.” Amani</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/shay-abrahams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Shay</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/asheley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Asheley</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dr-gennifer-herley-phd-8aa954b6/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Gennifer</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/amani-radman-74253684/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Amani</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>If you found this episode interesting, you might enjoy <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/147-blended-episode-1-whats-in-a-word/\">Episode 1,What’s In A Word</a> or <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode194/\">Episode 7, Equality vs Diversity: What’s The Difference?</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23107997/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-students.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23107997\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />We are absolutely loving showcasing our incredible range of live shows! Last month, in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode257/\">episode 257</a>, we put the spotlight on Action Items with Dyci Sfregola. Last week in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode262/\">episode 262</a>, it was Mercado’s turn with their show, First Things First. And, today, we’re bringing you Coming In Hot, with Abby Baird.</p>\n<p>The industry is always changing, so what’s in store for the next generation of supply chain professionals? Supply chain management student, Abby, brings her passion and enthusiasm for the future of supply chain every fourth Thursday at 12.30pm EST.</p>\n<p>In this episode, Abby is joined by special guest Lydia O&#8217;Neal, supply chain and logistics reporter at The Wall Street Journal, to talk all about the memefication of supply chain; how supply chain management is being shared; and the popularization of the industry.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.43] An introduction to special guest Lydia O&#8217;Neal, her background and how she transitioned to reporting on supply chain.</p>\n<p>[10.20] How Lydia came to write <em>Sorry, the Global Supply Chain Ate My Homework</em>, and her thoughts on the memefication of supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’ve heard, anecdotally, that professors are seeing more interest from younger students, even in high school!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.23] How the memeifcation of supply chain, and the increase in supply chain content on social media, has impacted people and businesses.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Another effect of this has been the visibility of all the people, the workers in the warehouses, the truckers and on cargo ships, because it’s previously been this invisible magic of your stuff getting to your door.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.36] Lydia’s reflections on whether the newfound popularity of supply chain in social media is actually helping to teach people what supply chain really is.</p>\n<p>[18.09] The value to be found in greater supply chain exposure and increased knowledge.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s great to bring in a more diverse workforce, in management especially – I hear over and over again that this is the domain of old white guys… so to go on <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@letstalksupplychain?is_from_webapp=1&amp;sender_device=pc\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">TikTok</a> and find young women explaining it… it’s great!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.12] How fresh supply chain content is moving away from jargon and a business-heavy approach towards making the topic fun and engaging.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The over-arching goal was to make it fun!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.29] How new supply chain content is reaching such a broad audience.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s exploded and people have appropriated it into their own jokes.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.42] The opportunity for businesses to use the memefication of supply chain to their advantage, particularly when it comes to customer expectation and experience.</p>\n<p>[29.41] Lydia’s thoughts on whether increased memeification impacts supply chain professionals in their day-to-day roles.</p>\n<p>[31.39] What Lydia has learned, what excites her about supply chain and her future.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/abigailbaird/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Abby</a> or <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lydia-o-neal-15272771/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Lydia</a> over on LinkedIn, or check out Lydia&#8217;s article, <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/sorry-the-global-supply-chain-ate-my-homework-11643797810\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Sorry, the Global Supply Chain Ate My Homework</a>.</p>\n<p>You can find previous episodes of Coming In Hot with Abby Baird over on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gOpx3Z9Is5o&amp;list=PLFKDRuq7tnIqredC0nVay1VFKRi-rlNeh\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">YouTub</a>e, on our <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/coming-in-hot/\">live show</a> page, or you can check out other Let’s Talk Supply Chain podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23082782/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-software-solutions.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23082782\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />This is the second episode of our mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Quickbase</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode261/\">Episode 1</a>,  I was joined by Peter Rifken to take a closer look at people. We talked about the workers on the front line of the industry right now, the challenges, the opportunities, and exactly how Quickbase can optimize and automate to connect people and workflow together.</p>\n<p>Today,  I’m joined by Alex Pederson to talk all about the solar industry. We’ll be discussing the increasing importance of generating renewable energy sources, the challenges of ensuring efficiency and connectivity, while meeting high demand, the power of low-code development in complex industries, and exactly how Quickbase can centralize scattered workflows to help scale your operations quickly, safely and securely.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[01.46] An introduction to Alex, his background and role at Quickbase.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I ran into Quickbase… and it blew my mind – how customizable it was, how flexible the platform was and what you could do with it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.05] A snapshot of the main challenges facing the solar industry right now.</p>\n<p>[05.23] The huge range of stakeholders involved in solar projects, how they have typically been connecting and the positive impact of collaboration and bridging those gaps.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Most of the time, customers are emailing an Excel doc back and forth, or even shooting text messages.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.24] The popularity of Excel, and how we get people out of spreadsheets.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you’re using Excel, you’re going to absolutely love using Quickbase – it’s a very easy transition over and… you now have that ability to customize roles and permissions, governance, dashboards… everything that’s important for you and your role.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.03] A closer look at Quickbase’s Solar Management Software, how the solution can benefit solar brands, and address their key challenges.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Wherever there are gaps in your current process, that’s where Quickbase can fit in and be that agility layer.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.09] Keeping on top of the moving parts in complex solar projects.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It really comes down to making sure you have the correct data&#8230; then you’re able to start to see trends and make predictions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.00] How to better predict project delays, amidst industry-wide disruption, and improve communication.</p>\n<p>[18.05] The importance of control and custom solutions when it comes to efficiency and scaling at speed.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you think about needing a software that fits for your project, or fitting your projects in to a software, there’s a difference between the two.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.00] How Quickbase software has helped customers save weeks on their installation times, and what we can learn from other countries, like Africa, that are running successful solar programs.</p>\n<p>[21.15] The sustainability trends to look out for, and the future of solar technology.</p>\n<p>[22.42]  Alex’s key takeaway around the importance of control when it comes to efficiency, productivity and simplifying complex processes.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Quickbase’s <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alex-pederson-3890968b/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">connect with Alex</a> and Quickbase in order to keep up to date with the latest. Head to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a> or <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/lets-talk-supply-chain/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "262: We Need To Talk About The First Mile",
    "slug": "episode262",
    "date": "2022-05-09T04:00:15",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23044841/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-strategy.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23044841\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today we’re featuring one of our amazing live shows on Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™. Last month in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode257/\">episode 257</a>, we put the spotlight on Action Items with Dyci Sfregola and now it’s the turn of First Things First with Mercado!</p>\n<p>We live in a consumer driven world. $2.5T worth of products are imported annually, representing 15% of U.S. GDP. It’s time companies become fully connected to the people who make and move our products, and look for ways to improve the way we plan, buy, and move them around the world. Join Mercado CEO Rob Garrison and special guests every second Tuesday of the month at 12pm ET as they explore the future of the supply chain in 2022 and beyond.</p>\n<p>And this episode is all about the first, and last, mile.</p>\n<p>Rob is joined by special guest Edward Hertzman, Executive Vice President at Fairchild Media and Founder and President of Sourcing Journal, to talk all about ensuring you have a first mile strategy; the growing importance of traceability; building more equal supplier relationships; and the evolution of the modern first mile industry.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<p>[06.16] The “fastest five” – from carrier profits to a furniture brand building its own vessel, Rob takes a look at five standout industry headlines.</p>\n<p>[11.59] An introduction to special guest Edward Hertzman, his background and how he came to found Sourcing Journal.</p>\n<p>[14.57] Rob and Edward discuss how, and why, the final mile has evolved so quickly, whilst the first mile has remained arguably static; Amazon’s role in these changes; the importance of an integrated strategy; and the impact of COVID .</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When you talk about the last mile, Amazon has completely changed the game… they made that part of the shopping experience.”</p>\n<p>“We can no longer take our upstream, first mile relationships for granted and we need a strategy – it’s not one or the other, it’s the first mile, middle mile and last mile.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.33] A closer look at sourcing, tier two and three suppliers and the importance of traceability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We have a regulatory responsibility to make sure we know where our products are being made.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.37] Edward’s thoughts on whether the first mile is an opportunity for businesses to do some good, and better tackle their commitments to people and planet.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We need to think about how we can share risk – it can’t just be that the retailers win and the factories lose.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.57] Rob’s reflections on the ‘modern first mile industry.’</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re due for the next evolution of this industry.”</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Mercado’s <a href=\"https://mercadolabs.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you. You can also connect with Mercado and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/mercadolabs/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/robertwgarrison/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Rob</a>.</p>\n<p>Discover trending industry news over on Sourcing Journal’s <a href=\"https://sourcingjournal.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a>, or connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/edward-hertzman-2401b38/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Edward</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>You can find previous episodes of First Things First with Mercado over on the <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/first-things-first/\">live show</a> page, or you can check out other Let’s Talk Supply Chain podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode261",

    "video_id": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/23009363/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-process.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"23009363\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />This is the first episode in our brand new four-part mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Quickbase</a>.</p>\n<p>Quickbase helps customers see, connect and control complex projects that reshape our world. Whether it’s raising a skyscraper or coordinating vaccine rollouts, the no-code software platform allows business users to custom-fit solutions to the way they work – using information from across the systems they already have.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, See, we’ll be taking a closer look at people: the workers on the front line of the industry right now; the challenges; the opportunities; and exactly how Quickbase can optimize and automate to connect people and workflow together.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[02.01] A reminder of who Quickbase are and what they do; and an update on what’s changed since they were last on the show.</p>\n<p>[04.01] From labor shortages to staff retention, the main challenges that businesses are facing when it comes to front-line workers, and how those challenges have changed from just a couple of years ago.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Frontline workers are having challenges, and the folks that are trying to hire, retain, train and continuously upskill those workers are also having a huge challenge… COVID has put a huge spotlight on the need to improve some of the processes that are touching turnover.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.51] Compliance, how job site safety has changed dramatically since COVID, and the key priorities in the area right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“COVID has thrown a shocker at all of us and said ‘hey, you need to be able to adapt to rules, regulations and requirements that never existed’ – and you may not have a tool to track these 10 new requirements, or capture the information you didn’t capture before.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.14] Connectivity, and why it’s so important to change the way we think about data in order to get our teams out of Excel.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“People will always gravitate towards the path of least resistance to solve their problems.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.50] A closer look at the Quickbase software, and how it’s designed with front-line workers in mind.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;The challenge we see most often is that no team is exactly like the last one… they really need a combination of technology that is safe, secure and robust, but can then be moulded like Play Doh for the front line environment, that allows for both starting fast, and then scaling.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.45] Peter’s reflections around automation, how to get the most out of it, and how that works with Quickbase.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s dangerous to want to jump full steam ahead into automation… it needs to be coupled with strategy.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.31] Process improvement, and how you can achieve a healthy full circle model built around Quickbase.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Momentum is what starts to change culture.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.22] The impact on your business and bottom line when you successfully pull the threads of good data, transparency, collaboration and process improvement together.</p>\n<p>[32.44] A case study looking at how Quickbase helped a key customer to bridge systems and achieve connectivity and visibility, without impacting legacy systems.</p>\n<p>[36.17] What businesses need to consider and prioritize when it comes to people, and the changes we can expect to see from Quickbase in the future.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“As a business, are you stepping back to reassess how work can be done in a post COVID time?”</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Quickbase’s <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Quickbase and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/quickbase/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a> and <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/c/quickbase\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a>.</p>\n<p>If you want to dive deeper into what Quickbase is all about, why not listen to <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode224/\">episode 224</a>, where Peter Rifken, Principal Solutions Consultant at Quickbase, chats all about the company: what they do; the importance of operational agility; and the power to be found in unlocking the potential of your people. You can also read Peter&#8217;s <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/how-to-eliminate-disconnected-teams-and-increase-supply-chain-visibility/\">blog</a>, where he talks about how to eliminate disconnected teams and increase supply chain visibility.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/lets-talk-supply-chain/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
