  {
    "uuid": "6d7575be-ec31-4d33-ae2f-69caebf04995",
    "episode_number": 260,
    "post_id": 13024,
    "title": "260: Women In Supply Chain™, Maggie Petrovic",
    "slug": "episode260",
    "date": "2022-05-02T04:00:20",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22962995/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/women-in-business.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22962995\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by experienced and strategic logistics operations professional, Maggie Petrovic.</p>\n<p>A business and communications graduate, Maggie honed her skills at global third-party logistics provider Coyote Logistics, gaining deep knowledge and experience across operations, sales, strategy and customer experience. As a leader at Emerge, she’s helping to save shippers time and money by operationalizing game-changing products.</p>\n<p>Today Maggie will be talking to us about her career so far; her talent for operations strategy; the excitement of start-up culture; and Mom guilt. Plus, she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, as well as her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h1>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://emergemarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Emerge</a>. As a company focused on empowering and growing meaningful supply chain relationships, Emerge is proud to sponsor Women In Supply Chain™. Through its freight procurement platform, Emerge offers solutions that enhance the spot and contract procurement process, enabling shippers and carriers to make more strategic decisions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h1>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.24] Maggie’s background, her field hockey college scholarship, and her reflections on how a sporting mindset correlates so well with business, and supply chain.</p>\n<p>[14.02] How Maggie went from a Business and Communications degree to a successful career in supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It sounded interesting… it was an industry that was growing after the recession and not shrinking… I got an offer from Coyote Logistics, and never looked back!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.32] Maggie’s time at Coyote Logistics, learning on the job, and the experience she gained from having a ‘just say yes’ mentality.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When I think about the roles and opportunities that stick out, it was really just me saying yes to anything and everything that was going to give me an opportunity to learn more and put me out of my comfort zone.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.28] Maggie’s experience of living and working in Europe, and what she learned.</p>\n<p>[21.15] Maggie’s role as Vice President of Strategic Initiatives at Emerge.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I truly believe that what we’re doing at Emerge is game changing – we’re building products that the industry really needs”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.12] The impact of COVID on procurement, and the resulting trends and learnings.</p>\n<p>[24.02] Maggie’s experience of Mom guilt, and how she balances work and motherhood.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I certainly had Mom guilt going back to work after maternity leave. I thought: ‘my baby is so small, how can I leave her all day’? and that was so hard.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.39] Why Maggie loves the culture and benefits that come from working in a start-up, and her experiences, as a woman, of working in those environments.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Start-ups can be extremely lucrative and awesome opportunities for everyone. At a start-up, you have better access to having a seat at the table, having your voice heard and ideas implemented.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.30] How saying yes and trying something new in business helped Maggie to find her voice and grow in confidence.</p>\n<p>[31.35] Maggie’s work ethic, the difference between advocates and mentors and why it’s important to have both.</p>\n<p>[34.16] What the future holds for Maggie, and for Emerge.</p>\n<p>[34.53] Maggie’s words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h1><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h1>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with Maggie over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/maggie-petrovic-81500926/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>If you enjoyed finding out more about female leaders at Emerge, why not check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode255/\">episode 255</a>, where I&#8217;m joined by Mardi Tegmeyer, Customer Success Manager at Emerge. And if you&#8217;re interested in hearing more about balancing motherhood with a successful career &#8211; and why we need to talk about it &#8211; head over to <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode234/\">episode 234</a> to hear what Anne Robinson has to say.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22880921/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/logistics-software.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22880921\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://prompt.global/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Prompt</a>, a customer-focused logistics software business who are on a mission to unlock your digitization and automation potential – to drive cost savings and revenue improvements – without changing your underlying software platforms.</p>\n<p>Prompt helps supply chain companies to easily expand the functionality of their Transportation Management Systems without changing or replacing any of their existing software. As the only logistics technology company with all the major global data privacy and security certifications, Prompt work with more than a third of the top 25 freight forwarders, providing visibility, automation, and payment processing solutions that all safely and seamlessly connect back to their system, or systems, of choice.</p>\n<p>Today Kai Timmermann, Chief Operating Officer at Prompt, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the biggest challenges in logistics today; putting customers at the core of their solutions; and the importance of visibility and data integration to the future of logistics.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.06] Prompt’s origin story, and how Rob and Kai’s background with Lading and CargoWise led them to develop this new software-based brand.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re about orienting for real outcomes – we’re not excited by jargon… we just want to get the job done.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.38] An overview of Prompt – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For users, we’re about moving time and attention… and from a management perspective, they benefit from that users time and attention, but now they also have process consistency.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.12] From managing talent to process inefficiency, a look at some of the key challenges Prompt’s customers are facing right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“To win the talent war – which is a big deal these days – you want to get people out of that menial work.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.49] A  closer look at Prompt’s Automation solution: what it does, how can it help, the benefits – and Kai’s thoughts on the rising importance of automation within supply chain technology.</p>\n<p>[19.09] What visibility means to Prompt, and how their business intelligence solutions can help to address core inefficiencies.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There are a million people doing it, and visibility can be used to describe a huge span of things… when we talk about our Prompt visibility tool, it’s about better data and access to the information inside a company’s ERP.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.02] Prompt’s two-sided integration, how it helps to facilitate improved visibility, and how they work to expand a company’s TMS without impacting their existing software.</p>\n<p>[25.54] A closer look at Prompt’s evolving Payments solution.</p>\n<p>[26.46] Kai’s reflections on why we should be paying so much attention to issues like visibility and data integration; the difference it’s going to make, both on a business and on an industry level; and Kai’s predictions for when global logistics is finally going to return to normal.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Logistics technology has gotten so fragmented… our customers have invested heavily in freight management systems and they’ve got a strategic imperative to close the gap with digital freight forwarders – so we’re trying to provide the capabilities to close that gap.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.44] Why successful implementation is on an equal footing to the technology itself, and why customers are so important to Prompt.</p>\n<p>[32.01] The ideal client for Prompt.</p>\n<p>[32.53] Two key case studies, illustrating how Prompt Automate helped one customer to reduce a proposed integration time of five months down to three to four weeks, and another customer benefit from financial savings of around 40%, on average.</p>\n<p>[35.41] The future for Prompt.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Prompt&#8217;s <a href=\"https://prompt.global/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Prompt and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/promptglobal/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Kai on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kai-timmermann-9ab1/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "978fceb4-c903-410f-bcf2-7816a66b8580",

    "post_id": 12843,
    "title": "258: Blended &#8211;  I Said No: Managing Sexual Harassment In The Workplace",
    "slug": "episode258",
    "date": "2022-04-20T04:00:20",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22846025/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/support-in-the-workplace.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22846025\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />\n<p>It’s episode 19 of Blended: I’m joined by another amazing panel of guests and we’re talking about sexual harassment. It’s another tough subject because the reality is, so many people, particularly women, have a story. And we need to tell those stories if we’re going to expose just how prevalent this problem is.</p>\n<p>Today, our guests will be discussing exactly what sexual harassment means and where and when it happens; sharing their own personal experiences; reflecting on the differences between harassment and assault; and the panel will be sharing their advice for tackling the issue and creating safer workplaces.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[01.37] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Young adults and children need to learn about boundaries: what they mean, how to uphold them and how to resolve a conflict around them.” Christina</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Kristy – President and Owner at Knichel Logistics</li>\n<li>Carl – CEO at Carl Shawn Watkins Consulting, LLC</li>\n<li>Christina – Writer</li>\n<li>Charlene – Website Architect &amp; Full-Stack Web Developer</li>\n<li>Nathalie – Customer Success Manager of Enterprise Partnerships at Calm</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s been a clash of generational understanding and generational behaviour.”  Charlene</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.15] The group discuss the basics around sexual harassment: what it means, where and how it can happen, the behaviors it can include and the difference between sexual harassment and sexual assault.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not about sexual desire… it’s the power that&#8217;s yielded through that harassment.” Carl</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Mindset and intent</li>\n<li>Language matters</li>\n<li>Generational clash</li>\n<li>Mocking or discrimination around a person’s sexuality</li>\n<li>Gender stereotypes</li>\n<li>Power plays</li>\n<li>The danger of anonymity online</li>\n<li>Blurred lines between the workplace and online/social media</li>\n<li>Move from acceptable to accessible</li>\n<li>Confrontation and boundaries</li>\n<li>Remote working inviting harassment into your home / violating a safe space</li>\n<li>(Men’s) sense of entitlement</li>\n<li>Men choosing not to put themselves in a compromised position</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“When you think about what predated ideas about what sexual harassment would be defined as, it also came with these predisposed character traits. “ Nathalie</p></blockquote>\n<p>[55.14] The panel share their own personal experiences of sexual harassment, and the impact of those experiences.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s the translation from that Mad Men era where everything was pictured as acceptable to now where everything is accessible… now the attitude has met the opportunity.” Carl</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Carl’s experience of child molestation by an uncle; how he used imagination, creativity and learning as a release; and the alcoholism and suicidal ideations that followed, before he translated that pain to power</li>\n<li>Kristy’s experience of dropping out of college because of an attempted sexual assault, of inappropriate behavior by a client and multiple sexual advances at an industry event</li>\n<li>The lasting impact of abuse and how it links to how you identify as a person</li>\n<li>Nathalie’s experience of subtle and manipulative harassment in the workplace</li>\n<li>Allyship and advocacy</li>\n<li>The importance of documenting incidents</li>\n<li>Christina’s experience of a group sexual assault as a teenager, sexual harassment in multiple workplaces and how a man, who she believed to be a good friend, offered to be her sugar daddy</li>\n<li>Triggering behaviors and re-traumatisation for victims</li>\n<li>Charlene’s experience of receiving unwanted messages and intimate photographs</li>\n<li>Leadership obstacles</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“As soon as my relationship status changed, I became a target for that sense of entitlement.” Christina</p></blockquote>\n<p>[01.29.54] The group share their suggestions for solutions and sum-up their learnings from today’s discussion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Know your company’s policy in the workplace, and don’t be afraid to speak.” Kristy</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristyknichel/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Kristy</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/carlswatkins1/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Carl</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/christina-heldwein/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Christina</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/charlenevbrown/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Charlene</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/nathalie-mathis-b8944573/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Nathalie</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>If you found this epsiode interetsing, you might enjoy <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode165/\">Episode 3, The Gender Equation</a> or <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode252/\">Episode 18, The Reality of Workplace Discrimination</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "1206731f-b7f0-4299-801b-58cf0a78bf6e",
    "episode_number": 257,
    "post_id": 12841,
    "title": "257: Creating Supply Chain Stability with Dual Sourcing and S&#038;OP",
    "slug": "episode257",
    "date": "2022-04-18T04:00:06",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22821428/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/sales-and-operation-planning.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22821428\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today we’re shaking things up and, instead of our usual guest interview, we’re featuring one of our fantastic new live shows on Let’s Talk Supply Chain – Action Items with Dyci Sfregola.</p>\n<p>Each month Dyci, CEO of <a href=\"https://newgenarchitects.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">New Gen Architects</a>, is joined by a special guest to discuss key issues in the post-COVID supply chain; actionable steps businesses can take to prepare for scalability; and how to leverage supply chain technology and process redesign to upskill or reskill teams to provide meaningful, purposeful work for their employees while improving the bottom line.</p>\n<p>And this episode is all about stability and supply chain – two words that we don&#8217;t see together very often! But Dyci has a few key action items up her sleeve to do just that – to ensure supply stability to support demand plan. Dyci is joined by special guest Atia Yarbrough, Director of Demand and Supply Planning at Mason Dixie Foods, to talk all about sales and operations planning, the importance of dual sourcing, how to reduce uncertainty, start-up funding, customer relationships and more.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[08.21] Atia’s journey to Mason Dixie Foods.</p>\n<p>[10.41] Atia’s experience of S&amp;OP’s in large enterprises, and how that compares to Dyci&#8217;s experience of small businesses.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We have a very cross functional process where we have supply chain, planning, sales and finance engaged and we’re working monthly… if you’re looking at it from a yearly standpoint, you’re a little too late.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.20] How Mason Dixie established a robust S&amp;OP process as a small business, and Atia’s advice on how others can get started.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“First you have to have people on board – change is hard, process change is <em>extremely</em> hard.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.07] An idea of the time and allocation of resources required when fulfilling a successful S&amp;OP process.</p>\n<p>[21.21] Some of the key technologies used in sales and operations planning.</p>\n<p>[23.46] The importance of dual sourcing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Customers want what they want, when they want it.. so dual sourcing is an integral part of the S&amp;OP process.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.51] Audience question: <em>any tips on how to measure ESG impacts in the S&amp;OP process?</em></p>\n<p>[28.58] Finding the right partners.</p>\n<p>[33.25] Translating your sales and operations planning into weekly or daily S&amp;OE’s, and determining the key KPI’s to measure that execution.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can have that S&amp;OP process, but you really have to have that actionable plan to show a result every day – whether it’s a good result, or a bad one.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.10] How external partners are a part of the S&amp;OP process, and how to extract and utilize their data.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Really organizing the data, and everybody owning their part to bring the model together, I think that’s key – because you don’t want death by Excel!</p></blockquote>\n<p>[41.53] Accountability, leadership and culture.</p>\n<p>[45.20] This month’s Action Item – <em>questions to ask yourself to understand if you’re running a true S&amp;OP process.</em></p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can find previous episodes of Action Items with Dyci Sfregola over on the <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/action-items/\">live show</a> page, or you can check out other Let’s Talk Supply Chain podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>You can find out more about Atia over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/atiayarbrough/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "0e91d794-fdb7-48fc-88a9-5ba59b9224d3",

    "post_id": 12792,
    "title": "256: Find The Perfect Employees For The Long Run, with WorkStep",
    "slug": "episode256",
    "date": "2022-04-11T16:45:21",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22730618/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/recruiting-talent-in-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22730618\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined <a href=\"https://www.workstep.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">WorkStep</a>, a people-focused provider of hiring and retention technology for supply chain teams.</p>\n<p>WorkStep is the market-leading provider of Frontline Workforce Retention solutions, purpose-built for the modern supply chain. With customers including manufacturing, warehousing, retail distribution, and transportation employers across North America, WorkStep solutions provide HR, operations, finance, and c-suite executives with what they need to hire frontline workers, engage them throughout their employment journey, and seamlessly act on critical insights to drive organizational change and ultimately reduce turnover.</p>\n<p>Today Dan Johnston, Co-founder &amp; CEO at WorkStep, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the ins and outs of hiring and retention; the truth behind the current ‘talent shortages’; and the upcoming workforce trends to look out for.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.03] Dan’s founder story, and how his experience as an ‘Entrepreneur in Residence’ gave him the time to reflect on his previous role as a warehouse manager and how he could innovate to solve some of the problems he saw there.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’d seen just how detrimental the temp staffing model was… just how challenging a constant rotating door of frontline workforce turnover was to every level of an operation.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.47] How Dan’s previous education technology businesses led him to found a business in supply chain staffing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When we started WorkStep, we thought of this as really a matching problem – supply and demand. And what we realized over time, is that it’s much more than that. It’s more than just matching an available worker to an available job.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.16] An overview of WorkStep – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<p>[17.04] From talent shortages to new ways of working, a look at some of the key challenges happening in staffing right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“A lot has changed in the last two years, but actually a lot of these trends were already underway.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.57] WorkStep’s employer solution for hiring new staff – how it works, the benefits and the power of data and automation.</p>\n<p>[22.37] WorkStep’s employer solution for staff retention, why retention is so important and the huge impact it has on both a company’s top and bottom lines.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re talking about hundreds of millions of dollars in turnover spend that these large logistics and manufacturing companies are incurring every year – so this is a very important bottom line problem.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.14] Why WorkStep is the best solution for job seekers.</p>\n<p>[29.22] The importance of diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and how WorkStep’s solution can help aid your DEI strategy.</p>\n<p>[33.15] The ideal client for WorkStep.</p>\n<p>[35.41] A closer look at WorkStep’s competitive pricing model.</p>\n<p>[37.16] A case study, showing how WorkStep helped a 3PL achieve an 18% decrease in overall staff turnover, and a 36% decrease in new hire turnover, resulting in significant savings to the customer&#8217;s bottom line.</p>\n<p>[40.07] The future for WorkStep.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our goal is really to make the front line a better place to work… we help workers improve their jobs, so they can live a better life.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to WorkStep’s <a href=\"https://www.workstep.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with WorkStep and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/workstep/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Dan on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dan-johnston-8b109324/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "85ed3cbc-bff9-4036-9c00-e08f06ff1bf4",
    "episode_number": 255,
    "post_id": 12742,
    "title": "255: Women In Supply Chain™, Mardi Tegmeyer",
    "slug": "episode255",
    "date": "2022-04-04T04:00:46",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22652255/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/inspirational-female-leaders.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22652255\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Mardi Tegmeyer: a passionately customer-focused supply chain leader.</p>\n<p>An experienced logistics professional, Mardi’s knowledge and experience covers sales, operations, account management and customer success. As a leader at Emerge, she’s helping to reinvent freight procurement by putting customers firmly front and center.</p>\n<p>Today Mardi will be talking to us about her career so far; her passion for customer success; and the importance of collaboration and inclusion within supply chain. Plus, she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, as well as her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://emergemarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Emerge</a>. As a company focused on empowering and growing meaningful supply chain relationships, Emerge is proud to sponsor Women In Supply Chain™. Through its freight procurement platform, Emerge offers <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode243/\">solutions that enhance the spot and contract procurement process</a>, enabling shippers and carriers to <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/its-now-2022-are-consumers-growing-tired-of-supply-chain-shortages-and-rising-costs/\">make more strategic decisions</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.36] Mardi’s background, and the journey that led her to a career in supply chain and customer experience.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I was the receptionist to start… and then a month later, I was the customer service manager! And from that point, taking care of customers was my niche.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.06] Mardi’s experience at <a href=\"https://www.garrettpopcorn.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Garrett Popcorn</a>, her incredible accomplishments there and the power of learning on the job.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I was in a little over my head – I was figuring it out as I went, making relationships, building trust… It was an adventure!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.37] Mardi’s reflections on young people and supply chain, the balance between learning and experience and what <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/coming-in-hot/\">the next generation of supply chain professionals</a> bring to the table.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s no right or wrong way to solve challenges in this industry.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.07] Mardi’s role as Customer Success Manager at Emerge.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Every day is different &#8211; I do love that about this job &#8211; I can come in and solve different problems… and there’s lots of disruptions going on, especially now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.58] A closer look at Emerge’s supportive culture and approach to <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/diversity-and-inclusion-blended/\">diversity and inclusion</a>.</p>\n<p>[21.31] The importance of customer success, building strong relationships and how it differentiates you in the marketplace.</p>\n<p>[24.16] The role of collaboration, how it ties business together and impacts the overall success of customer experience.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Customers want to see that we’re, internally, collaborating and that their information isn’t getting lost in the shuffle.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.50] Mardi’s experiences as a woman in a largely male-dominated industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Ultimately, I think we teach people how to treat us – and I think hard work pays off.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.20] Mardi’s thoughts on mentorship and the college professor that helped to launch her journey.</p>\n<p>[30.50] What the future holds for Mardi.</p>\n<p>[31.39] Mardi’s words of advice for all of the women out there.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I would love to empower everyone, if I could, to have that big voice, to speak up – and don’t be worried about how you’re perceived as a result.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with Mardi over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mardi-tegmeyer-6aa96a67/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>If you want to find out more about Emerge, check out <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode243/\">episode 243</a>, where George Abernathy joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; bringing accountability to logistics; and why it’s so important to bring all industry players together to build positive and mutually beneficial networks.</p>\n<p>Why not also head over to Debra Phillips&#8217; (Marketing Manager at Emerge) <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/its-now-2022-are-consumers-growing-tired-of-supply-chain-shortages-and-rising-costs/\">blog</a> to hear her thoughts on whether consumers are finally growing tired of supply chain shortages and rising costs.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode254",
    "date": "2022-03-28T04:00:36",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22574462/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/outsourcing-in-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22574462\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"http://zenov-bpo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Zenov BPO</a>, a customer-centric and results-driven outsourcing business, who are laser-focused on solving their clients’ toughest challenges through their range of expert services.</p>\n<p>Zenov are dedicated to ensuring efficiency in their customers back office operations, and to delivering the best savings, by providing unmatched services in strategy, technology and operations. With expertise across industries and most business functions, they deliver transformational outcomes for a demanding new digital world.</p>\n<p>Today Joseph Wilson, Senior Director &amp; Partner at Zenov BPO, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the role of outsourcing in contemporary business; and the importance of a customer-focused approach.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.23] An overview of Zenov BPO – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“A lot of organizations hit that hump, where they can’t grow exponentially… so we’re saying ‘how can we help these organizations climb and reach their pinnacle?’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.29] From accounting to supply chain management, a closer look at Zenov’s range of services.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;A lot of companies are still working on Excel… so we take all that information and compile it into a dashboard so they can have the data to drive the business, to make decisions that are agile but also meet and exceed expectations.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.49] How Zenov work with their customers to build a bespoke support package that best addresses their challenges.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We take KPI’s… and get organizations to start thinking differently.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.49] How, and why, Zenov work as an extension of their customers internal teams.</p>\n<p>[18.28] The most common objections from potential customers when it comes to embracing outsourcing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“One of the biggest hesitations, prior to COVID, was ‘the back office is going to take my job!’ But we’re not taking your job, we’re supporting&#8230; allowing you to do the value add work.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.47] Zenov’s North American office and executive staff, why that’s important and the benefits it brings to their customer base.</p>\n<p>[25.48] The importance of a customer-focused approach and why it’s a growing trend.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We look to be an extension of their business… and if they’re not growing, and they’re going out of business, so are we. So we look at it as if it&#8217;s our own family-run business.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.09] The impact of COVID on the workplace and the unexpected positives.</p>\n<p>[29.02] The trend towards increased outsourcing, and the current challenges – and potential – within the talent pool.</p>\n<p>[32.59] The ideal customer for Zenov BPO.</p>\n<p>[34.23] A case study detailing how Zenov helped to improve response time and customer satisfaction for a key client, resulting in an increased profit margin of 30-40%.</p>\n<p>[37.35] The future for Zenov BPO.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Zenov BPO’s <a href=\"http://zenov-bpo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Zenov BPO and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/zenov-bpo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://mobile.twitter.com/ZenovBPO\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/zenovbpo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Instagram</a> or <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/zenovbpo1/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a>, or you can connect with Joseph on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/josephwilson360/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "a7cd73b7-e188-4e15-932a-a2ae3d2ef867",

    "post_id": 12629,
    "title": "253: Optimize and Automate Warehouse Operations, with Motion2AI",
    "slug": "episode253",
    "date": "2022-03-21T04:00:37",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22496798/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/artificial-intelligence-in-logistics.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22496798\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://motion2ai.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Motion2AI</a>, an exciting and innovative tech company offering machine-learned solutions for warehouse mobility operations, covering monitoring, dispatch, safety, and autonomy integration.</p>\n<p>Founded in 2018, Motion2AI is a fast-growing start-up providing intelligent solutions for warehouse efficiency and safety. It offers AI platforms for warehouse mobility fleets (such as forklifts, carts or robots) by providing services of safety, monitoring, optimization, and autonomy. And the ecosystem supports manned labor and robots seamlessly, providing practical and scalable solutions for warehouse operations.</p>\n<p>Today Byungsoo Kim, Founder &amp; CEO at Motion2AI, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the benefits to be found in harnessing the power of AI within operations; and the relationship between people and technology.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.00] Byungsoo’s background and how he came to found Motion2AI.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Not every warehouse is taking advantage of that new technology and I’m happy that, with Motion2AI, I can support that.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.00] Byungsoo’s experience as a start-up, and Motion2AI’s impressive growth in a short space of time.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s no secret… we have good technology, and we’re working with excellent customers!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.24] An overview of Motion2AI – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<p>[12.19] The three core challenges that Motion2AI customers are currently facing in their warehouses.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The size of these warehouses is a big challenge… so communicating and collaborating between those different units is a challenge, too.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.52] A closer look at the four core products that   {
    "uuid": "9f263f9a-b44e-441e-b1c7-ee72d3a57b7e",
    "episode_number": 252,
    "post_id": 12535,
    "title": "252: Blended &#8211; Hiding in Plain Sight: The Reality of Workplace Discrimination",
    "slug": "episode252",
    "date": "2022-03-16T04:00:46",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" title=\"Embed Player\" src=\"//play.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22461023/height/192/theme/modern/size/large/thumbnail/yes/custom-color/2c9d8f/time-start/00:00:00/hide-playlist/yes\" width=\"100%\" height=\"192\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>It’s episode 18 of Blended: I’m joined by another amazing panel of guests and we’re talking about workplace discrimination. It’s a sensitive subject: something that a lot of people have actually experienced, but not something we like to talk much about. So, of course, it’s a topic we want to tackle head-on!</p>\n<p>Today, our guests will be discussing exactly what discrimination means and why it happens; sharing their own personal experiences; reflecting on the differences between discrimination, micro-aggressions, victimization and bullying; and the panel will be sharing their advice for creating more supportive and inclusive workplaces.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[0.33] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Dyci – Founder and CEO of New Gen Architects</li>\n<li>Jennifer – Director of Public Information at Citizen Potawatomi Nation</li>\n<li>Miles – Co-founder &amp; CEO of Cargologik</li>\n<li>Brittany – Marketing Director at Interior Design Magazine</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[02.40] The group discusses the basics around workplace discrimination: what it means, the reasons that people are discriminated against and how it differs from bullying, harassment, victimization and microaggressions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I always look at workplace discrimination as a clear barrier or blockage to a job, an opportunity, or a role, because of, not necessarily the way that someone identifies, but how that person is perceived.” Dyci</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.28] The panel shares their own personal experiences of workplace discrimination, and the impact of those experiences.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Dyci’s experience of micro-aggressions</li>\n<li>Disguising bias behind a compliment</li>\n<li>How discrimination changes across industries</li>\n<li>Miles’s experience of victimization</li>\n<li>HR in theory vs HR in practice</li>\n<li>Discrimination in fundraising</li>\n<li>Conscious vs unconscious bias</li>\n<li>Tolerance</li>\n<li>Jennifer’s experience of being silenced</li>\n<li>White passing, ownership of culture ad exclusion</li>\n<li>Brittany’s experience of seeing an interview candidate excluded due to disability</li>\n<li>Woman to woman discrimination and competition</li>\n<li>Representation and internalized diversity quotas</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“HR is usually treated as an extension of legal… so resolution never seemed like the authentic goal. But now it seems like it is… with a newer movement towards becoming more aware, you can institute an objective third party, mentorship, a safe space, where it&#8217;s more a function of culture than legal.” Miles</p></blockquote>\n<p>[52.23] The group shares their suggestions for actionable ideas and insights for our own workplaces.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Education and ongoing learning</li>\n<li>Creating safe spaces</li>\n<li>Mentorship</li>\n<li>Blind applications</li>\n<li>Developing a reporting process that doesn’t involve naming your accuser</li>\n<li>Speaking up and supporting others</li>\n<li>Asking for help, bringing in external expertise</li>\n<li>Building the right culture</li>\n<li>Re-branding HR</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s about engaging people in a way that doesn’t feel like just checking a box, it’s about engaging people on every single level, from entry level to C Suite.” Brittany</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.17.56] The panelists sum up their learnings from today’s discussion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s also incumbent on each of us to not allow space for discrimination, to call it out whenever we see it, to say ‘there’s no room for that attitude here.’” Jennifer</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dycimanns/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Dyci</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifermbell/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Jennifer</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mvarghese/#hello\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Miles</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/brittany-lloyd-00b2a061/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Brittany</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode251",
    "date": "2022-03-14T04:00:12",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22420964/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/transportation-solutions-with-R2-Logistics.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22420964\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.r2logistics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">R2 Logistics</a>, an award-winning third-party logistics provider offering industry-leading supply chain management services to shippers of all sizes.</p>\n<p>Founded in 2007, R2 Logistics is a global provider of market-leading transportation services and logistics solutions. As a third-party logistics company, it provides access to thousands of transportation providers and has the capacity to resolve all of your shipping needs. Backed by game-changing technology and its culture for reliable service and relentless passion, R2 Logistics has built a strong reputation as an industry leader.</p>\n<p>Today Frank Dreischarf, Vice President of Supply Chain Solutions at R2 Logistics, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; overcoming challenges in the midst of disruption; and the importance of collaboration and visibility in supply chain.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[08.28] R2 Logistics’ background and how they’ve evolved into the company they are today.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“That expedite mentality, that sense of urgency, is part of our organizational DNA.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.29] A closer look at the R2 Logistics transportation management system, its features and the benefits.</p>\n<p>[14.10] From expedited to intermodal, a look at R2 Logistics&#8217; full suite of services for shippers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I like to say that we’re in the ‘headache elimination’ business. Our job is to work with our strategic customers, figure out what their needs are, anticipate those needs (sometimes before they even know that they have them) and come up with solutions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.08] The importance of transparency and why R2 Logistics partner with industry-leading tech providers to offer the highest level of visibility.</p>\n<p>[17.12] The R2 Logistics carrier offering.</p>\n<p>[19.13] A closer look at the platform itself, and its user-friendly interface.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Everything, from the interface to how the customer interacts with the system, is designed to make it as easy as possible.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.23] The speed and ease of an R2 Logistics implementation, and the on-boarding audits that help new customers ensure they have the best prices and achieve the most value from the process.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We&#8217;re able to add a lot of value to customers that are in that mid-small size range… because companies of that size just don’t have the economic resources to hire the professionals necessary to adequately manage that transportation spend.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.50] The R2 Way, and why this unique set of principles sets them apart.</p>\n<p>[30.05] From the importance of surety of supply to a new appreciation for collaboration, Frank’s reflections on the state of the industry right now, and the key trends and learnings coming out of it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“People are starting to realize that relationships matter, collaboration matters. Those customers or shippers out there that have forever viewed their relationships with their transportation providers as tactical, rather than strategic, are suffering right now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.30] The ideal customer for R2 Logistics.</p>\n<p>[36.22] A case study detailing how R2 Logistics was able to help a key customer quickly integrate new acquisitions into their network and reduce transportation costs by 15%.</p>\n<p>[38.27] The future for R2 Logistics.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to R2 Logistics’ <a href=\"https://www.r2logistics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with R2 Logistics and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/r2-logistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/r2logistics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/r2_logistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Instagram</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/r2logistics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/R2_Logistics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Frank on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/frankdreischarf/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "250: Women In Supply Chain™, Mary McNelly",
    "slug": "episode250",
    "date": "2022-03-07T04:06:29",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22326887/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/mentors-in-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22326887\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Mary McNelly: industry powerhouse and logistics and supply chain expert for leading global shoe brand, Crocs.</p>\n<p>An experienced and talented leader, Mary’s knowledge and experience covers all aspects of logistics and supply chain. In her 13 year career with leading retailer Crocs, Mary has risen through the ranks to become the Senior Director of Global Logistics &amp; Supply Chain Network Design.</p>\n<p>Today Mary will be talking to us about her career so far; her passion for logistics; and the role of innovation, automation and agility amidst major disruption. Plus, she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, as well as her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://emergemarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Emerge</a>. As a company focused on empowering and growing meaningful supply chain relationships, Emerge is proud to sponsor Women In Supply Chain™. Through its freight procurement platform, Emerge offers solutions that enhance the spot and contract procurement process, enabling shippers and carriers to make more strategic decisions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.06] Mary’s background, and the journey that led her to a career in supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For the people who are interested, but don’t really know – jump in and just start…. If you’re true to yourself you’ll find it, because there’s something for everyone in supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.32] A closer look at Mary’s current role as senior director of global logistics and supply chain network design at Crocs, the challenges and the triumphs.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Logistics in the last three years has really proven to be incredibly enabling or disabling, if you don’t think forward and have the right relationships and strategy.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.34] Mary’s steady career progression throughout her 13 years with Crocs, and what she loves so much about the brand.</p>\n<p>[14.32] Mary’s experience of disruption as a director of a global brand during a pandemic, and the different proactive ways in which Crocs responded.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I love logistics, supply chain and problem-solving – and what’s more important, is we’re creating history in supply chain right now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.23] Mary’s innovative, strategic and agile approach to leadership, and how more businesses across the industry can better nurture that kind of mindset.</p>\n<p>[21.03] The importance of sustainability and social responsibility, and a closer look at Crocs philanthropy division.</p>\n<p>[24.15] Mary’s experiences as a woman in a male-dominated industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m so proud to be able to say that the majority of our C Suite at Crocs are all women… it’s been a real goal within Crocs to continue to elevate women.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.23] Mary’s reflections on the best way to engage in mentorship.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you’re thinking you need to lean out and ask somebody for mentorship, think about what you’re really asking for and be really focused on that.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.40] The small, consistent steps throughout her career that helped Mary to find her voice as a supply chain leader.</p>\n<p>[35.15] What the future holds for Mary.</p>\n<p>[36.55] Mary’s words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can choose to see all of the men in the room, and get overwhelmed – or you can choose to see all of the amazing women in the room, get motivated, go and stand next to them and be a part of that. And that was a transformational moment for me.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>You can connect with Mary over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mary-mcnelly-0090a834/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

  {

    "title": "249: Making Deliveries Better For Everyone, with FarEye",
    "slug": "episode249",
    "date": "2022-02-28T04:00:42",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22245239/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/delivery-management.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22245239\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.getfareye.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">FarEye</a>, a cutting-edge logistics tech company that is on a mission to make logistics across the world more efficient, predictive and organized, through the use of new technology.</p>\n<p>FarEye’s Intelligent Delivery Management Platform is making the delivery experience better for everyone, and enabling enterprises to deliver at reduced cost with a superior customer experience. Founded in 2013, the platform leverages millions of data points to predict the shipment journey and improve the delivery experience for hundreds of businesses in over 30 countries worldwide.</p>\n<p>Today Kushal Nahata, Co-founder and CEO at FarEye, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do, the challenges of last-mile delivery, reducing your carbon footprint while cutting costs, and why, in the e-commerce industry, experience is the new loyalty.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.15] Kushal’s journey from engineering to transportation; and how, and why, he came to co-found FarEye.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our passion was: ‘can we leverage our engineering technology knowledge to solve real world problems?’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.43] An overview of FarEye – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The space has evolved… It’s less about what you deliver – it’s become more and more important, <strong><em>how</em></strong> you deliver.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.15] The four main challenges in last-mile delivery and customer expectation today, and how the FarEye team got hands-on, with drivers and dispatchers, to understand these pain points from the inside.</p>\n<p>[15.46] An overview of FarEye’s Intelligent Delivery Orchestration, Intelligent Delivery Visibility and Intelligent Customer Experience products, and their benefits.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Logistics, which used to be more of an operation and execution function, has now become a revenue generation function as well.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.52] A closer look at the FarEye platform, and the increasingly important role of low-code development, particularly in the ever-changing world of logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“With a low-code platform, you can define your own logistics and delivery process.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.38] FarEye’s plug and play implementation and integration process.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In the last two years specifically, a lot of companies are looking at speed to market. And that’s where I think implementation time becomes a big blocker, or enabler.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.54] The importance of sustainability, and why it can lead to greater profitability.</p>\n<p>[24.55] FarEye’s ethos of collaboration, and mission to make life better for everyone.</p>\n<p>[27.19] The ideal customer for FarEye.</p>\n<p>[28.20] A case study detailing how FarEye was able to help a key customer, a major pizza delivery service, vastly reduce delivery time and cost, as well as greatly improve its delivery NPS.</p>\n<p>[33.22] The future for FarEye, and for the logistics industry over the coming years.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to FarEye’s <a href=\"https://www.getfareye.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with FarEye and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/fareye/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/GetFarEye\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/FarEyeInAction\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">YouTube</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/fareye\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Kushal on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kushalnahata/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "17dd1f9e-824a-455b-8304-ff9063e6cdb9",

    "post_id": 12406,
    "title": "248: Plan, Automate and Optimize, with Optimal Dynamics",
    "slug": "episode248",
    "date": "2022-02-21T04:00:01",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22198013/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/use-of-ai-in-supply-chain.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22198013\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.optimaldynamics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Optimal Dynamics</a>, a cutting-edge tech company that is utilizing next-generation artificial intelligence to enable logistics companies to better plan, optimize and automate strategic, tactical and real-time operational decisions.</p>\n<p>Optimal Dynamics was founded to bring advanced AI to the logistics industry, in order to help companies automate and optimize operations. A by-product of 40 years of world-leading research and development, Optimal Dynamics’ underlying technology has managed billions of dollars of assets for some of the largest companies in the world.</p>\n<p>Today Daniel Powell, founder and CEO at Optimal Dynamics, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the role of education in innovation; and why fully realized AI solutions are the future of supply chain.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[06.31] Daniel’s career journey, and how, and why, he came to found Optimal Dynamics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I backed into where I am now, not intentionally – through realizing that being Gordon Gecko was much cooler in a movie!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.06] An overview of Optimal Dynamics – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<p>[13.35] An explanation of CORE.ai and how it sits behind the Optimal Dynamics platform.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Core.ai is the underlying engine behind the Optimal platform; it’s the building block of 40 years of research and development, to help make decisions in uncertain environments.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.17] The reality of AI within the logistics industry right now.</p>\n<p>[20.48] A closer look at the Optimal Dyanimcs product and how it can help with day to day logistics operations.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When we think of our plans, we think of resilient, self-healing operations.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.40] Future Visibility™ and how visibility, and the insights that it brings, can help to facilitate effective optimization and collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“[If the logistics team have information earlier], they can collaborate with their teams and figure out freight that fits well for their network, not just a band aid.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.35] Optimal Dynamics’ easy, phased implementation and integration process.</p>\n<p>[29.15] The role of learning and education within Optimal Dynamics’ ethos, why it’s so important and why it sets them apart.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Education is part of our DNA… Robust learning and impact is going to eventually drive innovation, but innovating to innovate is not who we are.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.24] The ideal customer for Optimal Dynamics.</p>\n<p>[32.24] A look at the impact and ROI that the Optimal Dynamics platform is delivering for its customers.</p>\n<p>[34.51] The future for Optimal Dynamics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’ll be spreading our application as far and wide as we can, throughout logistics and supply chain, to help every company make better decisions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Optimal Dynamics’ <a href=\"https://www.optimaldynamics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Optimal Dynamics and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/optimaldynamics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Daniel on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/daniel-powell-18790036/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "bef99075-28ce-4f9b-a201-d9b1ec778e31",
    "episode_number": 247,
    "post_id": 12290,
    "title": "247: Blended &#8211; The Difference Between Culture and Community: What Can We Learn?",
    "slug": "episode247",
    "date": "2022-02-16T04:17:00",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "\r\n<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" title=\"Embed Player\" src=\"//play.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22144154/height/192/theme/modern/size/large/thumbnail/yes/custom-color/2c9d8f/time-start/00:00:00/hide-playlist/yes\" width=\"100%\" height=\"192\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\r\n\r\n<p>It’s episode 17 of Blended: I’m joined by another incredible panel of guests and we’re talking about community and culture. It’s a huge beast to tackle, but sometimes we get the best conversations and most fascinating insights from letting our guests open up, share their truths and bring a really intimate look at the topic from their perspective.</p>\r\n<p>The culture or community that each of us has come from, and the differing communities that play their parts during the course of our lives, are truly instrumental in making us who we are. And really taking the time to hear and embrace that can make us all better friends, partners, parents, colleagues – truly, better people.</p>\r\n<p>Today we’ll be diving into our guests personal experiences with their individual cultures and communities; the challenges involved in embracing who you are; the amazing benefits that can come from working together and celebrating each other’s individuality; and the panel will be sharing their advice for creating more supportive and inclusive workplaces.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>[01.34] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Lisa – Co-founder of REFASHIOND Ventures and REFASHIOND OS</li>\r\n<li>Victoria – Owner at Victoria Ann Studio and Founder of Unhidden</li>\r\n<li>Jennifer – Founder and CEO of Staff Shop</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p>[05.12] The group discuss culture: what it means, the impacts and their own personal experiences.</p>\r\n<blockquote>\r\n<p>“I can’t imagine a single culture throughout time that didn’t have an amazing arena of self-expression and creativity – and you can really assess a culture by its creative.” Lisa</p>\r\n</blockquote>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>What makes a culture?</li>\r\n<li>The personal journey involved in embracing ones own culture</li>\r\n<li>Empathy vs grace</li>\r\n<li>Guilt and shame surrounding individual cultures</li>\r\n<li>Forgiveness and healing</li>\r\n<li>Insights into indigenous Canadian and Puerto Rican cultures</li>\r\n<li>Intergenerational trauma</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<blockquote>\r\n<p>“Given the lack of visibility for disabled people, its tough to embrace a culture that, for so long, has hidden us away and made it so difficult for us to live as equitable a life as everyone else.” Victoria</p>\r\n</blockquote>\r\n<p>[44.20] The panel share their thoughts around community, and take a closer look through the lens of disability.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>What is the difference between culture and community?</li>\r\n<li>Ableism and discrimination</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<blockquote>\r\n<p>“Disability is like a subculture… Worldwide, there’s a million of us: it’s the world’s largest marginalized group.” Victoria</p>\r\n</blockquote>\r\n<p>[57.12] The group reflect on how we can create more inclusive environments and better support one another, in the workplace and in wider society.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Where does responsibility lie?</li>\r\n<li>Opportunities for learning and growth</li>\r\n<li>Self-declaration vs asking questions</li>\r\n<li>Wide range of accessibility needs</li>\r\n<li>Role of data</li>\r\n<li>Using self-identification to reclaim power</li>\r\n<li>Business certification and supplier diversity</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<blockquote>\r\n<p>“We’re not a problem to be solved. Maybe ask ‘what more can I learn?’” Jennifer</p>\r\n</blockquote>\r\n<p>[1.15.11] The panel discuss celebrating culture and community, the current challenges and the benefits to be found in embracing difference.</p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Labels, siloes and intersectionality</li>\r\n<li>Finding common ground</li>\r\n<li>A focus on equal opportunity</li>\r\n<li>Outdated procurement and grant application processes</li>\r\n<li>Acceptance and tolerance vs understanding value</li>\r\n<li>Poverty, gatekeeping and financial literacy</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<blockquote>\r\n<p>“It’s about creating an environment where people can be their authentic self, where they feel safe…” Jennifer</p>\r\n</blockquote>\r\n<p>[1.33.26] The panellists sum-up their learnings from today’s discussion.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/supplychainlocalization/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Lisa</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/victoria-jenkins-812b7027/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Victoria</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifer-menard-shand/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Jennifer</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\r\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>",

    "uuid": "9024e18f-4bb0-418f-9add-d1d2eee38cb5",

    "title": "246: Achieve Complete Command &#038; Control For Your Supply Chain, with Overhaul",
    "slug": "episode246",
    "date": "2022-02-14T04:00:24",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/22103615/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/supply-chain-optimization-software.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"22103615\" height=\"90\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" player_use_thumbnail=\"use_thumbnail\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://over-haul.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Overhaul</a>, a fast-growing supply chain tech company that is on a mission to empower global supply chains with risk management for compliance, efficiency &amp; transparency.</p>\n<p>Founded in 2016, Overhaul is the industry’s first and only holistic, end-to-end solution that optimizes supply-chain visibility, integrity, and security for global enterprises. Its software-based approach offers high configurability and efficient time-to-value to supply chain organizations, without the heavy tech debt found with hardware-based providers. Overhaul has quickly grown to be a trusted provider for Fortune 100 companies moving freight globally across industries, such as pharmaceutical and healthcare, technology, logistics, and food and beverage.</p>\n<p>Today Karin Stevens, General Manager at Overhaul, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; utilizing multimodal visibility in risk management; and the importance of digital supply chain transformation.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[07.01] Overhaul’s founder story: how, and why, the company began, and how it has evolved since its inception.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our software has been developed to provide real time visibility around what’s happening in your supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.43] A broad look at Overhaul – what they do, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For us, defining ourselves as a risk management organization is broader than just providing root visibility – it’s about providing actionable insights, and providing real time corrective response into the supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.44] A closer look at risk management, why it’s so important, and how it connects to issues around compliance and insurance.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Over the last 15 years we’ve seen about a 330% increase in verdicts ending in over 1 million dollars in litigation costs.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.30] Overhaul&#8217;s implementation and integration process, and the role of data.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The ability to integrate, but then also plug the gaps, is a key theme for our implementation process.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.52] The realities of digital transformation, change management and the process of identifying core business problems.</p>\n<p>[32.15] The ideal customer for Overhaul.</p>\n<p>[35.00] Case studies: how Overhaul helped two key customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not just a one size fits all experience within our software. It’s something that’s connected and configured around the customers KPIs and what they care about.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[42.56] The future for Overhaul, and for the logistics industry.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Head over to Overhaul’s <a href=\"https://over-haul.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Overhaul and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/overhaulinc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/OverhaulInc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Facebook</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/overhaulinc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Karin on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/karinstevens/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
