    "web_content": "<p>Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://logixboard.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Logixboard</a>, an exciting software company who are helping freight forwarders to deliver unparalleled customer experience, by combining logistics expertise and personalized service with a powerful digital platform.</p>\n<p>Logixboard is a one-stop customer engagement platform for freight forwarders that helps their customers be more efficient and have more visibility into their processes. With a focus on simplifying logistics and delivering unrivalled customer experience, Logixboard can help you to boost customer retention, supercharge your sales team, scale your operations and confidently compete in a busy market.</p>\n<p>Today Julian Alvarez, co-founder and CEO at Logixboard, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; their dedication to customer experience; and the challenges facing the shipping industry right now.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>[05.30] Julian’s entrepreneurial journey and how he came to co-found Logixboard.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We fell deeply in love with the industry and the opportunity for impact that we could have.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.40] An overview of what Logixboard does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Everybody is always thinking about the ROI, everybody has seen technology as a cost center for a very long time – and we’re flipping the script.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.34] A closer look at the Logixboard platform, and what customers can do within it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re helping freight forwarders provide better visibility – their customers, in a chaotic supply chain, are trying to understand and answer the basic question: ‘where’s my stuff?!’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.10] The ease and speed of integration with the Logixboard platform.</p>\n<p>[21.46] The three signs your business is ready for digitization, and the importance of a people-first mindset.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Having a mindset that data is an asset is ultra-critical.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.18] Julian reflects on resiliency, Logixboard’s COVID experience and how they were able to support their customers through disruption.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When you’re an entrepreneur, resiliency and grit is at your core.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.17] Logixboard’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[35.09] Two case studies, looking at how Logixboard helped their customers to achieve success.</p>\n<p>[39.07] The future for Logixboard.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Logixboard’s <a href=\"https://logixboard.com\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Logixboard and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/logixboard\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/logixboard/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Facebook</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/logixboard\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Julian on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/julian-alvarez-751943126/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20898248/height/360/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/87a93a/\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_229_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" libsyn_item_id=\"20898248\" height=\"360\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"87a93a\"></iframe><br /></p>\n",

    "uuid": "19333134-79df-4f6c-9d20-157a394be802",

    "post_id": 7805,
    "title": "228: Women In Supply Chain™, Donna Wilczek",
    "slug": "episode228",
    "date": "2021-11-01T04:00:44",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20972861/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" use_download_link=\"use_download_link\" download_link_text=\"Download here!\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_228_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"20972861\"></iframe><br /><a class=\"libsyn-download-link\" href=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_228_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Download here!</a><br /><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Donna Wilczek: innovator, business leader, tech strategist and inventor.</p>\n<p>Donna is a SaaS technology executive who, over the course of her 20 year career, has worked at major names like IBM and Accenture. As well as currently serving as the senior vice president of product strategy and innovation at Coupa Software and on the board of Optimizely, a digital experience platform, Donna is also an inventor and technology innovator.</p>\n<p>Today Donna will be talking to us about her career so far; her passion for tech; her innovative spirit and talent for invention; and she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, and her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics are proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.35] Donna’s background and how her natural curiosity and interest in continuous improvement led her to a career in tech.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I was able to join the field at a really interesting time of change… I loved the notion that we would be creating a new frontier and trying to figure it out.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.11] How Donna’s early career and experiences at IT brands like Accenture and IBM fuelled her curiosity; and how the industry has changed.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When I joined Coupa, the company was fully 100% cloud, and even 10 years ago, that was a very difficult conversation to have with IT organizations!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.59] Donna’s role as senior vice president of Product Strategy and Innovation at Coupa.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We think ‘how would it work, if we were able to do anything!’ And that is the most thrilling part of my role. We’re not limited by anything, other than our creativity and imagination.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.07] Why diversity and inclusion is so important in the workplace.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We have a saying at Coupa: ‘none of us is as smart as all of us!’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.28] How Coupa has changed over the last 10 years, Donna’s pride and excitement in playing a part in helping them to scale and go public – and why it’s important to get comfortable with being uncomfortable.</p>\n<p>[16.40] Donna’s new role as a board member at Optimizely, a closer look at what they do and the key trends of responsive experimentation and personalization.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Optimizely is a recognition that the customer experience is now a digital experience.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.07] How Donna came to secure a board position, and her advice for other’s looking to explore a similar position.</p>\n<p>[22.55] Donna’s talent for invention, why it’s important for her to nurture her creative side and how she supports other’s in gaining their own patents and protecting their work.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The patents from my history show that I was able to take something, look at it differently and then do something special with it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.25]  Donna’s experiences as a woman in the industry, and how she helps to echo minority voices.</p>\n<p>[30.41] The mentors that have helped to inspire and support Donna throughout her career.</p>\n<p>[31.26] What the future holds for Donna, and for innovation and collaboration at Coupa.</p>\n<p>[33.13] Donna’s words of advice to all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with Donna over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dwilczek/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/dwilczek\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode227",
    "date": "2021-10-25T04:00:48",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" title=\"Libsyn Player\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/21312551/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe>Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.c3solutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">C3 Solutions</a>, a global leader specializing in powerful yard management and  software solutions.</p>\n<p>Since its inception in 2000, C3 has been transforming its customers static logistics operations into dynamic flow-through centers, and has gained the confidence of clients around the world and across numerous industries including retail, grocery, distribution, manufacturing and parcel post.</p>\n<p>Today Greg Braun, Chief Revenue Officer at C3 Solutions, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; their passion for their customers, for industry trends and the latest tech; and the current challenges in supply chain.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.14] The history behind C3 Solutions and how Greg came to co-found the company.</p>\n<p>[08.48] An overview of what C3 Solutions does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We really help our customers get out of the information dark ages!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.56] A closer at look at C3&#8217;s Dock Scheduling solution, and the challenges it helps to solve for customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We help businesses put some order into their process&#8230; and then automate it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.29] A closer look at C3&#8217;s Yard Management solution, and the benefits it brings.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a mission critical system… for industries like grocery or parcel post, if you have down time, it’s catastrophic – so our solution is built to be reliable.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.10] C3 Solution’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[33.32] Why C3&#8217;s solutions are so easy to use and implement.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re one of the only companies out there that is constantly re-investing in our yard products.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.35] Case studies, detailing how C3’s Dock Scheduling and Yard Management solutions have increased productivity, efficiency and visibility and reduced cost and non-compliance for two key customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We can improve a manual shunter’s (yard driver’s) productivity by as much as 30%.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[47.01] The future for C3 Solutions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to C3 Solution’s <a href=\"https://www.c3solutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with C3 and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/c3-solutions-inc-/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/C3-Solutions-117615678266090/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/C3SolutionsTV\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">YouTube</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/c3solutions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Greg on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/c3gregbraun/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "601450ba-63c5-4cb4-930c-1def5103ddc0",
    "episode_number": 226,
    "post_id": 7732,
    "title": "226: Blended – (Dis)Ability in the Workplace",
    "slug": "episode226",
    "date": "2021-10-20T04:00:17",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe title=\"Libsyn Player\" style=\"border: none\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20832671/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" height=\"90\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\"  allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe></p>\n<p>If you were listening last month, you’ll have heard that we were celebrating a whole year of Blended! In episode 12 we talked all about immigration – our guests gave us an insight into their personal journeys, and how those experiences shaped them; we talked about struggling with identity; and we reflected on what we can do, as leaders, to celebrate diversity through immigration, to create opportunities and to elevate those voices.</p>\n<p>Now it’s episode 13, we’re stepping into year two of Blended, I’m so excited to bring you all more – and today we’re talking about disability. The subject of disability has come up in other shows, particularly when we’ve talked about rights or discrimination. But sometimes we are all guilty of talking broadly and lumping everybody together – so we say, “there’s a policy that covers women, LGBTQIA+, disability, race, religion” – but we know that these sweeping statements don’t work. Everybody is different, their needs are different and so we need to make sure we’re breaking it all down and talking about things on an issue by issue, person by person level. So I’m joined by another passionate group of professionals who are helping us shine a light on the issue of disability today.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.01] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m a person who can’t see that is living in a world that has been set up for people who can – and that’s the same for all disabilities.” Scott</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Scott – Director of Public Policy at Alphapointe</li>\n<li>Claudia – Senior Director of Global Logistics at Google</li>\n<li>Prakash – Multi Model Operations at Toll Group</li>\n<li>Doug – Program Manager in Workforce Development at NSITE</li>\n<li>Victor – Chair of Board of Directors for Clothing Pick Up for Cerebral Palsy and Board Director for The Ontario Federation of Cerebral Palsy</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I can now say ‘I’m blind’ and I’m not cautious or ashamed. I encourage people that are going through the same thing, there’s a rainbow at the end, you can get through this and really succeed!” Doug</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.52] The group reflect on what the word ‘disability’ means to them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Disability is a very broad statement that actually disempowers a lot of people.” Prakash</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>People first language</li>\n<li>The evolution of language</li>\n<li>What defines you as an individual</li>\n<li>Words mean different things to different people</li>\n<li>Developing more creative means of communication</li>\n<li>Breadth of what the word represents – not all disabilities are visible</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I think it’s always safe to ask the person how they want to be referred to. In a situation where you’re not sure, it’s best to ask!” Claudia</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.05] The guests share their personal experiences, both the challenges and the positives, and discuss some of the things they’ve learned from those experiences.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Creating safe spaces to educate and empower</li>\n<li>Normalizing conversations</li>\n<li>Making things accessible, from workplaces to websites</li>\n<li>Creating equal opportunities</li>\n<li>Honesty and visibility</li>\n<li>Systems, technologies and remote working</li>\n<li>The impact of COVID</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m a strong believer that we need to do what it takes to get employers to look at people, to pay them real dollars and give them real jobs so everyone has an opportunity in life.” Victor</p></blockquote>\n<p>[52.00] The panel discuss different company procedures and approaches, and their impact.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You need to educate people about inclusion – you can have an accessible washroom, but that doesn’t mean you’re welcoming people.” Victor</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Holding leadership accountable</li>\n<li>Policies and targets</li>\n<li>Breaking the tendency to only employ people like yourself</li>\n<li>Training and awareness</li>\n<li>Company culture and structure</li>\n<li>Assumptions vs honest conversations</li>\n<li>Flexibility</li>\n<li>Accessibility vs inclusiveness</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not just about diversity, race, gender, disability – it’s the culture-add that you get. By adding people of different backgrounds and abilities, you get a stronger, richer, high performing team.” Claudia</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.09.03] The group reflect on possible solutions for opening up dialogues in our businesses, guiding leaders to a more inclusive way of working and celebrating and promoting people with disabilities.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Creating the right environments</li>\n<li>Staff training</li>\n<li>Keeping an open mind and resisting assumptions</li>\n<li>Taking action and being committed</li>\n<li>Being an ally</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[1.20.22] The panellists each give their sum-up from today’s discussion around what we can we do to encourage diversity through disability. .</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Don’t be scared to have the conversation, or ask the question – Prakash</li>\n<li>Don’t be afraid to step down and empower the person with the disability – Victor</li>\n<li>Promote awareness – Claudia</li>\n<li>Remember that with diversity comes opportunity – Doug</li>\n<li>Your future will be brighter and better when you find ways to engage with and include people with disabilities – Scott</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We need more pressure on our HR staffing teams to make sure that we have a diverse slate of candidates – and that means all kinds of diversity.” Claudia</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/scottthornhillnc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Scott</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/claudiaknowltonchike/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Claudia</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/douglas-goist-656b3228/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Doug</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/prakash-m-radhakrishnan-4b048044/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Prakash</a> and Victor over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20816978/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" use_download_link=\"use_download_link\" download_link_text=\"Download here!\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_225_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"20816978\"></iframe><br /><a class=\"libsyn-download-link\" href=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_225_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Download here!</a><br /><br />Today I’m joined by pioneering software company <a href=\"https://www.toolsgroup.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">ToolsGroup</a>,<em> the</em> innovators of service-driven supply chain planning software for companies that face high demand volatility, along with distribution and product line complexity.</p>\n<p>For more than two decades, ToolsGroup has been helping companies around the globe achieve the highest service levels in their industries while streamlining inventory and logistics costs. Their flagship software, SO99+, automates and optimizes supply chain planning tasks including demand forecasting and sensing, multi-echelon inventory optimization, replenishment and S&amp;OP to meet target service levels.</p>\n<p>Today David Barton, General Manager for the Americas at ToolsGroup, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; how their service-driven approach sets them apart; and exactly how we get our businesses ready for anything.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.26] The incredible history, dating back to the ’70s, that led founders Joseph and Eugenio to establish ToolsGroup.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“They discovered that the low hanging fruit in manufacturing was supply chain – that’s where the greatest impact could be had… so they focused the whole company on the use of service-driven planning in supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.31] The three core ToolsGroup focus areas of ‘predict,’ ‘protect’ and ‘perform.’</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Working with the constraints of the real world of supply chain and the built in uncertainty, you need an automated engine to optimize towards target service level &#8211; and it’s probabilistic forecasting that makes that possible.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.28] ToolsGroup’s unique service-driven approach, and its benefits.</p>\n<p>“Fundamentally, our focus is about business outcome, and service level can be equated to top-line revenue.&#8221;</p>\n<p>[18.58] David reflects on the challenges of the last 18 months and what we can learn from them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Dealing with those disruptions puts even more pressure on having digital transformation in your operating model.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.38] A closer look at the challenges of adopting a just-in-case approach to inventory and current lead-time disruption.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can’t just crank up your safety stock as a strategy&#8230; Having a real word digital model of how your supply chain operates is essential.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.35] Why supply chain digitization and digital transformation are so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“…being able to normalize and reconcile differences in data, so that you can get to a single view of the operating model of inventory, is one of the critical challenges customers face.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.22] A profile of ToolsGroup’s ideal client.</p>\n<p>[32.12] Client case study: how ToolsGroup helped a key customer increase service levels, inventory efficiency and ultimately increase market share.</p>\n<p>[35.00] The future for the industry, and for ToolsGroup.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to ToolGroup’s <a href=\"https://www.toolsgroup.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with ToolsGroup and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/toolsgroup/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCM2oXT0JxuRgHYscxUWw_qQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">YouTube</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/toolsgroup\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with David on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-barton-21234b4/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20744060/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" use_download_link=\"use_download_link\" download_link_text=\"Download here!\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_224_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"20744060\"></iframe><br /><a class=\"libsyn-download-link\" href=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_224_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Download here!</a><br /><br />Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.quickbase.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Quickbase</a>, a company who are on a mission to unleash the creativity and problem-solving power of everyone in your business, so you can innovate every day.</p>\n<p>Quickbase is an application development platform that unites business and IT teams by enabling problem solvers of any technical background to work together to safely, securely and sustainably to create an ecosystem of applications. Quickbase helps businesses accelerate the continuous innovation of unique processes by enabling citizen development at scale across one common platform.</p>\n<p>Today Peter Rifken, Principal Solutions Consultant at Quickbase, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; the importance of operational agility; and the power to be found in unlocking the potential of your people.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.02] An introduction to Quickbase.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our goal, at the highest level, is to help our customers achieve operational agility.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.13] An explanation of the terms no-code, low-code and citizen development.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“No code gives you the ability to create end-to-end enterprise grade solutions – but with no coding experience required.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.45] How the Quickbase platform works and its four common pillars.</p>\n<p>[17.59] The key misconceptions or objections around embracing a cloud-based citizen development platform like Quickbase.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re talking about the cloud, so I hear a lot of: ‘if you were in this room, talking about Quickbase, 5 years ago – you would’ve been thrown out!'&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.22] Integration, scalability and Quickbase Pipelines.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Legacy systems aren’t going away… We built Pipelines to both plan for your new integration needs and that connectivity to legacy.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.09] Why empowering your people, and unlocking their potential, is so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“No-code taps into everybody’s inherent ability and need to solve problems.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.32] The age of operational agility, and how can Quickbase can help facilitate it.</p>\n<p>[35.54] The culture and mindset of Quickbase’s ideal client.</p>\n<p>[37.48] Case study: how Quickbase helped transform a key client&#8217;s approach to establishing a new distribution center.</p>\n<p>[41.22] What the future holds for Quickbase.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Quickbase’s     "uuid": "e9436210-91d1-4567-8cc1-c059880e2b63",
    "episode_number": 223,
    "post_id": 9781,
    "title": "223: Women In Supply Chain™, Tara St James",
    "slug": "episode223",
    "date": "2021-10-04T07:00:50",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" title=\"Libsyn Player\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20662403/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Tara St James: a fashion designer, sustainable design strategist and responsible supply chain consultant all rolled into one.</p>\n<p>Tara has spent the last 20 years designing and producing collections for both men and women; and she’s overseen development, production and design procedures at factories across the globe. This extensive experience in product development, sourcing, textile research and development, led her to dive deeper into sustainability and supply chain, and she’s never looked back.</p>\n<p>Tara established her own sustainable womenswear brand in 2009, successfully running it for over 11 years, and went on to found Re:Source(d), a consultancy and education platform looking to demystify the world of sustainable fashion and textile sourcing. She’s an instructor at the Fashion Institute of Technology, as well as holding leadership roles at a sustainable fashion brand and fashion collaboration platform.</p>\n<p>Today Tara will be talking to us about her career so far, her love for fashion; her dedication to sustainability and shaping the future of ethical fashion; and she’ll be sharing her experiences as a woman in the industry, and her words of advice for all of those women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics are proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.02] How Tara’s interest in fashion started at just five years old, her career journey and how fashion has changed.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m really grateful that there’s now more and more focus on supply chain and manufacturing, and the hands that are making the clothes – not just the people that are designing them.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.43] The two key ‘a-ha!’ moments in Tara’s career that pushed her towards a passion for sustainability and a more ethical supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I had to either leave the industry altogether and stop polluting unknowingly, as I had been, or try to make change. That was the first pivot towards sustainability.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.28] How and why Tara established her own sustainable womenswear brand, Study NY, as well as her consultancy, Re:Source(d), and what she learned along the way.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Sustainability isn’t a series of checkboxes, you can’t do everything.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.34] How packaging and technology ties into sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I see packaging as low hanging fruit for brands who want to start on their sustainability story… it’s the first touchpoint that most customers have with their product.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.25] The damaging impact of fast fashion, and why change is on the way.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Government and industry are starting to take the fashion industry more seriously. It’s flown under the radar for a while because people think its frivolous – but it&#8217;s not!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.00] How Tara manages her busy schedule and multiple roles and responsibilities.</p>\n<p>[32.19] The increasingly inclusive and collaborative mindset that Tara has experienced as a woman working across the worlds of fashion, supply chain and sustainability.</p>\n<p>[34.36] Tara’s ongoing journey of finding her voice.</p>\n<p>[36.56] What the future holds for Tara.</p>\n<p>[39.46] Tara’s words of advice to all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with Tara over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/tarastjames/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Head over to Re:Source(d)’s <a href=\"https://www.resourced.fashion/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> to find out more, or connect and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/resourced.fashion/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Instagram</a>.</p>\n<p>Discover Study NY over on their <a href=\"http://study-ny.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>, or connect and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/studyny/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Instagram</a>.</p>\n<p>Discover Another Tomorrow over on their <a href=\"https://anothertomorrow.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>, or connect and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/anothertomorrow/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Instagram</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/anothertomorrownyc/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Facebook</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/another_tmrw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Find out more about Eleven Radius over on their <a href=\"https://www.elevenradius.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>, or connect and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/eleven-radius/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<iframe style=\"display:block;\"   {
    "uuid": "9f790385-d3b9-49b7-a420-2ce78277a22f",
    "episode_number": 222,
    "post_id": 7637,
    "title": "222: Build the future of digital logistics, with Vizion",
    "slug": "episode222",
    "date": "2021-09-27T07:00:29",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p>Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://vizionapi.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Vizion</a>, an exciting supply chain and logistics tech company that offers API&#8217;s and tools to help businesses integrate quality ocean freight tracking data from almost any carrier in a single, easy to use structure.</p>\n<p>Founded in 2018, Vizion provides the technology and data needed to build and deliver end-to-end logistics visibility for shippers, forwarders and software developers. Combining simple APIs for tracking international ocean freight with a global web of carrier connections, the Vizion platform provides you with the data you need to optimize the quality and cost of your visibility.</p>\n<p>Today Kyle Henderson, CEO &amp; Co-Founder at Vizion, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do; how their real-time technology successfully pulls together shippers and forwarders; and the future of visibility.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.21] Kyle’s background, and the entrepreneurial spirit that led him to be a part of nine tech start-ups before eventually founding Vizion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I really doubled down on understanding analytics and data as the principle elements in each of the companies I worked for. So lets take what I learned in this industry… and take it to this industry who hasn’t done it yet.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.38] Exactly what Vizion does, and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We were encountering, again and again, issues with the data foundations across international logistics. It was tough to get data, and if you could get it, it wasn’t coming through pipes that any modern tech systems would utilize. And then the data itself was fragmented and incomplete.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.24] The fundamental differences between API’s and EDI’s, and Kyle’s reflections on the pros and cons.</p>\n<p>[24.54] Why API’s are truly at the heart of digital transformation.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“API’s force better data quality.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.30] A closer look at the Vizion interface and pricing structure.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Using an API is the most flexible and close-to-instant way to put the information you need in the places and systems you want in the fastest possible time.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.17] From smallest to largest, why Vizion doesn’t necessarily have an ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[35.14] Key customer case studies demonstrating the different ways Vizion can help to solve business challenges, and deliver swift ROI.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our customers know before their customers ask.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[39.18] The future for Vizion.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Vizion’s <a href=\"https://vizionapi.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Vizion and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/vizionapi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/VizionAPI\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Kyle on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kylehenderson/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Read Vizion&#8217;s blog post on how API&#8217;s are enabling supply chain digital transformation <a href=\"https://vizionapi.com/blog/2021/2/17/how-are-apis-enabling-supply-chain-digital-transformation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">here</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20555444/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_222_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"20555444\"></iframe></p>\n",

    "title": "221: Take your brand from unknown to notable, with Notably",
    "slug": "episode221",
    "date": "2021-09-20T07:00:05",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p>Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://notablypr.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Notably</a>, a modern PR agency that’s on a mission to help leaders take their companies to the next level.</p>\n<p>Notably is a PR agency for high-growth companies that want to scale quickly, raise serious capital, be acquired or go public. Combining traditional public relations with digital marketing and creative services, Notably’s senior-level team takes pride in taking both B2C and B2B brands from unknown to notable.</p>\n<p>Today Carin Warner, co-founder at Notably, joins me to chat all about the company: what they do and the different ways they can help your brand; as well as her longstanding career in PR, what’s changed over the years and what the future might bring when it comes to making your business stand out from the crowd.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.32] Carin’s career in PR, and the journey that led her to co-found Notably.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I love to think about how to help companies succeed – and that really was the vision behind Notably.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.17] What Notably do and how they help their customers</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We get under the skin of the company we’re working with, understand their pain points… and tell a story that will help them break through the clutter.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.07] Why notably provides, not just a full range of traditional PR services, but also digital advertising and additional creative services.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We think as entrepreneurs… and I think about if I was running my clients company, what would I need? I want to have the whole arsenal of marketing tools available.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.32] What makes Notably different.</p>\n<p>[18.17] The entrepreneurial spirit of Notably’s co-founders and how that translates throughout the business.</p>\n<p>[21.06] Carin’s reflections on how PR and communications have changed since she founded her first company, Warner Communications, back in 1997 &#8211; and how it informs her approach with Notably.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s no end to the news cycle now. It’s fast and it’s furious, and if you don’t jump in on it, you’re gone.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.22] Why it’s so important for B2B and supply chain brands to work with a company like Notably.</p>\n<p>[25.42] Why Notably’s ideal client needs to have a growth mindset and not shy away from taking a risk.</p>\n<p>[27.55] Carin’s experience and thoughts on crisis management.</p>\n<p>[32.45] How PR and marketing are going to continue to evolve.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There will be more and more supply chain companies looking for stories in higher level media&#8230; that will tell who they are in a broader and more impactful way.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.32] The future for Notably.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Notably’s <a href=\"https://notablypr.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Notably and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/notably/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Carin on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/carinwarner/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20435663/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_221_MIXED_AND_MASTERED_1.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"20435663\"></iframe></p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "94f7d4ca-62e3-473e-a885-3614fee530e3",
    "episode_number": 220,
    "post_id": 7484,
    "title": "220: Blended &#8211; Immigration and Identity",
    "slug": "episode220",
    "date": "2021-09-15T07:00:25",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20457359/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>It’s episode 12, and that means it’s been a whole year of Blended! This year has flown by – I’ve hosted some incredible guests and it’s been a real honor that they’ve opened up, and shared their stories with us – in a lot of cases they’ve been really sensitive, personal topics and yet they’ve thrown themselves into it with authenticity and humor so that, as a group, we’ve been able to start to break down stigma and create a safe space for people to ask questions, learn, grow and work through their own belief systems and experiences. We’ve tackled some huge topics – social inequality, racism, sexism, trans rights – and we don’t plan on stopping now!</p>\n<p>Today in episode 12, ‘Immigration and Identity,’ I’m joined by an amazing new group of supply chain and DEI professionals to tackle the, sometimes controversial, subject of immigration. I’ve interviewed so many first and second-generation immigrations on Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™, and that aspect of the guest&#8217;s identity, more often than not, really helps to shape who they are as people, their ambition and aspirations. It’s always a fantastic talking point, so we thought it really deserved a show of its own. Our panelists share their personal journeys and we tackle the challenges and biases as well as the joys and successes of immigrant experiences.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.04] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Stefanie – Product Manger at Terminal 49</li>\n<li>Martha – Global Snr. IT Manager of Enterprise &amp; Corp Systems at McKesson</li>\n<li>Sneha – Demand Planning/Operations Program Manager at Crane</li>\n<li>Shana – Associate Director of Product Management, International Supply Chain at Wayfair</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It wasn’t actually until I went to college that I had my first experience where I felt different.” – Shana</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.57] The group defines the word ‘immigration.’</p>\n<p>[12.13] The panel discusses their personal experiences of immigration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I learned to appreciate how diverse my home city of Mombasa was, and I saw that in the US it’s often not as tolerant as it should be for a first world country – it was a huge surprise.” – Martha</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.47] The group reflects on their accents and the impact of ‘sounding different.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Bias</li>\n<li>Self-consciousness</li>\n<li>Identity</li>\n<li>Integration</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I tried to hide my accent, that bias is there… but my accent is a core part of my being so I don’t hide it anymore and I’m happy with the way I am – but it took me some years to learn that.” – Sneha</p></blockquote>\n<p>[47.23] The panel discusses the word immigrant, and what it means to them.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Context: facts vs assumptions</li>\n<li>Intention, bias and misuse</li>\n<li>When do you stop calling someone an immigrant?</li>\n<li>The controversial use of the word &#8216;alien&#8217;</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s always a culture struggle of ‘who do I identify with?&#8217; Do I let go of my Asian culture so I can blend in more, or be more Chinese but have a conflict of ‘who am I?’” – Stefanie</p></blockquote>\n<p>[56.55] The group reflects on the widespread Asian hate experienced following the start of the pandemic, and the nuances around the word ‘Asian.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The fear felt by many Asian communities</li>\n<li>One word to represent so many different people</li>\n<li>Two-way communication – being open to both asking, and answering, questions</li>\n<li>Allyship</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We all come from a different ethnicity, we all have our own unique identities – and we would like to be respected for where we come from.” Sneha</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.19.42] The panelists each give their sum-up from today’s discussion around what we can we do to celebrate diversity through immigration, to create opportunities and to elevate voices.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Be a change agent: use your position to amplify voices – Shana</li>\n<li>We have a responsibility to each other as human beings, and everything begins with love – Martha</li>\n<li>Leaders need to have more empathy, and connect with immigrants more – Stefanie</li>\n<li>Embrace everyone, and stop filtering people by ethnicity or immigration status &#8211; Sneha</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/stefanieyang/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Stefanie</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/martha-lumatete-0bb2871/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Martha</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/snehakumari/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Sneha</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhengshana/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Shana</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p>Today I’m joined by <a href=\"https://www.transmetrics.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Transmetrics</a>, a leading tech company that optimizes logistics planning and asset management by leveraging the power of predictive analytics and artificial intelligence.</p>\n<p>Transmetrics is a state-of-the-art AI platform developed exclusively for logistics. Established in Bulgaria in 2013, Transmetrics’ unrivaled technology uses a unique approach for analyzing, modeling and predicting transport flows with very high accuracy. Combining the technical knowledge of big data and predictive analytics with hands-on expertise in transport and logistics, Transmetrics’ solutions have brought significant benefits to top-tier logistics companies worldwide.</p>\n<p>Today Marc Meyer, Chief Commercial Officer at Transmetrics, joins me to chat all about the company; what they do; the challenges that the logistics industry is facing right now; and the role data, AI and tech innovation will play in the coming years.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.47] How and why Transmetrics was founded.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In most of the companies the founders were working for, there was an issue of inefficient capacity utilization – with no one out there willing to face that challenge.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.35] An overview of what Transmetrics does, and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We bring just-in-time processes to logistics, with the help of artificial intelligence and machine learning.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.34] How the system&#8217;s broad areas of ‘analyze,’ ‘forecast’ and ‘optimize’ come together to create a smart and robust all-in-one platform.</p>\n<p>[18.50] A closer look at how the Transmetrics platform works, as well as the integration and implementation process.</p>\n<p>[24.46] Marc reflects on the power of data, and how the Transmetrics platform cleanses and enriches client data.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Data is only valuable in the right hands, and with the right intentions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.00] Transmetrics&#8217; unique approach to combining people and AI, with their ‘best of both worlds’ ethos.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There should always be someone involved – not only controlling and checking the machine, but bringing an empathetic view.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.44] Transmetrics’ ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[35.25] An impressive case study, detailing how the Transmetrics platform helped a key customer.</p>\n<p>[41.22] The future for Transmetrics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We want to reshape and revitalize the industry! By making the industry a nicer place to work, and more sustainable, we can do a lot to change it for the better”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Transmetrics&#8217; <a href=\"https://www.transmetrics.ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Transmetrics and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/transmetrics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Marc on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/marc-m-25681358/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20435351/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/LTSC_219_MIXED_AND_MASTERED_1.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"20435351\"></iframe></p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "2b2f5007-5bce-4a03-961e-b8f3e7a5fab9",
    "episode_number": 218,
    "post_id": 7278,
    "title": "218: Women In Supply Chain™, Lisa Morales Hellebo",
    "slug": "episode218",
    "date": "2021-09-06T07:07:38",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20352389/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" height=\"90\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\"  allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe></p>\n<p>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Lisa Morales Hellebo: a truly inspirational VC, entrepreneur, product strategist and community builder, with 25 years of experience working with start-ups and Fortune 500s alike.</p>\n<p>After beginning her career in graphic design, Lisa pulled together her talents for creativity, product design and innovation and set her sights on tech. After successfully founding her own start-up, and being named one of the Top 10 Women in DC Tech, Lisa realized the impact she could have helping other start-ups. Her passion and commitment to the acceleration of technologies that advance the industry has only grown and now, as well as advising others, she is also the co-founder of two organizations, that focus on funding innovation and revolutionizing supply chain.</p>\n<p>Today, Lisa will be talking to us about her career so far; her love for fashion tech and passion for innovation; her reflections on the corporate world’s approach to sustainability; and she’ll be sharing her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics is proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<p> </p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.06] How Lisa’s creativity took her on an ever-evolving journey from graphic design to fashion tech, supply chain and sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My entire career has been obsessed with data, customization, personalization, on-demand – and it’s led me to what I’m doing now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.17] A closer look at REFASHIOND Ventures – what it does, what ‘refashioning supply chains’ means and the power of supply chain digitization.</p>\n<p>[12.59] Why REFASHIOND Ventures is needed, the complex and fascinating journey that led Lisa to found it, and the many things she learned along the way.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I learned that VC’s don’t know anything about fashion, or retail… so I decided to found and build a fashion tech accelerator – the one that I wished had existed when I had <em>my</em> fashion tech company.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.39] Lisa reflects on some of the key challenges she’s faced when it comes to industry change, mindset and sustainability – and the opportunities that have come from that.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We produce 4 times the textile waste of any other country in the world, and so we don’t need to produce or grow another fiber for generations – we’re sitting on mountains of waste that could be generations worth of regenerative textiles.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.35] Lisa’s experiences as a Latina woman, in childhood as well as moving through the industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My entire career, my entire life, every choice I’ve made, has been about proving my     "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20201189/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" height=\"90\" width=\"100%\" scrolling=\"no\"  allowfullscreen webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen oallowfullscreen msallowfullscreen></iframe> Today I’m excited to be joined by Sarah Scudder, President &amp; CRO at Real Sourcing Network and a superstar in the packaging space, who is helping to change the way we think about how the products we sell, and use, are packaged.</p>\n<p>Packaging is a really important topic, because so much of our economy is based around consumption – an average consumer in the western world will handle more than 50 packaged products or items every single day! – and so the conversations around issues like the air miles of those products, the labor practices and of course, sustainability, are key.</p>\n<p>Today Sarah joins me to chat all about single vs multi-use plastics, recycling vs reusing, innovations in the packaging space, and the impact more sustainable packaging can have on both business and the environment.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.51] The truth about fossil-based plastic production.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“99% of plastics are made from oil and/or natural gas: so the greater the demand for plastic packaging, the greater the need for fossil fuels.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.18] A closer look at the technicalities around recycling – the different rules and regulations, lack of machinery, lack of consumer understanding and the profitability of used plastics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Consumers don’t know how to properly dispose of their plastic packaging, so they simply don’t – they throw it in the trash.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.08] Six ways companies can quickly pivot towards greater sustainability in their packaging – without spending a fortune.</p>\n<p>[19.41] How to choose the right packaging for your business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“All plastic is not bad… multi-use plastic can actually be more sustainable than other types of paper packaging.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.27] How recyclable packaging is driving competitive advantage, particularly with Gen Z consumers, and the brands who are setting good examples.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you make that investment… you need to make sure you partner with marketing to leverage that messaging.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.32] New innovations in packaging materials, including IKEA’s mushroom packaging.</p>\n<p>[32.16] The ‘resin identification code’ on your plastics – how to identify it, what it means and how it can help consumers to recycle more effectively.</p>\n<p>[36.17] Sarah’s top tips for making your packaging lighter.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Real Sourcing Network’s <a href=\"https://rsnetwork.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with RSN and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/rsnetwork/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realsourcingnet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Sarah on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sscuddergrowthstrategist/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/sscudder\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20201189/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_216_MIXED_AND_MASTERED_1.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"20201189\"></iframe>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20160812/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe>Blended is back with yet another open and authentic dive into diversity, inclusion, equality and all of the issues around it. You’ve been giving my co-host Madison and I some amazing feedback, and we are truly honored to facilitate these conversations for you, month after month.</p>\n<p>Today in episode 11, ‘Shining a light on social inequality,’ I’m joined by an amazing new group of supply chain and DEI professionals, who are really committed to opening up conversations around diversity, inclusion, community – and they’re brimming with excitement and ideas for how we can bring positivity and drive change. And today, we’re going to be taking on social inequality. It’s another massive topic, but you should know by now that we’re not ones to shy away from a challenge, so we’re going to do our best to shine a light on it, and give you an entry point to take the conversation further.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[02.48] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Shemika – Co-Founder &amp; Executive Director at Zora&#8217;s Cradle</li>\n<li>Hilary – Founder/President at ManPower Trucking Inc.</li>\n<li>Caitlin – Founder and CEO at Global Gateway Logistics</li>\n<li>Donna – Supply Chain Professional</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[06.36] The group discuss social inequality, and what it means to them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I looked at why there was no entry level for women in trucking… and I found that money was in the way.” Hilary.</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Barriers to opportunity</li>\n<li>Educational background</li>\n<li>Socio economic limitations</li>\n<li>Fear and active prevention of certain groups thriving</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[19.06] The panel reflect on the different societies and systems within social inequality, and how we can increase awareness to help us make progress.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Increased education at school, and within the home</li>\n<li>Acceptance, accountability and truth-telling</li>\n<li>Trauma</li>\n<li>The power of the media</li>\n<li>Embracing love and kindness</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[37.13] The group share their personal stories of social inequality, and think about what we can all learn from them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’ve worked for men my entire career… the men are being paid more, being offered direct access to promotion – and we fight 10 times harder to prove our effort as females.” Caitlin</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Disconnect between what companies are saying and what they’re doing</li>\n<li>Talking vs action</li>\n<li>Societal shame</li>\n<li>Creating opportunity for others</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[57.14] The panel discuss social inequality on a global scale, and whether globalization is a help or a hindrance.</p>\n<p>[1.08.50] The group reflect on what we, as employers, entrepreneurs and community members, can do to help create change; and Shemika shares the personal experience that led her to action and the creation of <a href=\"https://zorascradle.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Zora’s Cradle</a>.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We need to work on diversity – we need to get to know others and understand what they can bring to the table.” Donna.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.22.04] The panellists each give their sum-up from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Never underestimate the power of education – Caitlin</li>\n<li>Learn to love others unconditionally – Donna</li>\n<li>We can achieve equity if we all work together – Shemika</li>\n<li>When it comes to diversity and inclusion, just ask. You can’t advocate for others when you don’t understand them – Hilary</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Equity is possible if we all do the work. We have the manpower – let’s start the conversation.” Shemika</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/shemika-hopson/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Shemika</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/h-sandiford/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Hilary</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/caitlin-murphy-0b5a4916/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Caitlin</a>, and Donna over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode-214",
    "date": "2021-08-16T07:00:18",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/20136602/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe> Today I’m excited to be joined by 1-Stop: a trailblazer in port logistics solutions, that is working with communities across the world to lead the way in supply chain innovation, building products that continue to enhance productivity and make life easier.</p>\n<p>Established in Sydney in 2002, 1-Stop is a world leader in developing innovative solutions for the global port community. Working closely with industry operators, its suite of tailored and integrated products has been developed to help streamline operations, enhance efficiency and optimize productivity throughout the supply chain. With the aim to deliver efficiency gains for all, 1-Stops’s customers include shipping lines, port and terminal operators, freight forwarders, customs brokers, 3PLs, trucking companies, rail operators, importers and exporters.</p>\n<p>Today Michael Bouari, CEO at 1-Stop, joins me to chat all about the company; what they do; some of the biggest challenges facing the global port community right now; and the innovations we should expect in the coming years.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.08] How and why 1-Stop was founded, and an overview of what it does.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The key word that best describes port environments is chaos!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.08] A deeper dive into the sectors and products that the 1-Stop suite of solutions encompasses.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We don’t see ourselves as a system for one operator – we’re the glue connecting the operators, so information flows from business to business ”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.05] Exactly how 1-Stop tools integrate with customer systems, and the benefits of increased connectivity.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In Australia alone, we’ve been able to save the community in excess of 10 billion dollars in productivity savings… just by allowing data to be exchanged more efficiently.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.08] Why 1-Stop’s key pillars of efficiency, collaboration, integration and innovation are so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The only way you can connect person A and person B is by understanding what they need – and that’s where the collaboration takes place.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.09] Michael’s reflections on the global port congestion crisis, and how 1-Stop can help.</p>\n<p>[23.18] The environmental impact of global shipping, and why collaboration and shared responsibility will be key to making positive change.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Everyone wants to achieve efficiency, but they struggle to do that because of coordination.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.28] A closer look at 1-Stop’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[29.30] A case study illustrating the impressive social and economic impact of 1-Stop’s solution roll-out in the city of Manila, Philippines.</p>\n<p>[33.32] Michael’s thoughts on the future of the industry, and the kinds of developments and technologies we might expect to see in the next few years.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I can see drone delivery, just in time delivery and artificial intelligence all being technologies that can solve challenges within our supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.21] The future for 1-Stop.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to 1-Stop’s <a href=\"https://www.1-stop.biz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with 1-Stop and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/1474532\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Michael on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-bouari/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "b206ac1b-fa02-4a91-bcb9-9acadf9a459c",

    "post_id": 7060,
    "title": "213: Manage Your Supply Chain Planning Smarter and Safer with Coupa",
    "slug": "episode213",
    "date": "2021-08-09T07:00:12",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" title=\"Embed Player\" src=\"//play.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19902266/height/192/theme/modern/size/large/thumbnail/yes/custom-color/0083b6/time-start/00:00:00/playlist-height/200/direction/backward\" width=\"100%\" height=\"192\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Today I’m thrilled to be joined by a giant in business spend management; a company that is looking to unify supply chain, procurement, payments and treasury in one smart and seamless platform, Coupa.</p>\n<p>Founded in 2006, Coupa is <em>the </em>cloud platform for business spend management, empowering companies around the world with the visibility and control they need to spend smarter and safer. In partnership with the Business Spend Management (BSM) Community, Coupa is constantly co-creating new and unique capabilities that deliver transparency, efficiency, actionable insights and solutions to customers, partners and suppliers, so they can understand and manage their spending.</p>\n<p>Today Matt Tichon, Vice President of Industry Strategy at Coupa Software, joins me to chat all about the company; what they do; the impact of COVID on supply chain resiliency; and why innovation, collaboration and visibility are the keys to business success.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[3.34] A brief background on Coupa and Matt.</p>\n<p>[05.55] How Matt compares Camaro&#8217;s to supply chain.</p>\n<p>[9.05] Coupa&#8217;s key areas and how help their clients understand efficiencies.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We allow companies to experiment&#8230; Instead of making a gut feel with a little bit of data, we can take a whole lot of data and say,<em> &#8216;what happens if?&#8217;</em> and we test these things out.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.26] The value of Digital Supply Chain Twin and how it can be a competitive advantage.</p>\n<p>[16.25] Matt&#8217;s thoughts on artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data science.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The question is, what do you do with your insights once you have them? 85% of data science projects fail. The trick is understanding to start with the end in mind.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.00] How different execution systems all come together.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It is magic when you do this right! The value unlocks are massive and it&#8217;s not hard! I want the whole world to know that this is possible and it&#8217;s easy to do, and we&#8217;ll hold your hand getting there. You&#8217;re going to be amazed so just come on this journey!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23:36] Matt on Coupa&#8217;s &#8220;War Gaming&#8221; concept.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It&#8217;s understanding different plays and what your supply chain will look like while your competitors haven&#8217;t even thought of what to do yet.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.02] Coupa&#8217;s perspective on nurturing resilience during and after COVID.</p>\n<p>[32.30] An ideal customer for Coupa.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For food, once you get to 500 million dollars or more in revenue, they start to exhaust their team&#8217;s abilities and they come knocking on our door. Outside of food, 1 billion dollars and above.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.00] A case study for Coupa</p>\n<p>[40.53] The future for Coupa and Matt</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Coupa&#8217;s <a href=\"https://www.coupa.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Coupa and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/coupa-software/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Rujul on <a href=\"http://linkedin.com/in/matttichon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "5be54788-cf0e-4ac9-9d3a-a3225ab125ec",
    "episode_number": 212,
    "post_id": 6947,
    "title": "212: Women In Supply Chain™, Ana Lucia Alonzo",
    "slug": "episode212",
    "date": "2021-08-02T08:00:30",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19989083/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe><br />\nIn today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Ana Lucia Alonzo: a powerhouse supply chainer, who has held impressive leadership roles at major global consumer brands.</p>\n<p>After gaining a degree in industrial engineering and an MBA at INCAE Business School in her home nation of Guatemala, Ana Lucia dived feet first into a career in supply chain. Her career has taken her around the world and seen her climb the ranks of supply chain leadership in huge brands like Chiquita. Ana Lucia is now bringing together everything she’s learned so far as VP of global supply chain at Starbucks.</p>\n<p>Today Ana Lucia will be talking to us about her career so far, her take on COVID demand and disruption, the importance of brands embracing sustainability; and she’ll be sharing her words of advice for all of the women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics are proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.43] Ana Lucia’s background, and how her curious nature – and love of food! – led her to supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My childhood was filled with education, I was constantly encouraged to explore – intellectual curiosity was on a daily basis.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.30] Why Ana Lucia moved to America from Guatemala, and how her international experiences shaped her.</p>\n<p>[13.33] Ana Lucia’s experience at Starbucks.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a really inclusive culture. It encourages you to bring your whole self to work – and that makes a difference!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.39] COVID, its impact on customer demand and supply chain disruption.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re facing unpreceded volatility and uncertainty in all aspects, across supply and demand. But its amazing how supply chains across the world have stepped up.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.02] Ana Lucia’s final role at Chiquita, and why incorporating continuous improvement is the key to successful sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I had the opportunity to combine elements that make a difference for our environment, but at the same time still drive operational excellence – that’s so critical in sustained long-term solutions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.24] The experiences and challenges that Ana Lucia faced as a Latina woman in a male-dominated world, and what she learned from them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Most of the environments, for my studies and work, have been male-dominated. So in a way I’ve been used, most of my life, to being the minority in the room.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.02] The liberating moment Ana Lucia found her voice.</p>\n<p>[38.04] Why the future is bright for supply chain, and for Ana Lucia.</p>\n<p>[39.53] Ana Lucia’s words of advice to the next generation.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not about being perfect, but always being better.”</p></blockquote>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with Ana Lucia over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
