  {
    "uuid": "0fedcf64-6d8a-47ea-a4f8-5383e39fcab4",
    "episode_number": 211,
    "post_id": 6694,
    "title": "211: Transform Your Procurement Process, with Zip",
    "slug": "episode-211",
    "date": "2021-07-26T08:00:11",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19902266/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets-Talk-Supply-Chain-podcast-Zip-Rujul-Zaparde.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"#0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"19902266\"></iframe><br />Today I’m thrilled to be joined by Zip, the world&#8217;s leading intake-to-procure solution, that provides one cohesive platform for employees to initiate a purchase or vendor request.</p>\n<p>The Zip solution is an intelligent purchase request flow that guides users, automatically catalogs and recommends your preferred vendors, and routes through all the necessary internal departments to control spend, assure compliance and reduce time spent coordinating approvals by half.</p>\n<p>Today Rujul Zaparde, CEO at Zip, joins me to chat all about the dynamic and fast-growing company; what they do; why collaboration and visibility are so important; and Rujul’s entrepreneurial spirit and what he’s learned along the way.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.31] Rujul’s background and entrepreneurial journey.</p>\n<p>[10.03] How and why Rujul came to co-found Zip, and an overview of what it does.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Intake paradigms typically go one of two ways… so it’s sort of like ‘pick your poison,’ these days: upstream pain, or downstream pain!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.59] The experience of launching a new business during COVID, and the unexpected advantages.</p>\n<p>[16.45] A closer look at Zip Intake, and its benefits.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you have all requests flowing through one system, for the first time, you have data on things like lifecycle times or bottlenecks.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.23] The implementation and onboarding process &#8211; and why simplicity for staff is key.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“One of our core principles is that it has to be a consumer-grade product.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.37] The importance of visibility and collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The world has changed a lot – (in procurement) there are more stakeholders, more vendors, more teams – and it’s compounded how important it is to nail collaboration.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.08] Zip’s ideal client.</p>\n<p>[31.57] A customer case study: how Zip revolutionized one client&#8217;s procurement practices and delivered impressive ROI.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The average request, for this client, was taking over 30 emails, and lots of manual back and forth. In less than 6 months, they’ve reduced their cycle times by 43% and improved compliance.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.05] The future for Zip, and for Rujul.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Zip’s <a href=\"https://ziphq.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Zip and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/theziphq/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Rujul on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/rujulz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "d7df1243-af5e-4fc3-9a5a-6371e5caa888",
    "episode_number": 210,
    "post_id": 6785,
    "title": "210: Blended &#8211; Don’t forget the ‘T’: Talking Trans",
    "slug": "episode-210",
    "date": "2021-07-21T08:00:14",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19908695/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe><br />\nWe’re into double digits now: it’s episode 10 of Blended and we’re flying! I’m so proud of the panelists we’ve featured so far, the topics we’ve covered, and the sometimes tough conversations we’ve had, and I just cannot wait to bring you more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 10, ‘Don’t forget the ‘T’: Talking Trans,’ my co-host Madison and I are joined by a fabulous new group of supply chain and DEI professionals, who are overflowing with passion, insight and experience when it comes to all of the issues around diversity, inclusion, equity and community. And today, we’re going to be diving specifically into the transgender and non-binary community, so that can we learn, educate and celebrate with our, often marginalized, friends.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[00.39] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Lori – Environmental Social Governance Services Canadian Lead at EY</li>\n<li>Kai – President at TransFocus Consulting, Inc.</li>\n<li>Brian – Founder and CEO at Chain.io</li>\n<li>Gabriel·le – Translator</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[04.25] The group dive into the importance of words, looking at definitions, and what they represent to the communities involved.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Understanding and appreciating the language is complex – we might have simple definitions, but they might not always fit for everyone.” Kai.</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Umbrella terms</li>\n<li>The difficulty in finding words to suit such a broad spectrum of people</li>\n<li>Asking people personal questions vs creating safe spaces for people to share naturally</li>\n<li>Making mistakes</li>\n<li>The constant evolution of language</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s more about respect than being an expert on definitions.” Brian</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.06] The panel discuss pronouns – why they’re important, how to use them and why everyone should embrace them.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Mis-gendering</li>\n<li>The importance of holding back on assumptions</li>\n<li>The effect of cumulative impact on trans people over time</li>\n<li>Give and take and shared responsibility between trans cis people</li>\n<li>The use of pronouns on social media</li>\n<li>Structural and cultural considerations within business</li>\n<li>Gendered structures within other languages, like French</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not a political statement to put your pronouns out there – it’s just a way to make communication more effective.” Brian</p></blockquote>\n<p>[56.52] The group takes a closer look at bringing trans, and supporting the trans community, in the workplace.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Why trans rights are lagging behind</li>\n<li>Stigma and resistance to change</li>\n<li>Intersecting ‘categories’ of people – people aren’t just one thing</li>\n<li>Expanding policy and being a conscious employer</li>\n<li>Internal education and communication</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;Language is the main way we communicate and connect with each other&#8230; and people refusing to use the right pronouns is people refusing to speak the same language.&#8221; Gabriel·le</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.13.23] The panelists share their personal stories, and discuss allyship.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Why it’s not the responsibility of trans people to educate cis people</li>\n<li>Can you Google that?!</li>\n<li>Finding the balance, of silent support and speaking up, as an ally</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;The role of an ally is important&#8230; not just during the rainbow month, it&#8217;s 24 hours.&#8221; Lori</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.26.31] The panelists each give their sum-up from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Identity is fluid, embrace it and commit to it – Madison</li>\n<li>Learn to make space for the messiness of being human; being curious, respectful and humble will get you far – Gabriel·le</li>\n<li>Be mindful – Lori</li>\n<li>Approach the issue from a place of compassion – Brian</li>\n<li>Re-frame trans people as a gift, who can bring so much through being allowed to be their authentic selves – Kai</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“There are going to be terms that are accepted by some and rejected by others – you have to treat people as individuals.” Madison</p></blockquote>\n<h2></h2>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Madison</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lori-benson-scmp-cpsm-25662bb/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Lori</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kai-scott-7a3b4716/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Kai</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/briansglick/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Brian</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabriel-le-villeneuve/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Gabriel·le</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "b81e9a69-62e6-449d-adce-2cc886abb144",
    "episode_number": 209,
    "post_id": 6672,
    "title": "209: Revolutionize how you upskill your teams, with Skill Dynamics",
    "slug": "episode209",
    "date": "2021-07-19T08:00:34",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19842935/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Today I’m pleased to be joined by Skill Dynamics, an exciting and people-focused company on a mission to provide high impact digital training programs that upskill and effectively prepare corporate employees for everything required to excel in their role.</p>\n<p>Skill Dynamics offers expert, practical e-learning solutions for procurement and supply chain teams. Their real-world role-based programs, delivered with a customized and collaborative approach, have been rolled out to over 300,000 students to date. And with offices in the US, Europe, Middle East and China, and over 520 blue chip clients, they’re making a real impact on core training worldwide.</p>\n<p>Today David Rajakovich, CEO at Skill Dynamics, joins me to chat all about the company; what they do; the impact of the COVID crisis on staff training, procurement and ecommerce; and the power of digital.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.10] Exactly what Skill Dynamics does.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re laser focused on raising the performance of corporate learners.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.48] Skill Dynamics&#8217; recent re-brand, and the power of good marketing.</p>\n<p>[11.03] Role based learning – what it means, how it differs from more traditional styles of learning, and the benefits.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We work closely with clients to determine which roles need to achieve higher or lower targeted competence levels across the spectrum of procurement and supply chain skills.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.42] How Skill Dynamics work with their customers to develop the best learning solutions.</p>\n<p>[18.14] David’s background in the army, how it informed his career and helped him to create the original R&amp;D department at Skill Dynamics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My time in the army taught me about leadership – and I would argue that leadership is a necessary pre-condition to delivering innovation.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.24] Why Skill Dynamics chose to focus on online training right from the company’s inception back in 2011.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“From early on, we knew that the quality of classroom training is highly variable.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.49] COVID, and its impact on corporate training.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Given the disruption we’ve seen from COVID, Brexit and other trends, procurement and supply chain are squarely in the corporate spotlight – and those that have high performing teams… will gain a strategic advantage.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.41] Key industry challenges and trends.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The big trends around supply chain are risk and resilience.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.07] Skill Dynamics’ ideal client.</p>\n<p>[34.40] A customer case study: how Skill Dynamics deliver ongoing strategic value for a core client.</p>\n<p>[39.37] The future for Skill Dynamics.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Skill Dynamic’s <a href=\"https://skilldynamics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Skill Dynamics and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/skill-dynamics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/skill_dynamics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with David on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/davidrajakovich/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/dfraj8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE.</a></p>\n",

    "slug": "episode208",

    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p>Today I’m excited to be joined by EasyMile, a truly innovative and forward-thinking global business, which provides software and complete solutions for driverless mobility and goods transportation.</p>\n<p>EasyMile&#8217;s driverless technology is at the core of award-winning solutions for mobility, intralogistics and more. With quality delivery and real-world deployments, their certified, expert software is bringing autonomous vehicles around the world, in over 300 locations and more than 30 countries, to life.</p>\n<p>Today Joseph Holmes, Director of Sales at EasyMile, joins me to chat all about the company, what they do, the amazing technology behind their solutions and the role autonomous vehicles will play in the future of the industry, and the world.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.46] Joseph shares the story of how EasyMile was founded and the company&#8217;s key milestones.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our CEO experienced congestion and pollution… he wanted to reclaim the cities.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.44] Exactly what EasyMile does.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“By heart, we’re a software company. We work in tandem, with leading OEM’s and manufacturers, to bring what we both do best together, in order to produce automated vehicles.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.16] A closer look at how the technology works.</p>\n<p>[17.03] The importance of safety.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Safety is at the forefront of everything we do&#8230; and it’s the outcome of strict processes and well informed employees.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.18] An overview of EasyMile’s key vehicle solutions, including the EZ10: the most deployed autonomous shuttle in the world.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The EZ10 is essentially that ideal first and last mile connectivity vehicle.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.07] EasyMile’s unique approach to implementation and training.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In order for us to be sustainable, we need to ensure we train the end client to work with, and maintain, our products. We’re committed to having as light a footprint as possible.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.33] The ideal client for EasyMile.</p>\n<p>[35.56] Joseph shares a case study, detailing how Easymile created major efficiencies and achieved ROI in only 18 months for a key customer.</p>\n<p>[39.24] The future for EasyMile, and for autonomous vehicles.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to EasyMile’s <a href=\"https://www.easymile.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with EasyMile and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/easymile/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with Joseph on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/joseph-holmes-4b67b637/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/joseph_holmes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19784087/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_208_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19784087\"></iframe></p>\n",

    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Untitled-design.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Untitled-design-300x201.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Untitled-design-300x201.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Untitled-design.png 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "6453fad5-b555-4380-a0b9-aa0dccb49ed2",
    "episode_number": 207,
    "post_id": 5316,
    "title": "207: Women In Supply Chain™, Shana Zheng",
    "slug": "episode207",
    "date": "2021-07-05T08:00:31",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19664312/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Shana Zheng: a strategic, entrepreneurial and customer-obsessed product and business leader.</p>\n<p>After working as an analyst at huge names like JP Morgan and Disney, Shana went on to co-found her own company, successfully raising over $1.8 million from Google Ventures. And after subsequent roles at brands including GoFundMe, Shana moved across to the world of supply chain and has never looked back. She’s now Associate Director of Product Management, International Supply Chain at Wayfair, managing logistics execution, product vision, strategy and execution of transportation management for international freight forwarding.</p>\n<p>Today Shana will be talking to us about her career so far, her entrepreneurial spirit, her passion for working with charities; and she’ll be sharing her words of advice for all of the up-and-coming women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics is proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.24] Shana’s background, and the mentality, instilled in childhood, that kept driving her forward.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“As an immigrant, work ethic was always part of my upbringing.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.24] How Shana found supply chain.</p>\n<p>[15.10] A closer look at Shana’s current role at Wayfair.</p>\n<p>[16.15] Shana’s passion for customer satisfaction, and the changes she’s seen during the pandemic.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The customers’ needs are changing – it&#8217;s so important to understand your customer and the environment they’re operating in.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.42] How Shana’s entrepreneurial spirit weaves together with her corporate side.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“By nature, I’m curious: I’m always looking to learn and grow. And, as an entrepreneur, you’re nimble – you’re constantly morphing, trying to figure things out.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.18] Shana’s passion for working with charities.</p>\n<p>[25.49] Shana’s experience as a woman in a male-dominated industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The more senior you get, the fewer women you see &#8211; especially in tech. So, as a minority, I’ve always had to speak louder and speak more.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.20] How Shana found her voice.</p>\n<p>[29.49] Shana reflects on what’s she’s learned on her journey so far.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can do anything you want to, but you have to put your mind to it and do the work.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.13] Shana’s advice for the next generation.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with Shana over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/zhengshana/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.<br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19664312/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_207_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19664312\"></iframe></p>\n",

      5361, 6606, 6607, 6608, 5578, 6177, 5605, 5606, 6925, 6446, 6349, 5383,

  {
    "uuid": "474a099c-9fff-43e9-9638-3a3415b44769",

    "slug": "episode206",
    "date": "2021-06-28T08:00:33",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19583939/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/time-start/00:00:00\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Today’s episode is a little bit different from the norm. As always, I’m joined by a special guest, but it won’t be to bring you a business profile or the kind of interview you’re used to! Instead, my guest Jonathan Kempe, founder and CEO at Verifai, and I will be making a very special announcement, and sharing the ins and outs of our exciting news with you.</p>\n<p>We’ve been working on this quietly behind the scenes for a while, paddling against the COVID tide, and I’m incredibly proud that we can finally launch this next stage of our Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ journey. And make no mistake, there is a lot more on the horizon!</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.49] Jonathan and Sarah make a big announcement!</p>\n<p>[10.38] Jonathan discusses the potential he sees in the opportunity and in the Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ brand.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s a need in supply chain for clarity, for collaboration – because supply chains can be so chaotic, we need to work together&#8230; and those things are possible when we have a platform to facilitate those conversations.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.11] Despite the difficulties of the past year, Jonathan reflects on why now is the right time to embrace something new.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Someone famously said that crises bring opportunity, and I really believe that. There’s two ways to look at the world – pessimistically, or you can see the glimmers of hope and see the chance to change the narrative.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.56] How Jonathan plans to use Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ Asiapac to connect the community.</p>\n<p>[19.55] The growth, and power, of digital marketing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;It has the ability to be really transformational, really quickly.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.46] A closer look at the Asiapac region.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Typically, there hasn’t been a unified voice across that area.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.57] How Jonathan plans to bring his own unique brand to Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ Asiapac.</p>\n<p>[32.45] Jonathan’s passion for stories and how people’s unique journeys can inspire the community.</p>\n<p>[35.45] The launch of Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ Asiapac.</p>\n<p>[37.19] The future for Let’s Talk Supply Chain.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "205: Time To Make A Move, with Knichel Logistics",
    "slug": "episode205",
    "date": "2021-06-21T08:00:06",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19489631/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_205_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"19489631\"></iframe><br />Today I’m super excited to be joined by Knichel Logistics, a woman owned and operated intermodal marketing company specializing in intermodal, LTL, FTL, and specialty services.</p>\n<p>Knichel Logistics is on a mission to be the best third party logistics provider in the industry. Since its inception, its earned a reputation in the transportation industry as a reliable and valuable provider with a dedicated, experienced staff. And the team strive to build and maintain lasting relationships with their carriers so that, with their help, they can provide their customers with the smoothest transportation experience possible.</p>\n<p>Today Kristy Knichel, Owner and President at Knichel Logistics, joins me to chat all about her company, what they do, their unique family-oriented approach and the numerous benefits of working with a certified woman-owned and operated business.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.37] Kristy talks about her journey in logistics, working her way up in the family business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Even if you don’t have a college degree, you can still be successful if you put the time and effort in, work hard and learn.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.45] Kristy reflects on taking over from her Father, and the changes she implemented to make Knichel Logistics the business it is today.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My number one goal was changing the culture and making it a place where people wanted to come to work – even though it’s a challenging environment!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.23] A closer look at the different solutions that Knichel Logistics offer and the kinds of challenges each is suited to solving.</p>\n<p>[20.01] The benefits of engaging in strategic partnerships and the power of collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In the past you would never talk to a competitor. Now, it’s: who can I talk to, how can I help you, how can you help me? And that has been one of the most exciting things for me: it truly does work, and it’s beneficial.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.00] The challenges thrown up by COVID, and the changes the industry will continue to make.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s a lot of companies out there that are going to have to change the way they do business… But as challenging as it’s been, it’s opened up a lot of opportunities.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.23] The benefits of working with a certified WBE/WOSB supplier, and why businesses should be paying attention to supplier diversity.</p>\n<p>[31.15] Kristy discusses the many awards and recognitions she and her business have achieved, and what makes Knichel Logistics so special.</p>\n<p>[35.06] A closer look at Knichel Logistics’ ideal customer.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I like to take risks and help people get to the next level, because if no one gives them a chance, they’re never going to get there.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.12] A case study showing how Knichel Logistics thought outside the box and delivered a fresh solution for a key client.</p>\n<p>[40.15] The future for Knichel Logistics.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Knichel Logistics’ <a href=\"http://www.knichellogistics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Knichel Logistics and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/knichellogistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/knichel-logistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/knichellogistic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Kristy on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/kristy.knichel\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristyknichel/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/kristy1157\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "313e7ea7-edd6-4238-924d-cbea30370a63",
    "episode_number": 204,
    "post_id": 5229,
    "title": "204: Blended &#8211; Handling Diversity in Business: Is there a right or wrong answer?",
    "slug": "episode204",
    "date": "2021-06-16T08:00:41",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19489349/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe><br />\nIt’s Episode 9 and we are growing and improving show after show! We’ve already featured some incredible panellists, who have really opened up, got deep, got vulnerable, and brought some amazing points of view to the table.</p>\n<p>We’ve talked about all sorts of issues – the differences between equality and diversity, the Black Lives Matter movement, the gender equation and last episode, we got real about workplace bullying. It was an emotional one at some points, but yet again, so valuable in opening up the kinds of conversations we need to have to bring visibility to key issues and encourage positive change.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 9, ‘Handling Diversity in Business: Is there a right or wrong answer?’ Madison and I are joined by a new group of inspirational supply chain and DEI professionals who are passionate about people, about social issues in our industry and in the community at large; and they are going to share their insights and experiences with us to help shine a light on the huge topic of the right and wrong ways to handle diversity.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.11] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Rob – CEO at Mercado Labs</li>\n<li>Joselina – Executive Board Member at Zora&#8217;s Cradle</li>\n<li>Kesha – National Diversity &amp; Inclusion Specialist</li>\n<li>Gabby – Principal Consultant at Inclusive Kind</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Diversity should be a core value of every company: how you get there is as much art as it is science, but it should never not be the goal.” Rob</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.01] The group share some personal stories of the wrong ways to handle diversity in the workplace and touch on the kinds of challenges we’re still facing in this area.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Stereotypes and assumptions</li>\n<li>The role of ego</li>\n<li>Conforming and compliance</li>\n<li>Self-awareness, personal development and unconscious bias</li>\n<li>Good intentions vs being intentional</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We should work with people with who they are and what they have to offer, and value that. Diverse teams outperform homogenous teams but many people, for whatever reason, are uncomfortable with what doesn’t look familiar.” Joselina</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.36] The panellists take a closer look at the widespread corporate policy of target setting, and whether this challenges inequality and enhances diversity, or just further commoditises underrepresented groups.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Representation and diversity of thought</li>\n<li>Hiring vs retention</li>\n<li>Compliance and commitment</li>\n<li>Emphasis on employee experience</li>\n<li>Creating safe spaces</li>\n<li>Company vision and legacy</li>\n<li>Differing challenges based on company size and culture</li>\n<li>Goals vs targets</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Diversity and equity work is very purposeful… you need to know where you started from and where you want to get to, so you need to know the numbers to ground that work.” Gabby</p></blockquote>\n<p>[42.09] The group consider the idea of box-ticking, and what that means for company policies and belief systems.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The language we use around DEI</li>\n<li>Policy vs empowerment</li>\n<li>Change management and transformation</li>\n<li>Finding the ‘why’ and tying into culture, mission and values</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[1.00.50] Madison reflects on her appointment as head of Belonging, Inclusion and Culture and the panellists think about the pros and cons of hiring a DEI figurehead.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Personal accountability, advocacy and driving awareness</li>\n<li>DEI as an almost daily evolution</li>\n<li>Authenticity</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Retention is a piece of this equation too: how strong is the culture that enables diverse employees to bring their full selves to work?” Madison</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.12.15] The panellists each give their sum-up from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Be kind – Rob</li>\n<li>Take action – Joselina</li>\n<li>Create equitable foundations, that support everything from fair wages to talent development – Kesha</li>\n<li>Remember that we have the power to re-design the workplace – Gabby</li>\n<li>Be unapologetically you – Madison</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Integrate DEI into every facet of your organisation… make sure you have an equitable foundation that supports everyone.” Kesha</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Madison</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/robertwgarrison/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Rob</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/joselina-peralta/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Joselina</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mrskeshspeaks/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Kesha</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabby-zuniga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Gabby</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19400270/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_203_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19400270\"></iframe>Today I’m thrilled to be joined by Ware2Go, a dynamic company who are changing the landscape of warehousing, fulfilment, and supply chain, by connecting businesses of all sizes to enterprise-grade capabilities and assets that help them compete on previously impossible levels.</p>\n<p>Ware2Go offers a nationwide network of certified warehouses and technology to streamline fulfilment across sales channels for a fully scalable and on-demand solution, making 1-2 day delivery easy and affordable for everyone.</p>\n<p>Today Steve Denton, CEO at Ware2Go, joins me to chat all about Ware2Go, what they do, how customer buying habits are driving innovation in the industry and the future of integrated, flexible and data-driven supply chains.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.00] Steve talks about his incredible journey through the industry, incorporating marketing, ecommerce and supply chain, and how he came to Ware2Go.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I spent 20 years helping companies sell their products online, and the first half of my career helping them to distribute them… so the Ware2Go opportunity was a fascinating place to bring together my entire career.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.03] A closer look at Ware2Go, and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Similar to Uber or Airbnb, we connect merchants who have products to sell with a network of warehouses and stitch them all together with one common technology platform.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.14] Steve reflects on the new trend of micro warehousing.</p>\n<p>[15.02] The easy process of working with Ware2Go.</p>\n<p>[16.26] The importance of flexibility, and how customers can use Ware2Go’s footprint to flex their own offering.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The labor pool is probably the more difficult thing to manage than the capacity.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.54] How supply chain disruption, forecasting issues and a shift from ‘just in time’ to ‘just in case’ are impacting Ware2Go and their customers.</p>\n<p>[26.11] The rise of ecommerce, changing customer buying habits and high expectations, and their impact.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you can meet those demands of transparency, delivery speed, reliability and easy returns&#8230; you’re going to position yourself to win.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.37] Ware2Go’s ideal client.</p>\n<p>[32.12] Steve presents case studies of how Ware2Go helped two key customers pivot at critical times for their businesses.</p>\n<p>[37.16] Steve’s predictions for what the next few years might bring for warehousing, fulfilment and supply chain.</p>\n<p>[41.35] The future for Ware2Go.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Ultimately, we want to level the playing field so that merchants of all sizes can compete, and win, in the world of commerce.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Ware2Go’s <a href=\"https://ware2go.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Ware2Go and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/ware2go/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Ware2Go\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>, or you can connect with Stephen on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sdenton/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SRDenton\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "e5f8cff1-8ee2-48dc-af25-c14618ce3cd0",

    "title": "202: Women In Supply Chain™, Susan Walsh",
    "slug": "episode202",
    "date": "2021-06-07T08:00:21",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19277450/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_202_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19277450\"></iframe>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Susan Walsh: the self-confessed Mistress of Data who uses her expertise in spend data classification, supplier normalisation, and taxonomy customisation to help procurement and data teams across the industry to work more effectively.</p>\n<p>After working in sales and customer account management for big names like Philips and Colgate Palmolive, Susan discovered a passion, and talent, for data. And, having held management positions in various companies, she eventually decided to go it alone. Susan founded The Classification Guru in 2017 and now brings clarity and accuracy to data and procurement; helping teams work more effectively and efficiently by cleaning up their dirty data.</p>\n<p>Today Susan will be talking to us about her career so far, her passion for data, how the industry’s approach to data has changed over the years; and she’ll be sharing her words of advice for all of the up and coming women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics are proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.42] Susan’s background, and the varied career history that led her to her passion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m envious of those people who’ve always known what they wanted to do, because I’ve never known.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.49] The ups and downs of growing The Classification Guru over the last four years.</p>\n<p>[21.00] The role of digital marketing in Susan’s success.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Work with what you’re comfortable with… and don’t do what you think other people want you to do or say or be – just be yourself.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.47] Why Susan’s positive approach and free spirit was sometimes at odds with male-oriented work environments.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’ve never felt, even growing up, that there wasn’t anything I couldn’t do, or that I was restricted because of who I am.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.28] The turning point in Susan’s career that helped her find her voice.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When I found what I really loved, and I had the self-belief and self-confidence, then I felt ‘you can’t take me down, I know I’m good.’ ”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.31] The pitfalls of managing data, and why you need to make sure data always has its COAT on.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s a massive misconception that you can buy some off the shelf software that will fix all of your data problems and you don’t have to do a thing… Automation can help to a point, but it would be naïve to think it can solve all your problems.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[38.50] What Susan has learned about herself over the course of her journey so far.</p>\n<p>[40.30] Susan’s words of advice for the girls and women looking to follow in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with Susan over on <a href=\"https://uk.linkedin.com/in/susanewalsh\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>; head over to The Classification Guru’s <a href=\"https://www.theclassificationguru.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> or follow them on <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ClassificationG\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a> or <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/classificationg/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Instagram</a> to find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "201: Transform PPE into positive change, with LifeCycle Revive",
    "slug": "episode201",
    "date": "2021-05-31T08:00:03",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19247345/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_201_v2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19247345\"></iframe>Today I’m really excited to be joined by LifeCycle Revive, Canada’s first polypropylene PPE waste recycler, diverting from landfill by reclaiming non-contaminated medical waste from Ontario&#8217;s hospitals and reprocessing it into raw materials to create all kinds of new products.</p>\n<p>With a focus on healthcare, manufacturing and retail, LifeCycle Revive is dedicated to creating real environmental and economic change and transforming Canada’s sustainability programs.</p>\n<p>Today Andy Straisfeld, VP of Business Development at Lifecycle Revive, joins me to chat all about Lifecycle Revive, what they do, the importance of a circular economy, and the impact of COVID on the industry’s sustainability plans.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.14] How and why LifeCycle Revive was founded.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re not here to make a profit off the environment – this is a sustainability project.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.26] A closer look at how the process works.</p>\n<p>[12.56] How LifeCycle Revive works with its customers, to best suit their needs and work most efficiently towards their sustainability end goal.</p>\n<p>[19.38] The impact of COVID on PPE use and the innovation and commitment to change that is emerging from the crisis.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our box can fit 1,500 masks and in a popular spot, like a mall, hospital or college, it could fill up within 2 days.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.51] The circular economy and why there’s ‘gold in garbage.’</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If we tackle the issues of that garbage, reclaim from the landfills, not only will we create an economic powerhouse, we’ll give people green jobs and take care of our society.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.38] A closer look at LifeCycle Revive’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[31.44] A key customer case study, showing how LifeCycle Revive transformed one hospital&#8217;s approach to their waste.</p>\n<p>[35.03] Andy’s reflections on what the next few years might bring when it comes to the industry’s approach to waste and sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s all about the landfill – why do we send stuff there, do we actually need to? Recycling generates business, economy: it’s the right thing to do.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.14] The future for LifeCycle Revive.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re so excited that we’re part of the solution, not the problem.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to LifeCycle Revive’s <a href=\"https://www.lifecyclerevive.ca/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with LifeCycle Revive and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/lifecycle-revive/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or you can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/andy-straisfeld/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Andy</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "d0c927e0-4550-4783-a9fc-78c1f7ef6d69",

    "post_id": 5022,
    "title": "200: Sarah and Friends",
    "slug": "episode200",
    "date": "2021-05-24T08:00:07",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19177799/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_200_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19177799\"></iframe>Today is an extra special episode, since we’re celebrating a big milestone. Back in 2016, a male co-host and I started a podcast called “Two Babes Talk Supply Chain.” But over time, things evolved. My co-host left the show, and when I launched the Women In Supply Chain™ series, I realized there were quite a few people who weren’t too keen on the name…!</p>\n<p>So in April 2018 I re-branded the show (within a week, which I still can’t quite believe!). Let’s Talk Supply Chain was born – and I haven’t looked back.</p>\n<p>This is the 200<sup>th</sup> episode, as Let’s Talk Supply Chain, and last month we celebrated our three year anniversary. Wow! The last three years have been filled with opportunities and conversations I could’ve only dreamed of. There have been so many highs and lows; times where I&#8217;ve doubted myself and times where I felt like I could take on the world! And it&#8217;s safe to say I&#8217;ve learnt a lot about the industry, and myself, along the way.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m proud of myself for persevering; I’m proud of the ideas I’ve taken and run with; I’m proud of myself for not giving up.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>And for the last year, I’ve grown some amazing connections – mostly virtual – and brought together a group of talented, smart and supportive people that have changed my life for the better.</p>\n<p>And that group includes the incredible <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sscuddermarketingstrategist/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Sarah Scudder</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/briansglick/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Brian Glick</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alison-cusack/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Alison Cusack</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Madison Mobley</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/larry-leung/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Larry Leung</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lisafentoncscmp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Lisa Fenton</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dodeja/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Akshay Dodeja</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/angiereno/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Angie Reno</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-kempe/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Jonathan Kempe</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/audrey-ross-citp-3422a153/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Audrey Ross</a>.</p>\n<p>In this episode, you’ll get a sneak peek into the banter, conversations and love that happens on our not-to-be-missed weekly happy hours. We’ve shared ideas, celebrated 40<sup>th</sup> birthdays, worked together, helped each other through lockdown and spurred each other on to do better, day after day.</p>\n<p>Today, they’ll be sharing stories, their favourite memories of me, asking me questions and so much more. So grab your tissues (it gets emotional!) and join my friends and I on this very special trip down memory lane as we celebrate Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s 200<sup>th</sup> episode.</p>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\">Sarah x</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\">Sarah is so approachable and engaging; helpful in reaching out and proving support, and a lot of times we don’t see that in a business setting.” Akshay</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\"><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-5023\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-2-300x140.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"370\" height=\"172\" title=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-2-300x140.jpg 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-2-600x279.jpg 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-2-768x357.jpg 768w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-2.jpg 1023w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 370px) 100vw, 370px\" /></p>\n<blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\">“Sarah is so welcoming. She’s created a loving group of people; micro and macro pods of inclusivity… where you can show up as yourself.” Alison.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\"><img decoding=\"async\" class=\"size-medium wp-image-5024 aligncenter\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-300x215.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"215\" title=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-300x215.jpg 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-600x431.jpg 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51-768x551.jpg 768w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/IMG_05-17-2021_13-36-51.jpg 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\">“Sarah has an ability to make people feel seen, and I’m so thankful for that.” Madison</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p data-wp-editing=\"1\">\n",

  {
    "uuid": "bf1051ab-4c3b-44dd-bfe1-218925b5eccc",
    "episode_number": 199,
    "post_id": 4980,
    "title": "199: Blended &#8211; From the classroom to the boardroom: the truth about workplace bullying",
    "slug": "episode199",
    "date": "2021-05-19T08:00:24",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19138433/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>I cannot believe we’re already at Episode 8 of Blended! I’m so proud of how the show has been received so far, and the positivity and open-mindedness that I’m hearing from you all is so inspiring – it shows how many of us really are open to educating ourselves, supporting our communities and making changes for the future.</p>\n<p>Episode 8 also marks a change for Blended, as the absolutely fabulous Madison Mobley has agreed to join me as regular co-host!</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 8, ‘From the classroom to the boardroom: the truth about workplace bullying,’ Madison and I are joined by a new group of inspirational supply chain professionals who are passionate about people and about social issues in our industry and in the community at large; and they share their stories with us to help shine a light on the big topic of workplace bullying.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.59] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Everette – Director, North America at Lyric Robot</li>\n<li>Grant – President at Procurigence, Inc.</li>\n<li>Judi – LinkedIn Business Accelerator</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[09.31] The group discuss the difference between bullying, harassment and micro-aggressions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When you’re in a workplace, and somebody takes your power, it quickly brings you back to that place when you were a child.” Everette.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.21] The panellists share their different experiences of bullying, both personally and professionally.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>What drives acts of bullying, harassment and micro-aggression?</li>\n<li>The victim’s struggle with ‘Why me?’</li>\n<li>The role of job title, position and location in bullying.</li>\n<li>Why victims often choose to just ‘suck it up.’</li>\n<li>How to identify red flags.</li>\n<li>The impact of power struggles.</li>\n<li>The role of technology and the impact of COVID on bullying.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“As the primary caregiver, the weight of that was so heavy, I was nervous to disrupt my income… I was willing to put myself through anything.” Judi</p></blockquote>\n<p>[49.17] The group reflect on how we can call out bullying.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Opening up conversations and the words we use.</li>\n<li>The role of personal responsibility.</li>\n<li>Training and education.</li>\n<li>The importance of empathy.</li>\n<li>Conscious and unsubconscious bias; and social conditioning.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“… occasionally you have to use a little bit of force. But sometimes by doing that you can give someone an ‘a-ha!’ moment.” Grant.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.24.18] The panellists each give their key sum-up from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Normalise open conversations and don’t get too hung up on solutions – Judi</li>\n<li>Treat other people the way you want to be treated – Grant</li>\n<li>Put a focus on trauma, and how that unfolds in behaviors – Everette</li>\n<li>Align therapy, leadership and growth in the workplace – Madison</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Madison</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/everettephillips/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Everette</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/j-grant-caplan/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Grant</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/judiwfox/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Judi</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "b20c3861-2a00-4b3c-a5aa-732cd8f3a4b1",

    "post_id": 4964,
    "title": "198: Unlock the untapped potential of a connected workforce, with ProGlove",
    "slug": "episode198",
    "date": "2021-05-17T08:00:01",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/19077536/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_198_v2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"19077536\"></iframe>Today I’m really excited to be joined by ProGlove, an innovative German engineering company who are bringing award-winning wearable technology to industry. Combining precision engineering and big data analytics with a focus on the human worker, their technology is reducing costs, redefining efficiency and improving health and safety.</p>\n<p>ProGlove takes a truly human-centric approach to innovation, shaping the future of smart wearables for industry 4.0. From picking and inventory management through to packing and track and trace, ProGlove technology allows your business to ensure accuracy, speed and safety at every point of a products journey. And, gives you the visibility and data you need to accelerate your supply chain, lower costs and improve customer satisfaction.</p>\n<p>Today Ilhan Kolko, Chief Product Officer at ProGlove, joins me to chat all about ProGlove, what they do, their refreshing person-led approach and the future of IoT technology.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.40] How and why ProGlove was founded, and the fascinating journey to where it is now.</p>\n<p>[08.28] A closer look at ProGlove, what it does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<p>[10.29] Wearable vs traditional technology, and the benefit of ProGlove solutions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We anonymise the data as soon as it leaves the worker, so it’s now about the process, not about the worker.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.36] What the ProGlove device looks like, how it’s tested and a brief history of wearable technologies.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We balance the user delight, the technical side and the ruggedness and durability of the product.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.34] ProGlove’s integrated technology and how it brings connectivity, visibility and analytics together to improve workflow.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The promise of making this a human-centered, user-friendly product led us to the path of building connectivity software around it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.42] The process of integrating ProGlove technology into your business, and the commitment that comes along with it.</p>\n<p>[25.01] ProGlove’s unique approach to combining people and technology.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not a competition – it’s a collaboration.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.08] How ProGlove’s human-centric approach translates to their own workforce.</p>\n<p>[30.46] A closer look at ProGlove’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[32.12] A real-life example of how ProGlove’s technology helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“With a handheld scanner, it takes at least 6 seconds to scan an item; now imagine you’re scanning a thousand parts per shift.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.58] What the future might hold for wearable technology, and for ProGlove.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to ProGlove’s <a href=\"https://www.proglove.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with ProGlove and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/proglove/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or you can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/aikolko/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Ilhan</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "92f1a50d-b336-48ec-a574-c25285bd6bc9",
    "episode_number": 197,
    "post_id": 4941,
    "title": "197: Beat the Market, with Bid Ops",
    "slug": "episode197",
    "date": "2021-05-10T08:00:51",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18955802/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_197_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18955802\"></iframe>Today I’m honored to be joined by Bid Ops, a cutting edge company with supplier diversity and sourcing collaboration at their heart, who deliver strategic sourcing software powered by AI.</p>\n<p>Using intelligent price recommendations and dynamic benchmarks, Bid Ops AI helps procurement teams overcome complexity to secure optimal commercial terms with top suppliers. Combining strategic sourcing and collaboration with supplier management and diversity, and even automated negotiations, the Bid Ops platform helps you to skip the back and forth and choose the right supplier, at the best price, quicker and smarter.</p>\n<p>Today Edmund Zagorin, founder and CEO at Bid Ops Inc., joins me to chat all about his journey in strategic sourcing, how he came to found Bid Ops, exactly what the company does to help its customers and the role of AI in the future of technology.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.38] Edmund’s background and his journey from a degree in Philosophy, International Affairs &amp; Public Policy to a career as a procurement entrepreneur.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Once I began to see how procurement was transforming digitally, and the speed of that transformation, that was where the experience I had as an undergrad studying social movements really clicked.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.49] A closer look at Bid Ops, what it does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When you use recommended pricing… you actually get, not just faster process velocity, but there’s more clarity, trust and collaboration in the process, and that corresponds with cost savings.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.49] Bid Ops automated negotiations, and Edmund&#8217;s reflections on digital transformation and the evolution of procurement.</p>\n<p>[19.55] The recent drive in supplier diversity, and how the Bid Ops platform makes it quick and easy for businesses to build their own supplier diversity program, track it and report it.</p>\n<p>[26.27] Bid Ops commitment to integration and the changing technology behind it.</p>\n<p>[30.01] The ideal customer for Bid Ops.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our ideal client is a procurement team that has more work than it has people!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.49] A real life case study of how the Bid Ops platform saved a key customer significant time and money, resulting in board-level recognition.</p>\n<p>[34.39] Edmund’s advice for supply chain entrepreneurs and start-ups.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s never been a better time to innovate in supply chain and procurement than right now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.30] The future for Bid Ops.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Bid Ops <a href=\"https://bidops.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Bid Ops and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/bidops/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "3ca825bd-e188-461c-9fd2-911f63dbffed",
    "episode_number": 196,
    "post_id": 4903,
    "title": "196: Women In Supply Chain™, Madison Mobley",
    "slug": "episode196",
    "date": "2021-05-03T08:00:48",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18836237/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_196_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18836237\"></iframe>In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Madison Mobley: a woman who’s shaking things up in supply chain, through her advocacy and passion for diversity and inclusion within the industry.</p>\n<p>Having steadily climbed the ranks in the business areas of sales, customer management and HR at Dell and Proctor &amp; Gamble, Madison decided to follow her heart – and when she joined Fairmarkit, a procurement tech start-up, in 2020, everything changed. Quickly spotting her unique combination of passion and talent, Fairmarkit believed in Madison’s potential to change the industry, supporting her external ambassadorship roles and recently appointing her Head of Belonging, Inclusion, &amp; Culture.</p>\n<p>Today Madison will be talking to us about her career so far, her passion for procurement and why honest and open conversations around diversity and inclusion are key. And she’ll be sharing her experiences and words of advice with us all.</p>\n<h2>SHOW SPONSOR:</h2>\n<p>Apex Logistics are proud to sponsor Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s Women In Supply Chain™ podcast and blog series. Our leadership team actively works to empower an industry as diverse as our workforce with a focus on inclusion, and we’re passionate about promoting the voices of women leaders to drive visibility around their achievements. Find out more over on the Apex Logistics <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<h2>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</h2>\n<p>[07.00] Madison’s background, and her journey from a sociology degree, with ambition to become a journalist, to a career in tech sales.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I joined EMC’s tech sales boot camp – and the rest is history!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.58] How the experiences and opportunities for growth that Madison gained at Dell shaped her career.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Those years fuelled my appetite for well-roundedness. I was empowered to learn a lot.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.40] How Madison ensured she stood out in the workplace, and her words of advice for being your authentic self.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“More than anything else, knowing yourself and knowing where you feel most comfortable bringing everything that you are – those are the spaces that you’re meant to grow in and influence others.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.19] Why Madison made the jump from big business to tech start up.</p>\n<p>[20.24] What Madison loves about supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I can’t say how much I wish I had been exposed to the art of supply chain fresh out of school – my perspective on business would have evolved so much quicker.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.38] Madison’s new role as Head of Belonging, Inclusion, &amp; Culture at Fairmarkit.</p>\n<p>[26.52] Madison’s experiences of racism and homophobia, her reflections on privilege and why she’s so passionate about advocating, and making space for, underrepresented voices.</p>\n<p>[32.45] Madison’s short and longer term goals for diversity and inclusion within the industry.</p>\n<p>[36.02] Why Madison chose to join the Let’s Talk Supply Chain family.</p>\n<p>[40.12] What the future holds for Madison.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m arms wide open to whatever is meant for me.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[42.26] Madison’s words of advice for all the girls and women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</h2>\n<p>You can connect with Madison over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or head over to Fairmarkit’s <a href=\"https://www.fairmarkit.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "ea80d65e-aef4-48e8-88c3-8952204fbf44",

    "title": "195: Run your Supply Chain Operations on Autopilot, with Throughput Inc.",
    "slug": "episode195",
    "date": "2021-04-26T08:00:56",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18740933/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_195_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18740933\"></iframe>Today I’m thrilled to be joined by <a href=\"https://tinyurl.com/9pr4jck4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Throughput Inc.</a>, a company who believe that when operations, business and investors run smoother, workers, communities, society and the environment benefit – a truly refreshing approach.</p>\n<p>And with Throughput software, your business benefits from a single source of truth to take accurate data-driven decisions and drive sustainable growth and profitability. Striving to create resilient and unifying supply chains, Throughput’s holistic and insight-driven software unlocks operations agility and efficiency, to meet unpredictable customer demands, while creating uninterrupted flow of materials through supply chain networks.</p>\n<p>Today Ali Raza, founder and CEO at Throughput Inc., joins me to chat all about exactly what Throughput does, the importance of visibility, harnessing the power of AI and the future of effective supply chains.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.25] Ali’s background and his journey across industries and countries to eventually found Throughput.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We can prepare better, by having a more global perspective.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.13] A closer look at Throughput: its foundations, what it does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Why don’t we have technologies today that help us get into the analytics on the operations side to make the right decisions, and scale it?”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.26] Ali’s reflections on visibility and what it means to Throughput, and to supply chain as a whole.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Everyone’s connecting all the data and saying ‘look at the visibility, now you can see everything’ – but visibility isn’t the same thing as flow.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.09] How Throughput software ‘puts global industrial operations on autopilot.’</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Most businesses make or move stuff so ultimately there’s an output problem, a demand problem and a financial problem. And if you can tie all three of those together and run it in synchrony, you have an autopilot system.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.10] Throughput’s recent classification as a ‘top 10 highly disruptive supply chain start-up’ and why innovation comes from real-world experience and problems, not just from new technology.</p>\n<p>[29.57] A closer look at Throughput’s ideal client.</p>\n<p>[33.10] A key case study and exactly how Throughput’s software helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;When you have better material flow, you unlock hidden capacity.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.23] The future for Throughput and Ali’s predictions for what the next few years might hold for the industry.</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Throughput’s <a href=\"https://tinyurl.com/9pr4jck4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Throughput and keep up to date with the latest over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/throughput/?viewAsMember=true\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/throughputinc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a> and <a href=\"https://twitter.com/throughput_inc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/195.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/195-300x201.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/195-300x201.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/195.png 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"
