  {
    "uuid": "5bbd46c6-b4a3-4ed5-b607-86c39bd0d273",
    "episode_number": 194,
    "post_id": 4856,
    "title": "194: Blended &#8211; Equality vs Diversity: What&#8217;s The Difference?",
    "slug": "episode194",
    "date": "2021-04-21T08:00:19",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18748952/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the seventh episode of our new show, Blended. Hopefully by now, you know exactly what Blended is all about. We’re opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA+ community, people of colour, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more. And we’re getting candid, and sometimes uncomfortable, so we can challenge the status quo together and help move the industry forward for everyone.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 7, ‘Equality vs Diversity: What the Difference?,’ I’m joined by another group of amazing supply chain professionals who are passionate about the issues of equality and diversity and will be sharing their experiences, research and points of view with us, so we can open up this huge topic and tackle it head on.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[00.23] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Julie – Manager Business Systems Analysis at AMD</li>\n<li>Adrian – Director of Procurement Strategy and Innovation at Help My Bid</li>\n<li>Sabrina – Contract Specialist for the U.S Army Corps of Engineers</li>\n<li>Julian – Vocational Expert and Career Counsellor</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Diversity and inclusion means for me: treating everybody as a human being, with respect, kindness, humility and without judgement.” Julie</p></blockquote>\n<p>[04.34] The group discuss the difference between equality and diversity.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The nuances around the words equality, equity, diversity and inclusion.</li>\n<li>Can businesses build strategies to tackle the issues of equality and diversity if they don’t understand how they align with their core values?</li>\n<li>Has diversity replaced equality?</li>\n<li>Backing up intention with real action and policy.</li>\n<li>The layers within diversity and appreciating the different perspectives behind the person.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Are we holding our standards up to what our core values are, things like transparency, ethics, responsibility – so when you talk about equality does it all mesh and align?” Sabrina</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.29] The panellists reflect on what the picture of diversity looks like at company level.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Diversity targets and percentages.</li>\n<li>Where is the diversity located within the company – what are the levels of influence, and who are the decision makers?</li>\n<li>The importance of continuing to learn and improve.</li>\n<li>Does diversity policy actually represent everyone?</li>\n<li>The risk of alienating certain groups, by accident, whilst championing others.</li>\n<li>Fear of change.</li>\n<li>The need for people to be uncomfortable.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“If we’re all going to enjoy this place we’re creating, we all need to give a little. And when you start to do that, you really participate in the word equality by incorporating values and cultures that are important to others.” Julian</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.18] The group take a closer look at the word ‘racism.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Its definition and connotations.</li>\n<li>Race as a modern invention designed to segregate and create hierarchy.</li>\n<li>Historical power and systems – who benefits?</li>\n<li>Can white people experience racism?</li>\n<li>Prejudice vs racism.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Racism goes hand in hand with stereotyping. When we can get to a place of treating everybody on their own merit, then the chance for racism minimizes because we’re treating everyone as an individual.” Julian</p></blockquote>\n<p>[57.09] The panellists discuss the term ‘white privilege.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Does white privilege exist?</li>\n<li>Understanding the phrase – is it positive, negative or neutral?</li>\n<li>How do we use privilege for good?</li>\n<li>The importance of auditing privilege and being proactive about dismantling structures that give you privilege whilst subjugating others.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“White privilege just means that your race doesn’t put you at a disadvantage in society, but people get very wrapped up in the polarity of that phrase.” Sabrina</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.13.38] The group give their ideas on how to start to create practical change, within the workforce and the wider community.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Conduct self-study, research, ask questions and have open conversations from the heart.</li>\n<li>Be deliberate in your actions towards creating equity.</li>\n<li>Start with the people you already have in your workforce and ask them how they could be better heard and included.</li>\n<li>Remove unconscious bias from the hiring process.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We are living experiences all at the same time, but we’re experiencing the same situation in different ways.” Adrian</p></blockquote>\n<p>[1.24.36] The panellists each give their sum-up for creating meaningful change.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Be intentional – Adrian</li>\n<li>Be authentic – Julie</li>\n<li>Be human – Julian</li>\n<li>Listen – Sabrina</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Unless you audit what you’re doing, and you’re intentional about your action, it won’t change – just having the people in the room doesn’t make any difference.” Adrian</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/julieshum/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Julie</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/adrian-betton-mcips-chartered-b-eng-8bb2564/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Adrian</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sabrina-booker-b57584123/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Sabrina</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/julian-shields-m-s-crc-8138a5132/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Julian</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts HERE.</p>\n",

    "title": "193: Closing the Gap between Shippers and Forwarders, with Shipz",
    "slug": "episode193",
    "date": "2021-04-19T08:00:29",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18706583/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_193_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18706583\"></iframe><br />Welcome to a very special episode of Let’s Talk Supply Chain! Today’s host is Jonathan Kempe, the CEO &amp; Founder of Verifai, an Australian company with a global presence, that uses technology to increase supply chain security, visibility and transparency. And his esteemed guest is: Sarah Barnes-Humphrey!</p>\n<p>Sarah is not only the founder and host of Let’s Talk Supply Chain. She is also the co-founder and CEO of new technology start-up, <a href=\"https://www.shipz.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Shipz Inc</a>. Shipz is an award-wining freight marketplace that is working to simplify the complexity often found in logistics; the platform closes the gap between shippers and forwarders, creating an accessible, affordable and hassle-free logistics solution for all.</p>\n<p>Today Sarah tells Jonathan all about her background, how she came to found Shipz, all the positives the platform is bringing to the market and what the future might bring for international shipping.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.29] An introduction to Sarah and what she loves about international shipping.</p>\n<p>[07.08] Sarah’s journey in supply chain and how she came to found Shipz.</p>\n<p>[12.42] A closer look at exactly what Shipz does, and the problems it solves for both mid-market shippers and freight providers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For a shipper, it takes 101 hours, 40 emails and 20 phone calls just to get a shipment quoted and booked.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.19] How collaboration, visibility, sustainability and data form part of the long-term Shipz roadmap.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Collaboration is the future of business – and it’s at the forefront of everything I do. Winning together is my philosophy.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.42] Sarah’s reflections on launching Shipz against the backdrop of the pandemic.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You have to try, you have to test, you have to see what’s going to stick with the customer – from marketing messages to product.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.21] The role that platforms like Shipz can play in minimizing disruption and bringing efficiencies to day-to-day business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In some tech, we’re actually getting ahead of our customers: we’ve got to meet them where they are. We’ve got to take what they’re doing and make it easier for them.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.10] A profile of Shipz’ ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[31.30] How the Shipz features are laser-targeted to customer needs, and the positive feedback Sarah has seen so far.</p>\n<p>[37.06] Sarah’s reflections on what the next few years will hold for supply chain and international shipping.</p>\n<p>[41.15] Why Shipz is a signatory of the Neptune Declaration, and the importance of paying attention to industry welfare issues.</p>\n<p>[44.16] The future for Shipz.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re going to continue to listen to our customers, and build features based on their feedback.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Shipz’ <a href=\"https://www.shipz.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and sign up for a FREE trial now.</p>\n<p>There are lots of ways you can connect with Shipz, to find out what the team are up to: follow Shipz on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/iloveshipz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/iloveshipz\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/iloveshipz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Instagram</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/shipz/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "192: Make content the cornerstone of your strategy, with TopRank Marketing",
    "slug": "episode192",
    "date": "2021-04-12T08:00:31",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18621098/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_192_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18621098\"></iframe><br />Today I’m super excited to welcome <a href=\"https://www.toprankmarketing.com/influencer-marketing-supply-chain/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">TopRank Marketing</a>, a business that has earned a reputation as a first-choice digital marketing agency for major brands including McKesson, Dell and LinkedIn. Serving companies in the B2B technology, healthcare and servtopices industries, as well as B2C companies operating online, over the past 20 years they’ve developed some tried and tested insights and methodologies for tackling the most difficult digital marketing and PR challenges.</p>\n<p>Established back in 2001, TopRank’s talented team of smart, creative and results-focused digital marketing professionals, work alongside their clients to achieve common goals and solve business challenges. Through a combination of content marketing, SEO, influencer marketing and social media marketing expertise, they deliver impressive results.</p>\n<p>Today Susan Misukanis, Founder and President at TopRank Marketing, joins me to chat all about what TopRank do, how B2B marketing has changed, why it’s so important, and what the future is going to bring for the industry.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.09] Susan’s background and how she came to found TopRank Marketing 20 years ago.</p>\n<p>[09.03] A closer look at TopRank, what they do and how they help their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our focus is to help B2B clients to guide their buying customer’s journey.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.46] How marketing has changed over the years, particularly in the B2B space.</p>\n<p>[15.41] A closer look at B2B influencer campaigns: what are they and what are the benefits you could see from running them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can beat your chest and say ‘my product is the best.’ Or, you could partner with smart thinkers like influencers and bring visionary stories to the market to increase your reach to a wider audience.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.55] Embracing change and the mindset you need to harness the power of marketing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The change is not that profound! It doesn’t have to be scary, just stick to the fundamentals.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.26] The ups and downs of businesses investment in, and approach towards, marketing.</p>\n<p>[26.00] Susan’s words of advice for developing a strong marketing strategy.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Any kind of business has a profound story. It’s how you perceive what you do and make your story profound – be deliberate about how you craft that story. ”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.31] Why TopRank’s ideal client is more about mindset than size.</p>\n<p>[31.36] TopRank’s perspective on success and how they work with clients to deliver personalized results.</p>\n<p>[34.30] Susan’s reflections on what the future might hold for B2B marketing.</p>\n<p>[37.08] The future for TopRank Marketing.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to TopRank Marketing’s <a href=\"https://www.toprankmarketing.com/influencer-marketing-supply-chain/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Connect with Susan on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/smisukanis/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> and follow TopRank on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/toprank-online-marketing/mycompany/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "f47af1d4-dce4-4c08-8211-81344c305fbb",

    "title": "191: Women In Supply Chain™, Lora Cecere",
    "slug": "episode191",
    "date": "2021-04-05T08:00:27",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18580496/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_191_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18580496\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Lora Cecere. She’s had an impressively long-standing and diverse career, working in software, marketing and research for some big industry names from Proctor &amp; Gamble to Kraft, before breaking away and starting her own firm, <a href=\"https://supplychaininsights.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Supply Chain Insights</a>, in 2012.</p>\n<p>Through Supply Chain Insights, Lora works with supply chain leaders to take teams to higher levels of excellence. With research in her veins, Lora’s firm focuses on the changing face of enterprise technologies, paving new directions in building thought-leading supply chain research. And as if that didn’t keep her busy enough, Lora is also the author of popular blog ‘Supply Chain Shaman,’ a columnist for several industry publications and the author of two books (to date!)</p>\n<p>Today Lora will be talking to us about her incredible career so far, her passion for research, the creativity and connection she finds through writing and the future of supply chain.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>This Women In Supply Chain™ feature was made possible by our sponsor, <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Apex Logistics</a>. Apex Logistics International Inc is deeply rooted in diversity and culture, led by our own “Woman in Supply Chain” CEO, Elsie Qian; these values are why we partnered with Let’s Talk Supply Chain for the Women In Supply Chain™ series. Apex is recognized as one of the fastest-growing Top 25 airfreight forwarders in the world, with a network of over 2500 global employees in more than 70 countries.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.56] Lora’s background, her major career transitions and the journey that brought her to where she is now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I hope that, when I retire, people will say ‘she told it like it is, we believed in her and she was independent.’ ”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.59] How Lora came to found Supply Chain Insights.</p>\n<p>[13.49] From personal creativity to helping others, Lora reflects on her passion for writing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The whole process of writing is fascinating to me – and that learning is a journey that never ends.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.49] Lora’s varied experiences as a woman in a male dominated industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I probably wouldn’t be Lora Cecere in the role I am now if Proctor and Gamble hadn’t been so inclusive in diversity.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.51] Lora’s take on how the industry has changed over the years, and her predictions for future trends.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The definition of the office, and the meeting, will be totally different. We can constantly evolve how we work.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.18] Lora’s reflections on what a woman’s voice truly is, and the three different ways she discovered her own.</p>\n<p>[37.30] From travelling less to her ongoing contributions to the industry, what the future holds for Lora.</p>\n<p>[39.29] Lora’s words of wisdom for the next generation of Women In Supply Chain™.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>There are so many ways you can follow or connect with Lora: <u><a href=\"http://www.linkedin.com/in/loracecere\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a></u>, <a href=\"http://www.linkedin.com/today/author/446631\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn Influencer</a>, <a href=\"http://twitter.com/lcecere\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>. Check out her <a href=\"http://www.supplychainshaman.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">blog</a>, or read her writing over on <a href=\"http://www.forbes.com/sites/loracecere\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Forbes</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode190",
    "date": "2021-03-26T08:00:13",
    "video_id": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18454712/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_190_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18454712\"></iframe>Today I’m delighted to welcome <a href=\"https://www.leftspire.com/ltsc-ddt-episode\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Demand Driven Technologies</a>, the premier provider of next generation materials, inventory and production control planning and execution applications for the new demand driven world.</p>\n<p>Demand Driven Technologies is the first and most widely used enterprise-class Demand Driven MRP Supply Chain Planning Software, that provides superior materials, inventory, production scheduling and execution technology. Working across the automotive, healthcare and food and beverage industries, they’re growing quickly and even expanded into Europe last year, despite the huge challenges of the global pandemic.</p>\n<p>Today Brad Mitchler, VP of Partners and Products at Demand Driven Technologies, joins me to chat all about what Demand Driven do, visibility and consumer demand in supply chain, the impact of e-commerce and what the future is going to bring for demand driven supply chains.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.25] An overview of Demand Driven Technologies (DDTech).</p>\n<p>[08.42] The difference between demand driven supply chain and traditional supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The traditional way has worked fairly well, but we’re in a different place today – we demand a lot more product variety, speed to market, and there are shorter customer tolerance times.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.05] How companies can move from a traditional forecasting model to a demand driven approach, and how DDTech’s solutions can facilitate that.</p>\n<p>[14.02] The lessons COVID has taught us, and the importance of resiliency and agility.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Now is a more important time than ever to have an approach to planning your supply chain that is fluid, dynamic and resilient.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.23] Brad’s thoughts on visibility – what it means and why it’s so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Often the more mature the supply chain is, the less visibility they have. So being able to present a single source of truth is a real unsung benefit of the demand driven application.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.33] A key customer success story.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“They got through COVID and maintained a 96% service level by leveraging our software.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.26] An overview of DDTech’s existing, and ideal, clients.</p>\n<p>[31.28] Brad’s reflections on the future for the market.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“All signs point to further growth.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.57] The future for DDTech.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Demand Driven Technologies’ <a href=\"https://www.leftspire.com/ltsc-ddt-episode\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Connect with Brad on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/bradleymitchler/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or follow DDTech over on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/ddtech\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ddtechies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a> or <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/demand-driven-technologies\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18285743/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" libsyn_item_id=\"18285743\"></iframe><br />This is the fourth and final episode in our “Delivering Apex” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Apex Logistics</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in Episode 3, “Breaking Ground,” I was joined by Beth Parker, Business Development Manager at Apex, to discuss sales and marketing in logistics – how it’s evolved over the years, the challenges thrown up by COVID and exactly how Apex have been using their sales and marketing functions to support their business mission this past year.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, “One Byte At A Time,” I’m joined by Amanda Nazareno, Senior Product Manager at Apex, to talk all about technology: the emerging trends, the importance of using tech to enhance visibility and how Apex are staying ahead of the curve.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.05] An introduction to Amanda, her role at Apex and her reflections on technology in supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“People would be surprised by the volume of investment in innovation, in all areas of supply chain.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[02.43] How the COVID crisis accelerated the need for new technology and increased connectivity.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The pandemic has really forced companies to break down functional silos and build interconnected people, data, processes – and all of that is enabled by technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.36] Whether businesses need true end to end solutions, or better integration between platforms.</p>\n<p>[07.55] Key upcoming technology trends, including growth in all areas that enable predictability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s a constant chase for radical and revolutionary solutions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.39] How Apex tech can help businesses to take control and mitigate risk.</p>\n<p>[12.29] Visibility: myth vs reality.</p>\n<p>[16.50] The importance of data.</p>\n<p>[20.39] How Apex taps into customer needs and uses collaboration to stay ahead of the curve.</p>\n<p>[23.50] What the future holds for Apex.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re going to have a focus on data that’s enabling transparency and agility.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Apex Logistics’ <a     "slug": "episode188",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18362801/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_188_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18362801\"></iframe><br />Today I’m delighted to be joined by <a href=\"https://www.colliers.com/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Colliers International</a> &#8211; a global leader in real estate, diversified professional services and investment management. They operate in sectors all the way from Government to golf courses, and provide expertise on everything from valuations to project management.</p>\n<p>With operations in 67 countries, more than 18,000 enterprising professionals work collaboratively to provide expert advice to real estate occupiers, owners and investors. With annualized revenues of over $3 billion, Colliers are maximizing the potential of property and accelerating the success of their clients and people.</p>\n<p>Today Matt McGregor, Executive Vice President at Colliers International, joins me to chat all about Colliers wide range of services and sectors, key changes in the market and exactly what businesses should be considering right now when it comes to property.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.54] A look at who Colliers are, what they do and the types of customers they work with.</p>\n<p>[10.32] Why Matt chose to pursue further education in supply chain management and why it’s so important that brokers understand where industrial real estate fits into the customer’s bigger picture.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We asked some key clients, and the biggest thing that came back was that brokerages didn’t really understand their industries.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.33] What Colliers are seeing with regard to sustainability advancements in industrial real estate.</p>\n<p>[18.36] The growth of e-commerce in light of COVID, what it means for warehousing and retail, and Matt’s predictions for the future.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“At the end of 2019, 14% of all retail sales were online. Fast-forward to the end of 2020, 36% was online – a massive growth. That was all the growth we would have had in the next 5-7 years.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.57] From an increase in drone technology and autonomous trucks, to multi-story warehouses and much larger yard space, key changes and trends in industrial real estate.</p>\n<p>[31.20] The impact of COVID on Matt and his team, as well as on his customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For our clients, trying to separate people dramatically drove labor costs up and slowed production down.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.57] What distribution, fulfillment and manufacturing businesses should be thinking about when it comes to property in 2021.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You’ve got to understand the supply chain, and the disruptors.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.38] A key customer case study.</p>\n<p>[41.16] From an investment in tech to a commitment to innovation, what the future holds for Colliers.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Collier’s <a href=\"https://www.colliers.com/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Connect with Matt on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mattmcgregor/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, and follow <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/colliers/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Colliers</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18285461/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" libsyn_item_id=\"18285461\"></iframe>This is the third episode in our “Delivering Apex” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Apex Logistics</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in Episode 2, “We Deliver Passion,” I was joined by Sangna Mistry Kuhia, Vice President of Human Resources and Organizational Development at Apex, to talk about people – the ins and out of hiring and retention, Apex’s people-led approach and why a motivated, dedicated and passionate workforce is the key to success.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 3, “Breaking Ground,” I’m joined by Beth Parker, Business Development Manager at Apex, to discuss sales and marketing in logistics – how it’s evolved over the years, the challenges thrown up by COVID and exactly how Apex have been using their sales and marketing functions to support their business mission this past year.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.08] An introduction to Beth and her role at Apex.</p>\n<p>[03.28] How sales has changed over the last decade.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The biggest change has been technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.12] Key Apex services, including chartered air freight.</p>\n<p>[08.49] Marketing as an extension of sales, and why it’s so important that the two teams work hand in hand.</p>\n<p>[12.05] How marketing has evolved and the importance of embracing change.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You have to change with the times or you die!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.48] The synergy between sales and marketing and how Apex leverages that power.</p>\n<p>[18.42] The ways in which good marketing can really help to support a company and why some businesses might need to rethink the way they view marketing.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When businesses only look at marketing as a cost center, it really puts them at a disadvantage.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.33] Do your research and get educated, Beth’s advice for today’s sales teams.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Persistence wins – sales is a marathon, not a sprint.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.17] A closer look at some of the challenges thrown up by COVID when it comes to sales.</p>\n<p>[28.43] Challenges and trends for the coming year and how sales can use that knowledge to start discussions with potential customers.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Apex Logistics’ <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "592a3e42-ed97-4c74-8bde-fc8039f57f15",
    "episode_number": 186,
    "post_id": 4725,
    "title": "186: Blended &#8211; My Journey",
    "slug": "episode186",
    "date": "2021-03-17T08:00:05",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18254771/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Welcome to the sixth episode of our brand-new show, Blended.</p>\n<p>Blended is all about opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA+ community, people of colour, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 6, ‘My Journey,’ I’m joined by a group of amazing supply chain professionals who are opening up and sharing their personal stories with us – their experiences of being a woman, a person of colour, an indigenous person. And they’re going to really shine a light for us on how those formative experiences have impacted their lives and careers, and made them into the person they are today.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[00.34] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Devon – Founder of SheNative, Entrepreneurship &amp; Business Skill Development Facilitator, Coach &amp; Mentor</li>\n<li>Shay – President &amp; Managing Partner at Allegiant Logistics</li>\n<li>Mike – Founder of Procurement Foundry and Managing Partner of AMPlify Resources Group</li>\n<li>Tzvete – Investment Banking Analyst (Stout) and Founder of <a href=\"https://ecosystem.substack.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Ecosystem</a></li>\n<li>Adeola (Addy) – Director of Additive Manufacturing Solutions at Desktop Metal</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Diversity and inclusion is more than a catchphrase. It’s direct action and opportunities for people that look like me.” Shay</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.23] How Devon’s experiences drove her to shine a light on the common traumas of indigenous women and found SheNative, to inspire and support others.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Indigenous women are some of the most disadvantaged women in Canada &#8211; we&#8217;re five times more likely to go missing and to be murdered; we&#8217;re 3% of Canada&#8217;s population, yet 30% of the prison population.&#8221;</p>\n<p>[16.51] Shay’s ‘rags to riches’ childhood, and how that journey shaped the woman she is today.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Starting a business will expose a lot of your trauma, and people don’t always talk about that.” Shay.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.53] Why Mike’s experiences led him towards helping others and creating Procurement Foundry, a community for people in the industry to come together, learn and grow.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The people that are willing to expose their backgrounds and do a deep search into themselves to figure out where they came from, can ultimately say ‘now I know who I am today.’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.04] How Addy’s experience of growing up in Nigeria instilled her with an intense desire to succeed.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Since I started my career, I was always the only woman, and the only black person – there was never anybody who looked like me.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[41.43] Why Tzvete’s multicultural upbringing and ambitious parents, as well as her desire to inspire her younger sister, were the key to her success.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Being in such an international culture at a young age opened my perspective and showed me that there are so many different types of cultures and customs &#8211; and it taught me how to adapt.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[50.20] The panellists reflections on young people in business.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Lack of encouragement, low self-esteem and the importance of mentors</li>\n<li>Experience, knowledge, opportunity and giving the benefit of the doubt</li>\n<li>Inspiration, influence and visibility of positive role models</li>\n<li>Access to the right networks and communities</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[1.06.11] The panellists take a closer look at diversity and inclusion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Conferences: a lack of diverse speakers, financial drivers and the emphasis on job titles</li>\n<li>Looking at diversity at a team level</li>\n<li>The issue with big business ticking diversity and inclusion boxes without truly committing to change</li>\n<li>The downstream impact of supplier diversity</li>\n<li>Barriers to becoming a diverse supplier, eg issues with long term sustainability, scaling and access to capital</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[1.15.20] Creating meaningful change.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Find your niche and be the best at what you do</li>\n<li>Build something for yourself, outside of the corporate environment</li>\n<li>The importance of diverse investors</li>\n<li>The importance of mentorship for diverse SME’s</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[1.22.19] The panellists sum up their key piece of advice from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Diversity and inclusion only makes your company better: hear and respect their voices – Addy</li>\n<li>Put your money where your mouth is – engage with, and invest in, diverse businesses – Devon</li>\n<li>Just start – Mike</li>\n<li>Be aware – Tzvete</li>\n<li>Don’t be intimidated and once you’ve reached your destination, go back and carve out that path for others to follow – Shay</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/devon-fiddler/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Devon</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/shaylynndixon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Shay</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/michael-cadieux/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Mike</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/adeola-d-olubamiji-ph-d-42bb0b116/\"     "episode_number": 185,
    "post_id": 4720,
    "title": "185: Chart a Course for Shipping Success",
    "slug": "episode185",
    "date": "2021-03-15T08:00:11",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18252488/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_185_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18252488\"></iframe>Today I’m delighted to be joined by <a href=\"http://www.cusackandco.com.au/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Cusack and Co</a>, an innovative maritime law firm who are building a much-needed space for likeminded individuals and companies to do law differently.</p>\n<p>As top carriers continue to merge, shippers need personalised ocean carriage contracts to protect their businesses, now more than ever. So Cusack and Co, led by the dynamic and inimitable Alison Cusack, provide a range of both proactive and reactive services to help shippers compete and stay protected in a global market.</p>\n<p>Today Alison, Founder and Principal Lawyer, joins me to chat all about exactly what Cusack and Co do, the importance of empowering shippers and of driving better business.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[05.53] Alison’s background, her passion for maritime law and why she founded Cusack and Co.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You see the engine room of the world&#8217;s economy when you work with cargo ships.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.51] A closer look at exactly what Cusack and Co do and its ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[20.20] How Cusack and Co makes legal services accessible, through affordability and transparency.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m a lot cheaper than one wrong shipment!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.09] Why Alison designed the CLAMs claim bot system, and what it means for an SME’s typical claims process.</p>\n<p>[32.02] The importance of WISTA, Women&#8217;s International Shipping &amp; Trading Association, and why the industry needs to make some changes to better embrace equality.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The industry isn’t evolving fast enough to give women the space and opportunity to shine – and our industry is only as amazing as our people.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[39.21] Case study: how Cusack and Co helped a customer to swiftly lift a cargo lien and get back to business.</p>\n<p>[43.14] The future for Alison, and for Cusack and Co.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Cusack and Co’s <a href=\"http://www.cusackandco.com.au/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too. And, get 10% off with our totally exclusive discount code, only for Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ listeners: <strong>Let&#8217;s Talk Supply Chain™ 10</strong></p>\n<p>Connect with Alison on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alison-cusack/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or follow Cusack and Co on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/cusack_and_co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Instagram</a>, <a href=\"http://www.twitter.com/lawyer_shipping\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/company/cusack-and-co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or find them on Clubhouse @shippinglawyer.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Apex_2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18233825\"></iframe><br />This is the second episode in our “Delivering Apex” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Apex Logistics</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in Episode 1, “Apex Cares,” I was joined by Amy Froese and Holly Qualman to talk all about quality service and giving back – why it’s so important and the different programs Apex are involved in to truly help make the world a better place.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, “We Deliver Passion,” I’m joined by Sangna Mistry Kuhia, Vice President of Human Resources and Organizational Development at Apex, to talk about people – the ins and out of hiring and retention, Apex’s people-led approach and why a motivated, dedicated and passionate workforce is the key to success.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.07] An introduction to Sangna, her role at Apex and her passion for people.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Employee relations is one of the most important things that we do as leaders.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.23] Why a great workforce is so important.</p>\n<p>[08.17] A picture of the global Apex workforce.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“About 42% of our female leadership is at the VP level, and 85% of our workforce is considered to be minority.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.02] How HR helps to facilitate hiring the right talent, that will keep Apex’s core values top of mind.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We don’t just ask people ‘what have you done in your past?’ More so, we ask ‘what do you want to do in your future?’ ”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.00] The role of HR in supporting the wider company.</p>\n<p>[17.27] A closer look at how Apex goes about finding the right staff.</p>\n<p>[20.57] How Apex’s supportive and holistic culture helps them to retain talent, particularly in the face of fierce industry competition.</p>\n<p>[22.38] Some of the practical ways Apex approach talent retention.</p>\n<p>[25.19] Sangna’s advice for anyone interested in a career at Apex.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you have a passion for excellence, drop me a note!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Apex Logistics’ <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18188222/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_E2Open_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"18188222\"></iframe>Today I’m delighted to be joined by <a href=\"https://www.e2open.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">E2open</a>, a company who believes that the level of agility required to capture growth opportunities – plus the resiliency to manage today’s risks – demands a new way of thinking. Their range of intelligent applications allow supply chain leaders to make the best business decisions using real-time information from across their entire internal and external ecosystems.</p>\n<p>From channel shaping and demand sensing, to business planning and global trade management, E2open offers a full suite of intelligent applications for every stage of your businesses supply chain journey. They aim to unlock your potential with their expertise, delivering you end-to-end visibility, planning and execution, all in real time.</p>\n<p>I’m joined by Michael Farlekas, President and Chief Executive Officer at E2open, to talk about why the company is a market-leader, the impact of issues like COVID and Brexit on supply chain and why they chose 2021 to take E2open public.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.07] A closer look at what E2open does, and their recent big announcement.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We help our customers to connect what is really a disconnected world.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.39] Why E2open chose 2021 to take their business public.</p>\n<p>[11.31] How E2open was founded and why it led to a continuing culture of collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Collaboration is the foundation of our business.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.23] Michael’s advice for businesses considering the route of mergers or acquisitions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“How you technically integrate is the foundation, but it goes much deeper than that – you also need to consider go to market, cultural and back office integration.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.14] Why visibility is a growing supply chain trend, and how you create it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Visibility is what you get when you have a well-constructed supply chain architecture.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.28] How customer demand drives business, and how E2open’s software can deliver connectivity to help create a seamless and proactive supply chain, from sales predictions to inventory management.</p>\n<p>[25.03] E2open’s COVID experience, how they helped their customers and Michael’s reflections on how the pandemic has impacted the future of the industry.</p>\n<p>[28.14] A customer success case study.</p>\n<p>[29.54] From an increase in ocean shopping to more manufacturing, Michael’s trends and predictions for 2021 and beyond.</p>\n<p>[35.21] The future for E2open.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to E2open’s <a href=\"https://www.e2open.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18090308/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Apex_1_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18090308\"></iframe><br />This is the first episode of our latest mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Apex Logistics</a>. Over the next four episodes, our “Delivering Apex” mini-series is going to take a closer look at Apex Logistics, their commitment to the community, to the environment, and all of the amazing people that are helping to make an impact across the globe.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, “Apex Cares,” I’m joined by Amy Froese, Corporate Growth Marketer, and Holly Qualman, Sales, Marketing, and Analytics Strategist, to talk all about quality service and giving back – why it’s so important and the different programs Apex are involved in to truly help make the world a better place.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.14] An introduction to Holly and Amy.</p>\n<p>[03.59] A closer look at exactly who Apex is and what they do.</p>\n<p>[06.30] The growing trend in consumers seeking out ethical and sustainable brands.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There truly is a difference – and customers know this – between a company that actually lives, breathes and believes in sustainability, and companies that are doing it just to check a box.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.18] Apex’s huge customer commitment, and the vast scale of PPE they transported, during the height of the COVID crisis.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We pivoted with each of the different needs to be able to provide globally&#8230; so by Q3 and 4, we had delivered billions of pieces.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.33] Apex’s partnership with Habitat for Humanity.</p>\n<p>[19.01] The environmental impact of logistics, and the industry’s responsibility in driving innovation in sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our industry is really facilitating the movement of global commerce, and with that comes a significant amount of responsibility.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.30] Practical ways to make positive sustainability changes, on a personal and a business level.</p>\n<p>[26,27] Apex’s industry-leading partnership with BSR.</p>\n<p>[29.00] How we can start to influence our peers and drive sustainability conversations.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The first step is spreading awareness and sharing ideas.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.14] From developing more key partnerships to a commitment to volunteering, Apex’s corporate social responsibility goals for 2021.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Apex Logistics’ <a href=\"https://www.apexglobe.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Find out more about <a href=\"https://www.bsr.org/en/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">BSR</a> and <a href=\"https://www.habitat.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Habitat for Humanity</a> to explore whether they could also be the right fit for your corporate social responsibility goals.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {

    "summary": "NA",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/18089957/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_181_v2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"18089957\"></iframe><br />For today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Deborah Kotulich. Skilled in supply chain, operations management, Government, U.S. Department of Defense, Strategic Planning, and Business Process Improvement, Deborah is an experienced and successful military leader. From earning her degree in engineering from the United States Military Academy, she’s served her country, nurtured an impressive logistics career and is now Chief of Staff at US Transportation Command: she is one incredible woman.</p>\n<p>Today Deborah will be talking to us about her career in the military, how she balances it with family life, and she’ll be sharing her words of wisdom for the upcoming generations of ambitious young women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<h2><strong>SHOW SPONSOR:</strong></h2>\n<p>As a company focused on supply chain partnerships, <a href=\"https://www.fastenal.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Fastenal</a> is proud to sponsor this piece of Women In Supply Chain™. With more than 100,000 point-of-use vending machines around the world, Fastenal is dedicated to helping organizations lower their total cost of ownership.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.48] Deborah’s background, how she entered the military and the fascinating journey that brought her to her current role.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I went to school at a military academy… and I really found a place where I could thrive.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.45] Exactly what the U.S. Transportation Command is and what it does.</p>\n<p>[16.52] How an accident at military academy led Deborah to logistics.</p>\n<p>[21.23] Logistics in the military vs the civilian world.</p>\n<p>[24.50] How Deborah balances family life with her military and professional careers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m overwhelmingly fortunate to have a wonderful family – I owe it all to the patience of my wife and the resilience of my daughters.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.34] Deborah’s role with USTRANSCOM’s Inclusion and Diversity Council, and their goals.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We believe that coming at all we do from an angle of being inclusive, will unlock the door of opportunity for everyone.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.31] Deborah’s experience as a woman in the military.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I stand on the shoulders of giants… but (early on) there was a pressure to make sure I wasn’t a weak link.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.57] How Deborah found her voice.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m an extrovert with a capital E – so I’m not sure that I had to find my voice, as much as I had to refine and learn to control my voice.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[39.58] What the future holds for Deborah.</p>\n<p>[42.48] Do your research and take up any and all training and education opportunities, Deborah’s advice to the next generation of women who may be thinking about joining the military, or pursuing a career in logistics.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/deb-kotulich-4921b73/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with Deborah and find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17955887/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_180_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17955887\"></iframe><br />Today I’m talking to <a href=\"https://leangroup.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Lean Staffing Solutions</a>, one of Inc. Magazines ‘Top 500 Fastest Growing Private Companies.’</p>\n<p>Providing satellite offices in South America, Lean Staffing makes scaling easy, providing you with the best team to improve your processes and lower your operational costs. With the right combination of talent, culture and price, and with solutions across staffing, tech, marketing and sales, Lean Staffing are going from strength to strength in the market.</p>\n<p>I’m joined by Trey Griggs, Vice President of Lean Sales, to talk about exactly what they do, how their model works and the benefits to be found in broadening your reach through nearshore staffing services.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[08.08] An introduction to Trey and his take on how the pandemic has altered the culture of sales.</p>\n<p>[09.49] How Lean Staffing was founded, and its growth journey.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Customers started asking for more and more services… specifically when it comes to tech and sales.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.10] A closer look at exactly what Lean Staffing Solutions do.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We help companies take care of entry level positions at a fraction of the cost &#8211; and with better quality.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.27] Why Colombia is the perfect match for the US when you’re looking to expand.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The three critical components are time zone, language and culture.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.03] Exactly what businesses, like freight forwarders and brokers, need from Lean Staffing Solutions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Companies need quality workers with great attitude and work ethics, who don’t kill the bottom line.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.21] How Lean Staffing Solutions facilitate hiring and training workforces for their customers.</p>\n<p>[24.21] Why Lean Tech was recently listed by Analytics Insight Magazine as one of the Top 10 Most Innovative RPA Companies – and exactly why logistics companies need them.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“For the majority of customers in transportation, their technology is fragmented and they’re not talking to each other.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.28] Trey’s reflections on the post-pandemic workforce.</p>\n<p>[33.17] A real life case study of how Lean Solutions helped a customer to save time and ultimately secure new contracts and increase revenue.</p>\n<p>[36.21] From continuing to build on customer relationships to developing new technology, the future for Lean Staffing Solutions.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Lean Staffing Solutions <a href=\"https://leangroup.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "dba435f5-d6b4-4f31-b17f-7a51e42d38b2",
    "episode_number": 179,
    "post_id": 4648,
    "title": "179: Blended &#8211; The history, the movement, the people",
    "slug": "episode179",
    "date": "2021-02-17T08:00:54",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17968739/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Welcome to the fifth episode of our new show, Blended. Blended is all about opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA+ community, people of colour, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 5, ‘The history, the movement, the people,’ we’re going to be talking about the Black Lives Matter movement, specifically with 2020 in mind; why the movement blew up last year; the support, and lack of support, it received; its commercialization and our panellists reflections.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.31] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Len – Co-Founder &amp; CEO at Everlasting Love Fulfilment</li>\n<li>Al – Global Vice President: Supply Chain and Procurement at PCI Pharma Services</li>\n<li>Audrey – In house specialist at Orchard Custom Beauty</li>\n<li>JD – Chief Creative Officer</li>\n<li>Madison – Enterprise Sales Director at Fairmarkit</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“The BLM movement, to me, is bringing attention and awareness to the fact that it’s time for the conversation to stop being so hypothetical &#8211; there needs to be action.” Al</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.18] The impact of George Floyd’s death and the panellists observations.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>JD’s experience of modern racism in the South.</li>\n<li>The difference between peaceful protest and the rioters, who helped to derail the support behind the movement.</li>\n<li>How businesses tick boxes with diversity officers, but aren’t translating that into practical change for their staff or their communities.</li>\n<li>Victim blaming and justifications for the murder of black people.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“When the movement happened, I was excited because I really want us to finally unite. But what I was afraid of, is that we had a lot of young people who had the gumption to get out and march, but I didn’t know if they had the leadership to communicate with the people in the community.” JD</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.37] The swift decrease in support for the movement during 2020.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>White guilt.</li>\n<li>How the media used some groups taking advantage of the movement to condemn it.</li>\n<li>Society as a construct that benefits white people and actively oppresses others, and the fear of black skin.</li>\n<li>How the movement made black people visible.</li>\n<li>Right and wrong ways to protest, and why riots happen.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[37.15] The backdrop of COVID 19.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Systemic racism, resources vs intent and personal choice.</li>\n<li>The responsibility of black people to help elevate each other.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[44.51] The ‘All lives matter’ retort.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The bias and racism that often sits behind the phrase.</li>\n<li>The difference between having a lack of knowledge and being wilfully ignorant.</li>\n<li>The importance of research and educating yourself.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[66.26] The commercialization of the movement.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>The impact on the ‘buy black’ movement and giving to black causes.</li>\n<li>The positives of marketing and awareness.</li>\n<li>The powerful impact of white allyship.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“As white people, some of the basic steps you can take is saying ‘I’m an anti-racist. I don’t have all the answers, but I’m committed – publicly – to change’.” Len</p></blockquote>\n<p>[81.46] The future, and the panellists key takeaways from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Awareness and understanding – Len</li>\n<li>This conversation is here to stay – JD</li>\n<li>Question everything, and who it benefits – Audrey</li>\n<li>Understand your privilege and hold people accountable – Al</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s about elevating the human condition… but its also about creating space for black imagination, innovation and joy.” Madison</p></blockquote>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/len-lewis-67816513/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Len</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mossal/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Al</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/audrey-ross-citp-3422a153/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Audrey</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jdredmon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">JD</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Madison</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17868317/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_178_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17868317\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by one of Canada’s top sustainability professionals. In her role as Head of Sustainable Impact at HP Canada, Frances Edmonds is responsible for driving business from sustainability leadership and, focusing on Canada’s sustainable procurement practices, she’s working to change how Canada buys.</p>\n<p>Frances has founded sustainability and environmental education programs, given TedX talks and sits on sustainability boards – this award-winning woman is truly using her platform to change the world.</p>\n<p>Today we’ll be talking about her long-standing career, her passion for sustainability, why it’s so important – and the changes we can all start making in our businesses right now.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[08.11] Frances’s background, and her journey to sustainability.</p>\n<p>[09.42] Frances’s role at HP, and her responsibilities both internally and externally.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We realised that not many businesses are going to try and become a leader in sustainability because there’s no recognition for that in the marketplace – we’re in a capitalist system.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.21] From external recognition to thinking big, the key sustainability strategies and goals at HP.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In Canada, we have less than 20 companies who have set a science based target for carbon reduction, in the decade of climate action.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.06] Practical ways businesses can begin their own sustainability journeys.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The fastest way to green your business is to buy from one that’s already green.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.27] HP’s commitment to a circular economy and a services vs goods approach; how these strategies help extend the shelf life of technology; and how consumers are responding.</p>\n<p>[24.00] The environmental impact of supply chain, and the importance of carbon literacy.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Sustainability is the golden thread that ties all of the pieces together.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.07] Frances’s WWF programs and the positive impact of volunteering and setting personal sustainability goals.</p>\n<p>[36.48] How Frances has seen the industry’s approach to sustainability change.</p>\n<p>[39.14] Some key tools and resources.</p>\n<p>[40.23] Future sustainability trends to watch out for.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Transparency is a key component of sustainability leadership.”</p></blockquote>\n<h2></h2>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Explore HP’s sustainable impact on their <a href=\"https://www8.hp.com/uk/en/hp-information/sustainable-impact.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> or head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/franceshp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with Frances and find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "177: Innovating the Last Mile with Logistics Titans",
    "slug": "episode177",
    "date": "2021-02-08T08:00:37",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17774984/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Logistics_Titans_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17774984\"></iframe><br /><a href=\"https://logisticstitans.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Logistics Titans</a> really pride themselves on delivering forward-thinking, results-driven solutions for their customers. As the largest specialized and asset-based carrier in the US, they cast a wide net and empower their clients with new possibilities, locations and accessibility. And as a business, Logistics Titans believe in being bold, brave and impactful; so much so, they were named after powerhouses of Greek mythology.</p>\n<p>Working mainly across healthcare, technology and retail, their combination of award-winning customer service, 250 project warehouse locations and leading logistics technology makes them true industry titans.</p>\n<p>Wes Struebing, the Founder &amp; President at Logistics Titans, was on the show in <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode126/\">July last year</a> and he’s back today to talk specifically about the last mile – the challenges, how it&#8217;s linked to customer experience, and exactly how the team at Logistics Titans are using new technology to elevate their service.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.26] A reminder of exactly what Logistics Titans do.</p>\n<p>[09.05] Automation and rapid business growth – what Logistics Titans have been up to since we last spoke.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I was so fortunate that my existing business had done so well, that it afforded me the opportunity to purchase four other companies!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.29] A closer look at Logistics Titan’s new business acquisitions, and the process of merging businesses.</p>\n<p>[13.41] Some of the key challenges in the last mile right now.</p>\n<p>[16.58] How Logistics Titans continued to support the final mile through the height of the pandemic.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We diligently followed the CDC guidelines – and we enforced it through our WIPOD technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.59] Exactly how the last mile is connected to customer experience.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’ve been in the final mile business for a long time, and only within the last few years has the real desire for final mile prominence come to light.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.36] A look at Logistics Titans proprietary end to end software solutions that help provide visibility and success for their customers.</p>\n<p>[26.55] A real life example of how Logistics Titans helped a key customer reduce error and drive sales.</p>\n<p>[30.13] How the importance of the last mile will to continue to grow in the coming years.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re all waiting to see what the new normal is going to look like – but the creation for last mile delivery demand is going to continue to soar.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.05] From new certification to controlled growth, what 2021 is going to bring for Logistics Titans.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND     "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17681456/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_WISC_Isabel_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17681456\"></iframe><br />For today’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™, I’m joined by Isabel Tapia. From Mexico, she’s currently the Head of Ford of Mexico’s Indirect Purchasing department, leading a team with an annual spend of just shy of 2 billion USD.</p>\n<p>An experienced procurement executive with a long history in the automotive industry, she’s an expert in Supply Chain Management, sourcing and team growth and development.</p>\n<p>Today Isabel will be talking to us about her roots in engineering, her passion for procurement and her words of wisdom as a successful woman in a male-dominated industry.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[07.38] Isabel’s background and her long-standing interest in engineering.</p>\n<p>[10.17] Isabel’s current role at Ford.</p>\n<p>[11.33] Her 16 year career with Ford and what makes them such a good company to work for.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Ford is a great company: I’ve always felt comfortable, supported and challenged.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.19] A reflection on what’s changed over the course of Isabel’s career so far.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The automotive industry is in constant evolution.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.36] A closer look at the impact of the pandemic and the increasingly important role of technology.</p>\n<p>[17.44] Isabel’s surprising experience of working in, what is assumed to be, the male-dominated automotive industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;I can say that amazing women in my industry have already carved that path. So I’m coming into a work environment that’s already open.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.17] The importance of good female leaders and role models.</p>\n<p>[23.01] The path ahead for women in typically male-centered environments.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;It will not happen by chance – you need to go and pursue the opportunities, and if you need help, you need to use your voice.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.29] The story of how, and why, Isabel found her voice so early in life.</p>\n<p>[27.59] What Isabel has learned about herself on her journey so far.</p>\n<p>[29.11] Isabel’s words of wisdom for the next generation.</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/isabel-t-13174b3b/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with Isabel and find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode175",

    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
