    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17595299/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Blu_Jay_Series_4_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17595299\"></iframe><br />This is the fourth and final show in our “Give your business a fresh start” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">BluJay Solutions</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in Episode 3 “Your Global Impact,” we were joined by Patrick Maley, the Chief Marketing Officer at BluJay, to talk about the hugely important topic of sustainability. We discussed the impact of international shipping, how we can use technology to help us with our eco commitments and exactly how BluJay are helping us to facilitate them.</p>\n<p>And today in Episode 4, “Managing Risk: The Ultimate Balancing Act,” we’re joined by Bill Madden, Group Vice President, Logistics as a Service at BluJay Solutions, to talk about risk. How we can better prepare ourselves for the unknown, how we can utilize technology in risk management and why having a partner there when you need them, can really help you share that burden of risk.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.24] Bill’s background, his career at BluJay and the one thing that might surprise people about the idea of risk.</p>\n<p>[02.50] Quality, compliance and the right workforce, key focus areas for helping to manage risk.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When we talk about compliance, conversations have been around repeatability, striving for standardization and having best practices in place around exception management.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.56] Leveraging the power of technology in mitigating risk.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“To get predictability, you really have to get communication nailed.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.25] Core BluJay solutions that can help businesses to prepare for disruption or deal with it quickly.</p>\n<p>[21.41] The many and varied unexpected challenges thrown up by COVID, and their impact on supply chain in the long term.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We built the transition with long hours and hard work, but that’s not sustainable for the long haul. To ensure sustainability, we had to get better – better than we were before COVID.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.05] Why BluJay have been a trusted partner of many of the world’s top LSPs for decades.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s all in our DNA – data, network, applications – and the BluJay way.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.24] What the future holds for the industry and for BluJay.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“One thing we can all count on in the coming year, is that rapid change will be the only constant!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES</strong> <strong>AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to BluJay’s <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17634251/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_174_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17634251\"></iframe><br />Today I’m joined by the number one international shipping carrier for e-commerce. With customer experience at its core, <a href=\"https://passportshipping.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Passport Shipping</a> is putting the ‘care’ back in ‘carrier.’ They believe that a great international experience demands a considered approach to strategy, software and customer experience, as well as great logistics. So with their end-to-end solution, you can tailor experiences for your customers worldwide.</p>\n<p>I’m joined by Alex Yancher, the Co-Founder and CEO at Passport Shipping to chat about the company’s unique offering and all about international shipping: the benefits, the challenges and what we can expect in the coming year.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[04.36] Alex’s background, the personal experiences that have driven his career – and one surprising stat about shipping.</p>\n<p>[07.30] Alex’s previous business, Lynks, what he learned and how he took those learnings forward to found Passport Shipping.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It made me realize that international shipping is a whole lot more than just the logistics.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.26] A closer look at exactly what Passport Shipping does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“At Passport, we want to not only make sure that customers are capturing potential revenue, but they’re doing it in a way that doesn’t add undue burden to their operations and customer support.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.45] How customer experience, technology and logistics blend together to create the perfect supply chain solution.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“These three elements have to come together to provide a modern international shipping service.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.08] The benefits of international shipping, especially in light of COVID-19.</p>\n<p>[18.30] From returns and customer service to differing rules and local knowledge, a look at some of the obstacles holding brands back from jumping into international shipping.</p>\n<p>[22.09] Different shipping methods and how they align with individual business models.</p>\n<p>[24.16] The impact that issues like global tax changes can have on your business – and your bottom line.</p>\n<p>[27.59] How Passport Shipping helped key customer Bombas Socks to resolve core pain points in their international shipping process.</p>\n<p>[32.28] The ideal customer for Passport Shipping.</p>\n<p>[34.37] How SME’s can maximise the benefit of the recently implemented U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA).</p>\n<p>[38.05] The future for Passport Shipping, and for logistics, in 2021.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s even more critical, now more than ever, to have a solution and a partner like Passport in place to help you manage the change and stay compliant.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Passport Shipping’s <a href=\"https://passportshipping.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "709dd454-ceae-40a5-926d-e2883e593088",

    "slug": "episode173",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17571821/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Blu_Jay_3_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17571821\"></iframe><br />This is the third show in our “Give your business a fresh start” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">BluJay Solutions</a>.</p>\n<p>In Episode 2, “Simulation: The Future is Here” we talked to Pam Reeber, Director of Solution Consulting at BluJay Solutions, to talk all about simulation, and using AI to model scenarios within the supply chain so we can predict the future and stay ahead of the game.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 3 “Your Global Impact,” we’re joined by Patrick Maley, the Chief Marketing Officer at BluJay, to talk about the hugely important topic of sustainability. We’ll be discussing the impact of international shipping, how we can use technology to help us with our eco commitments and exactly how BluJay are helping us to facilitate them.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.04] Patrick’s background, his role at BluJay and one thing that would surprise people about sustainability.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Businesses often think about sustainability as an added cost, but they’re not thinking about the true business benefits.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.23] A global network – the benefits of international shipping.</p>\n<p>[05.11] The environmental impact of worldwide shipping, and why the tide is starting to turn.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Economies are growing, but we are becoming more efficient.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.54] From optimization to synchronization, the ways in which we can leverage the power of technology to help create change.</p>\n<p>[13.46] From conversation and connectivity to picking the low-hanging fruit, practical ways to start introducing change in your business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you look at the silver lining, the pandemic has really exposed some long held business practices and thoughts that we haven’t been questioning. “</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.01] How BluJay are helping their customers to improve their sustainability strategies.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our solutions are designed to reduce waste; they’re naturally built for sustainability. So companies who employ our solutions use fewer trucks and they drive less miles.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.17] Tips on how to influence our peers and be proactive in championing sustainable solutions.</p>\n<p>[25.07] The different levels of sustainability stakeholders within a business – and taking the lead from Heineken.</p>\n<p>[27.16] The future for sustainability and logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It will definitely pick up momentum as the new generations move in.”</p></blockquote>\n<h2></h2>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES</strong> <strong>AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to BluJay’s <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "5441fdf3-1d8e-4579-b374-cf0f94e92843",
    "episode_number": 172,
    "post_id": 4491,
    "title": "172: Blended &#8211; The World Stage",
    "slug": "episode172",
    "date": "2021-01-20T08:00:21",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17545850/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Welcome to the fourth episode of our brand-new show, Blended.</p>\n<p>Blended is all about opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA+ community, people of colour, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, ‘The World Stage,’ we’re going to be looking at diversity and inclusion from a worldwide perspective. What does it look like for our panellists; how does it vary by country, or continent; what are the conversations that are being had across the globe; and how can we join together to shape a better future.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.03] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Jenna – CEO &amp; Co-Founder at Shipamax, based in the UK</li>\n<li>Nissrine – Supply Chain Advisor, originally from Morocco, raised in France and living in United Arab Emirates</li>\n<li>Demostenes (Demo) – Latin America Supply Chain Business Strategist, born and raised in Panama</li>\n<li>Akta – Co-Founder &amp; CEO at Nomadory, born and raised in India and living in the USA</li>\n<li>Andrea – Senior Economist at Export Development Canada, born in Chile and raised in Canada</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I think about diversity from the perspective of embracing differences – and it’s beyond just your ethnicity or your race or where you were raised.” Akta</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.09] The panellists experiences of diversity and inclusion around the world.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>How Akta’s parents broke from patriarchal tradition in her upbringing; but working in investment banking, she still found herself the only woman on the trading floor</li>\n<li>Jenna’s perspective through European eyes, and the difference between being a diverse city and having that diversity actually represented in the workplace</li>\n<li>Education bias, and its damaging trickledown effect</li>\n<li>Andrea’s perspective on integrating, accessing opportunity and thriving as an immigrant</li>\n<li>Nissrine’s contradictory experience of equality in the UAE, from a push towards gender equality to a shying away from equality in the LGBTQIA+ community</li>\n<li>Education and qualifications as a part of culture, and both the positive and negative impact</li>\n<li>Demo&#8217;s experience of being surrounded by strong, professional women and how that influenced him in the workplace</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We have a very diverse city… but there’s a difference between having a diverse population and being inclusive as a society.” Jenna</p></blockquote>\n<p>[49.01] Individual experiences and the groups reactions.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Jenna’s experience of gender bias in fundraising; the questions that are asked and playing the game, whether that’s adapting to or challenging, that bias</li>\n<li>How a male dominated culture has historically held back talent</li>\n<li>How an international work experience encouraged Andrea to understand the importance of encouraging openness on a corporate scale, not just a personal one</li>\n<li>The importance of advocacy and honesty</li>\n<li>Andrea’s take on the dialogue around pronouns and the danger of assumptions</li>\n<li>Why Demo created the first woman-only panel in Panama</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It comes down to the intentions in those conversations – is the intention to understand or learn more?&#8230; We can’t rely on marginalized communities to educate us.” Andrea</p></blockquote>\n<p>[77.35] The benefits of actively seeking out and nurturing a diverse and inclusive environment.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Awareness and actively fighting subconscious bias</li>\n<li>The different perspectives that come from different industries and experiences</li>\n<li>Improved decision making, problem-solving and productivity</li>\n<li>Improved creativity and innovation</li>\n<li>Unlocking your potential and sense of purpose, and the power to be found in being – and being allowed to be – your best authentic self</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“We all have a responsibility as a human being to include everyone.” Nissine</p></blockquote>\n<p>[87.31] How do we find a way to work together to keep driving diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity?</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Embracing differences</li>\n<li>Avoid associating genders with particular traits</li>\n<li>Speaking up</li>\n<li>Influencing the group you feel comfortable with, whether that’s home, work or community</li>\n<li>The power of social media</li>\n<li>Being vulnerable</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s about finding balance in the team of different perspectives… Having that balance helped us to be more successful, and grow faster.” Demo</p></blockquote>\n<p>[96.09] The panellists sum up their key takeaways from today’s discussion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Ask – Demo</li>\n<li>Keep talking – Jenna</li>\n<li>Be accountable – Akta</li>\n<li>Empathy – Nissrine</li>\n<li>Be vulnerable – Andrea</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/demostenes-perez-ba06212/\" target=\"_blank\" on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "c242a6e7-2db7-4ea2-8b40-c7393a3fbdad",

    "post_id": 4514,
    "title": "171: Let’s Collaborate, with Mercado and Shipz",
    "slug": "episode171",
    "date": "2021-01-18T08:00:56",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17535716/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_171_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17535716\"></iframe><br />Today’s episode is a very special crossover episode, in honour of collaboration, featuring <a href=\"https://mercadolabs.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Mercado</a> and <a href=\"https://www.shipz.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Shipz Inc</a>.</p>\n<p>Mercado strive to deliver transparency, collaboration, automation and predictability across supply chain. From product creation and tracking, to document management and shipment, to order collaboration and smart tagging, their platform has everything you need for the first mile of your supply chain.</p>\n<p>And when it comes to the middle mile, you need Shipz Inc; the innovative new bid-and-ship freight platform. Working to simplify the complexity often found in logistics, the Shipz platform closes the gap between mid-market shippers and forwarders, creating an accessible and hassle-free logistics solution for all. From quick and accurate quotes, selecting the right partners that fit your business, secure documentation all in one place and even lines of credit, shippers and forwarders will see a variety of benefits by connecting with the Shipz platform.</p>\n<p>I’m joined by Rob Garrison, CEO at Mercado, to talk about why collaboration in business is so important, the impact of the pandemic, the vast array of benefits that collaboration can bring – and the new and exciting partnership between Shipz and Mercado, coming for 2021.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.18] Why collaboration is so important in supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“International supply chain is not only a mile wide, it’s a mile deep – and that’s the fundamental reason why collaboration is so important.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.01] An overview of Mercado and Shipz.</p>\n<p>[15.37] How collaboration can help businesses to extend their offering by filling in their gaps with a third party.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“As a customer… there are a lot of companies coming up and it’s not always clear exactly who they are and what their competency is. So Shipz Inc’s ability to diagnose those issues and connect them through the platform is a huge benefit.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.55] The benefit collaboration has with regard to data and insights.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you’ve got all the data in one source, you can give much richer reporting and much richer insight.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.54] How collaboration can help expand businesses, helping them to operate successfully on both a local and a global scale.</p>\n<p>[25.22] Why Shipz is an important partner for Mercado.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Whilst we’re experts in the first mile, it doesn’t mean we should ignore the rest of the supply chain and it’s great to be able to say to a customer, I have a great partner that can do that for you.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[28.10] The role good partnerships played in keeping businesses afloat in 2020, and the impact on the industry as a whole.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The world suddenly shifted – the pandemic accelerated plans from ‘over the next 10 years’ to ‘over the next 2 years;’ it was that rapid. Businesses had to rely on collaboration in order to survive.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.00] A look at Mercado’s new <em>Transform</em> campaign.</p>\n<p>[39.11] An introduction to how Mercado and Shipz are collaborating in 2021.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Mercado’s <a href=\"https://mercadolabs.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more and discover how they could help you too. And don’t forget to visit Shipz to sign up for your <a href=\"https://www.shipz.com/signup\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">FREE trial</a> now.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17518778/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Blu_Jay_Series_2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17518778\"></iframe><br />This is the second show in our “Give your business a fresh start” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">BluJay</a>.</p>\n<p>In Episode 1, “Visibility, Unchained” we talked to Bryant, Senior Global Product Manager at BluJay Solutions, about data and visibility: why it’s so important, the impact of last year and how BluJay is innovating in this area, to create unparalleled levels of visibility for their customers.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, “Simulation: The Future is Here,” we’re joined by Pam Reeber, Director of Solution Consulting at BluJay Solutions, to talk all about simulation, and using AI to model scenarios within the supply chain so we can predict the future and stay ahead of the game.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.04] Pam’s role at BluJay, and the one thing that might surprise people about AI.</p>\n<p>[02.44] Exactly what simulation is and how it works.</p>\n<p>[04.10] How, and why, BluJay became the first TMS Provider to build a modelling solution on the LLamasoft Cloud Platform.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We wanted to provide a hands-on, self-service tool that was easy to use but powerful enough to identify some key potential areas of opportunity.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.53] Consolidation, flexible date-shifting and mode conversion: the three key scenarios within the supply chain that BluJay can help to model.</p>\n<p>[08.51] Exactly how the solution works, and the ways users can interact with it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The data is displayed visually so a user can quickly compare the KPI’s across five different scenarios.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.37] The power of data sharing and collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can export data at a shipment or at a load level and you can use that to drive those conversations with vendors or customers.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.59] The benefits of being able to model different scenarios within the supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Shippers have seen an average cost saving of 17-22%.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.29] A real life case study: how BluJay helped a customer with a key cost vs service analysis.</p>\n<p>[21.02] The balance between people and technology.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The adoption of AI and machine learning is going to be a key factor to successful companies moving forward.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.19] An overview of some of BluJay’s other solutions and innovations introduced over the last year.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to BluJay’s <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "slug": "episode169",
    "date": "2021-01-11T08:00:02",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17446256/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_169_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17446256\"></iframe><br />In today’s episode I’m excited to be joined by Dan Deigan, a man with nearly 25 years’ experience in the logistics industry under his belt. His passion, dedication and talent has led him to become the go-to for the transportation &amp; logistics sectors’ coaching and sales training.</p>\n<p>He began selling transportation &amp; logistics services in 1994, quickly climbing the ranks, winning sales competitions and growing businesses, before the impact of the recession in 2008 led him to confront his mentality and approach to business. In 2012, he established High-Performance Logistics Sales and has become a sales and coaching guru, in demand across the logistics industry.</p>\n<p>Today Dan will be talking to us about his business, his journey to success and why freight providers need to get on board with high level sales performance, fast!</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[04.43] Dan’s background, how he fell into supply chain and discovered a love for sales.</p>\n<p>[10.15] The highs and lows of the journey that led Dan to establish High-Performance Logistics Sales.</p>\n<p>[17.30] The issues Dan identified within the industry that helped guide him to founding HPLS.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I realized there was a major gap, in transportation and logistics, in training.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.56] From online one-to-ones to group coaching, the many and varied ways Dan can help sales people to reach their goals.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you want to get into that top 2%, it’s a career, not a job.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.22] Why, historically, sales performance training in logistics hasn’t been something that most freight providers have embraced.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Businesses are worried that if they train people up, they’ll leave. And I say ‘well, what if you don’t train them, and they stay?!’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.03] A real life case study of how Dan helped revolutionize one customers sales strategy.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If we don’t have three key areas – clarity about what we want, an intention about getting it, and mastering the critical skills to get us there – we’re always going to be a generalist.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.13] The ideal client profile for High-Performance Logistics Sales.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If they’re dedicated and want this as a career – I can take care of everything else.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[38.31] The future for Dan, and for High-Performance Logistics Sales</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Dan’s <a href=\"http://www.dandeigan.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how he could help you too.</p>\n<p>You can also connect with him on <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/dandeiganhpls/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Facebook</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/dan-deigan-07915b3/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/dandeiganhpls/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Instagram</a> or <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DanDeigan\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Twitter</a>; check out his <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC372grKFxIhv6Fzbr3ZIJnQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">YouTube</a> channel; or even listen to his podcast on <a href=\"https://www.dandeigan.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">iTunes</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17362016/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Blu_Jay_Series_1_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17362016\"></iframe><br />This is the first episode of our latest mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">BluJay Solutions</a>. Over the next four episodes, our “Give your Business a Fresh Start” mini-series is going to take a closer look at BluJay, and how we can harness the power of new technology and machine learning to help us tackle key pain points within our businesses, from managing risk to improving our commitment to sustainability.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, “Visibility, Unchained,” Bryant Smith, Senior Global Product Manager at BluJay Solutions, joins me to talk all about data and visibility. Why it’s so important, the impact of last year and how BluJay are innovating in this area to create unparalleled levels of visibility for their customers.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[01.46] Bryant’s background and his role at BluJay.</p>\n<p>[03.16] Who BluJay are and what they do.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“What sets us apart is the BluJay way – our unique blend of philosophy, culture and services.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.38] Why data and visibility is so important, and why it’s been THE key talking point for 2020.</p>\n<p>[08.47] The core BluJay tools that are helping customers to get the most out of data and visibility.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Tools like BluIQ can help surface issues before they happen, so that the user can make more informed decisions on how to react.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.57] The interactive and collaborative relationship between BluJay and its variety of stakeholders, both internal and external.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We incorporate stakeholder feedback so that we can address today’s problems, and plan for tomorrow’s problems as well.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.43] Supply Chain Monitor, and how BluJay tools help bring visibility and translate data into practical change.</p>\n<p>[19.21] Back end data, evaluation and reporting through key BluJay tools.</p>\n<p>[23.10] A case study of how BluJay’s solutions helped a customer.</p>\n<p>[27.21] Data accuracy and access – BluJay’s focus for the coming year.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to BluJay’s <a href=\"https://www.blujaysolutions.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17350871/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_167_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17350871\"></iframe><br />May Shu, today’s woman in supply chain, has nurtured an impressive career with our friends over at Fastenal. Originally from China, she’s now making waves in the logistics industry state-side. A dynamic and innovative supply chain professional with over 15 years of experience with Fastenal, May has a focus on people development, driving process efficiencies, and developing scalable solutions for tomorrow’s business needs in collaboration with multiple departments across the globe.</p>\n<p>Today May will be talking to us about her career so far, her approach to self-improvement and why she stays so loyal to Fastenal.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.30] May’s background and how she went from a degree in forestry to a career in logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The more I got into it, the more excited I was with the opportunities – as soon as I accomplished one thing, there was another thing waiting!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.29] May’s role at Fastenal.</p>\n<p>[06.37] Why May moved from Shanghai to a small town in the USA – and how the stability of Fastenal’s culture helped ease the transition.</p>\n<p>[09.13] What makes Fastenal such a good company to work for.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We invest heavily in people, we have amazing training programs… and we have a promote from within model.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.25] Supply chain: why May loves it, and why it’s so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p> “Supply chain is the key piece that connects everything!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.07] How Fastenal’s customer-centric approach makes them such a dynamic and ever-changing business.</p>\n<p>[13.59] The challenges May and her team faced in 2020.</p>\n<p>[16.11] From continued demand for safety products to the importance of agility and being prepared for the unexpected, the trends and challenges to watch out for in 2021.</p>\n<p>[18.34] May’s approach to self-development and building confidence.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s still a daily challenge – I’m still building my confidence with a series of small wins every day.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.22] What May has learned about herself on her journey so far, and what the future holds.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I know that my personal growth is never done.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.04] “Don’t be afraid of stepping out of your comfort zone” – May’s words of advice for women and girls following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/may-shu-294b4b90/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with May and find out more.</p>\n<p>As a company focused on supply chain partnerships, Fastenal is proud to sponsor this piece of Women In Supply Chain™. With more than 100,000 point-of-use vending machines around the world, Fastenal is dedicated to helping organizations lower their total cost of ownership. Learn more <a href=\"https://www.fastenal.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">here</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "384e35e8-09a0-4725-b4a2-11ad0158ce00",

    "title": "166 &#8211; Year in Review: We Look Back on the Challenges and Trends that Defined 2020",
    "slug": "episode166",
    "date": "2020-12-28T08:00:28",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17292275/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_Year_In_Review_v2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"17292275\"></iframe><br />This is it – we’ve finally reached the end of 2020! I think it would be an understatement to say that it’s been a difficult year for many; but there have also been plenty of positives that we can take note of as well.</p>\n<p>So in this very special episode, I’m joined by Graham Robins from Border Buddy, who is a great friend of the show, to reflect on some of the things we’ve seen and done, to round out the year on a high and approach 2021 with a really positive mindset.</p>\n<p>We talk about COVID, collaboration, data, diversity and inclusion, and our plans for 2021. What a year!</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[04.56] An introduction to Graham, his background and his role at Border Buddy.</p>\n<p>[07.28] The impact of COVID and the valuable lessons we’ve learned this year, from the effect on mental health to the importance of the workers on the front line of supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Its been a transformative year for us. But we’ve learned that remote work is well suited for logistics!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.46] What we can practically take from these lessons and integrate into our strategies for 2021.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“A lot of this isn’t new – it’s just making it better! Let’s look at anything that takes extra, unnecessary time, and let’s squeeze that out.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.55] The importance of collaboration, the value to be found in improving communication and how we can continue to drive the momentum of collaborative spirit forward into 2021.</p>\n<p>[29.41] Data: how 2020 has shone a light on its benefits and encouraged a more open-minded approach.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Once you have the data, you can never go back to guesswork.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.36] The importance of diversity and inclusion, and how we can continue to open up much-needed conversations in 2021.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Everyone’s experience is different – we can’t broad brush everything. Everyone has their own lens.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[48.53] <em>“Nothing new – everything better!”</em> Border Buddy’s plans for 2021.</p>\n<p>[50.16] From the launch of Shipz and Blended, to laying big plans for the future, a snapshot of my year.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Border Buddy’s <a href=\"https://borderbuddy.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help your business.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "02ab8b2c-e6a7-4fc9-b763-f9f28db4eae4",
    "episode_number": 165,
    "post_id": 4416,
    "title": "165: Blended &#8211; The Gender Equation",
    "slug": "episode165",
    "date": "2020-12-16T08:00:02",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"border: none;\" src=\"//html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17210249/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/2c9d8f/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the third episode of Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s brand-new show, Blended.</p>\n<p>Blended is all about opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA community, people of colour, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 3, ‘The Gender Equation,’ we’re going to be exploring the different experiences that men and women have in their careers, the voices of conferences, why women have traditionally been pitted against other women, and how we can all work together to make meaningful change for the future.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[03.39] Introductions to our Blended panellists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Sofia Rivas Herrera – Airport industry data analyst, industrial engineer and supply chain ambassador</li>\n<li>Henrik Kofod-Hansen – Co-founder at novosensus</li>\n<li>Rashmeet Kaur – Supply chain consultant</li>\n<li>Jonathan Kempe – CEO and founder at Verifai</li>\n<li>Alison Cusack – Founder and principal lawyer at Cusack &amp; Co Pty Ltd</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>Why are we gatekeeping people’s passions? I just want to do what I love – and I don’t want to have to fight to do it.” Alison</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.46] What made Henrik write his paper “How a gender balance makes business better,” a summary of the findings and the groups reflections.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Imposter syndrome – the potential causes, and its wide-reaching impact</li>\n<li>Rashmeet’s perspective on the gender equation in India</li>\n<li>Sophia’s take on culture and gender in Mexico</li>\n<li>The consequences of women starting a family</li>\n<li>Jonathan’s view on why employers need to get creative when looking to solve problems of gender balance in the workplace.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Good leaders acknowledge any stage of life, and give opportunities equally.” Jonathan</p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.16] The age old issue of women being pitted against other women, and the panellists experiences.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Are women are conditioned to judge other women?</li>\n<li>The role of ego</li>\n<li>The limited roles for women, and unnecessary competition</li>\n<li>The power of internalized misogyny</li>\n<li>Why we need to be pro-active in celebrating the successes of other women.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I learned that it’s OK for other women to stand out as well.” Sofia</p></blockquote>\n<p>[56.56] The inequality often found in panels and conferences, and the excuses that the corporate world like to hide behind.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>How do we achieve diverse panels?</li>\n<li>The myth that there are no women who are interested in, or able to, contribute</li>\n<li>Why women need to say yes to everything – even if they need to figure it out later</li>\n<li>Why women need to create space for each other, coach and motivate each other whenever they can</li>\n<li>Why diverse panels are so important – and why they need to be approached with a genuine desire to do better, not as a corporate agenda</li>\n<li>Don’t be afraid to call out situations that you know aren’t right.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“Stop using ‘I’m a feminist’ as a pick-up line.” Rashmeet</p></blockquote>\n<p>[71.13] The importance of allyship.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Key things for men not to do and say if they want to be a good ally for women</li>\n<li>The exhaustion of microaggressions</li>\n<li>Why women need to give positive reinforcement for good male allies</li>\n<li>Listen to women – and believe them!</li>\n<li>The damage of the “men too” approach – don’t use women opening up about their challenges as an opportunity to talk about your own</li>\n<li>What do women need in an ally?</li>\n<li>Why we all need to get comfortable with the uncomfortable conversations.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>It’s nice to want allyship, but it seems that a lot of people aren’t equipped for it.” Henrik</p></blockquote>\n<p>[88.10] The panellists sum up one challenge and solution for the gender equation.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Stand up: the change starts with you – Rashmeet</li>\n<li>Self-belief: move away from coping to creating – Henrik</li>\n<li>Don’t be afraid to break out of your box – Sofia</li>\n<li>Drive honest and authentic conversations – Jonathan</li>\n<li>Assert your boundaries and value the relationship with yourself – Alison</li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sofia-rivas-herrera-18aa99183/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Sofia</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/henrik-kofod-hansen-9745ab7/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Henrik</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kaurrashmeet27/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Rashmeet</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonathan-kempe/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Jonathan</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alison-cusack/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Alison</a> over on LinkedIn.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "3079b295-686a-463e-b96f-f593090b0350",
    "episode_number": 164,

    "title": "164: Solving the Fundamental Problems of Freight with Convoy",
    "slug": "episode164",
    "date": "2020-12-14T08:00:06",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><br /><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17097830/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"360\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"bottom\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_164_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"standard\" libsyn_item_id=\"17097830\"></iframe>Founded in 2015, Convoy started a movement in efficient freight. Through their customer-centric approach, ethical commitment and unique technology, that creates smarter ways to connect shippers with carriers, they’re helping to solve problems, reduce waste and create a better future.</p>\n<p>Today, I’ll be talking to Lorin Seeks to find out a bit more about the Convoy network and how it’s utilising machine learning to solve the challenge of quality and compliance for small and midsize shippers.</p>\n<h2><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h2>\n<p>[06.59] Lorin’s background, his career in the army and how he fell in love with logistics.</p>\n<p>[11.08] A closer look at Convoy, what it does and how it works.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Convoy is the nation’s most efficient digital freight network.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.34] The four core areas of risk and compliance that every shipper needs to consider.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Shippers are facing legal, financial, service and reputational risks every time they ship freight.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.27] Why these areas can present real challenges for small and mid-market shippers.</p>\n<p>[23.45] How intermediaries and brokers are addressing risk and compliance, to ensure they can be a reliable and trusted partner for SME’s.</p>\n<p>[28.05] The Convoy solution, and the power of machine learning.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The more data we feed it, the more accurate it becomes – because it’s a learning algorithm, it gets better over time.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.28] The positive customer response to Convoy solutions.</p>\n<p>[33.27] From higher safety levels to lower claims, the benefits that shippers will see from the Convoy platform, through removing bias and human error.</p>\n<p>[38.51] Levelling the playing field for all customers, and a case study of how Convoy were able to solve a very specific problem for one customer in particular.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We were able to come with solutions – and we were able to cut theft by about 90%.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[43.15] The future for quality, safety and compliance – and for Convoy.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<h2><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h2>\n<p>Head over to Convoy’s <a href=\"http://www.convoy.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "096b6795-d413-4f2a-b918-7de6d970c3c3",
    "episode_number": 163,
    "post_id": 11588,
    "title": "163: Women In Supply Chain™, Sangna Mistry Kuhia",
    "slug": "163-women-in-supply-chain-sangna-mistry-kuhia",
    "date": "2020-12-07T17:35:44",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/17002838/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>From gaining her degree in Organizational Psychology &amp; Human Resources Management, Sangna has gone on to achieve huge success in her field. With an interest in technology and engineering, leadership roles at companies like Flextronics, Solectron and Meggitt have led her to her current role at Apex. She’s the Vice President of Human Resources for the Americas and has been doing some incredible work there for the past five years.</p>\n<p>Today Sangna will be talking to us about her long-standing HR career, her passion for people and the future of business.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[07.32] Sangna’s background and how she sidestepped from clinical psychology to HR.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Instead of one person at a time, I get to have an impact on a whole workforce.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.21] How Sangna began at Apex, and her role building their HR structure.</p>\n<p>[10.42] A closer look at Sangna’s responsibilities at Apex.</p>\n<p>[11.51] The impact of working in employee relations.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You are the facilitator – you are the polarized atmosphere, being part of an organization that values you, is more important than ever.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.18] What drew Sangna to technology and engineering, and how she ended up in logistics.</p>\n<p>[23.25] How the face of HR has changed over the years.</p>\n<p>[25.11] From remote working to the impact of COVID-19, the HR trends to watch out for.</p>\n<p>[27.11] The future, and a woman means to Sangna.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Finding your voice, for me, has been about building credibility with confidence.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.18] What Sangna has learned about herself along     "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16940801/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"></iframe></p>\n<p>Adebayo Adeleke is a supply chain enthusiast, businessman, social entrepreneur, retired U.S Army Officer and global thought leader all rolled into one. From Jordan to Japan, Africa to Afghanistan, he’s gathered his impressive knowledge and expertise from around the world.</p>\n<p>Retired from the U.S Army after an impressive 20 year career, Adebayo is now Managing Partner at Pantote Solutions LLC, President and CEO of Adebayo Adeleke LLC, a Principal Partner and Senior Supply Chain Consultant for Epot Consulting Limited and a Lecturer in Supply Chain Management at the Sam Houston State University.</p>\n<p>Today Adebayo will be talking to us about his career so far, his many inspirational achievements and his passion for driving immigration reform.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[06.47] Adebayo’s background and how he fell into supply chain by chance.</p>\n<p>[10.22] What led Adebayo to join the army, and why he fell in love with it.</p>\n<p>[11.38] Adebayo’s experience of war, and what he learned.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“When I came back, I was transformed – the way I saw supply chain was totally different.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.45] The challenges and unpredictability of army logistics.</p>\n<p>[22.08] The difference between army and civilian logistics – and efficient vs effective supply chains.</p>\n<p>[26.30] The challenges Adebayo faced in his life and career as an African immigrant in the USA.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Your identity is driven from your culture, and often you have to shed some of that to be a part of this system.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.40] What drives Adebayo to be so active as an influencer for positive change.</p>\n<p>[35.21] Adebayo’s roles in the Rising Leadership Foundation and the New American Economy – and why they’re so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If we can create better leaders, we can have a better society.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[39.59] The future for Adebayo.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We need to start understanding the nuances and how we can improve supply chain globally by regionalizing our solutions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[43.51] Be true to yourself – Adebayo’s advice for anyone following in his footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Connect with Adebayo on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/adebayoadeleke/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">LinkedIn</a> to find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "related_episodes": [],

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16806290/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the fourth and final show in our “Not Just Nuts and Bolts” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.fastenal.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Fastenal</a>.</p>\n<p>Last week in Episode 3, ‘Powered by Proximity,’ I was joined by Sam Nafe, Senior VP for National Account Sales Teams at Fastenal, and Jim DeMarco, Category Manager at PGT Innovations. We talked about their successful business partnership and the topic of glocality – what it means, why it’s so important and exactly how Fastenal deliver it across the world.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, ‘Wait! Don’t Order,’ we’re talking to John Soderberg, EVP of IT at Fastenal, to talk about data and analytics: why is data so important, what kinds of data should we be focusing on and how can we use it to better our supply chains.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.04] John’s long-standing career at Fastenal, his current role and how Fastenal truly has a decentralized model.</p>\n<p>[03.00] Why data is so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s the basis for making better informed decisions.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[04.49] The types of data that supply chain professionals should be looking at right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The data we should be looking at needs to support the areas we want to improve: it needs to be measurable and we need to know where we want to take it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.44] The importance of collaboration, between both departments and businesses, in understanding and using data.</p>\n<p>[08.57] Collecting data at a site-level, and the difficulty in keeping the consistency and discipline as you take that up to a higher level.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If there’s not an emphasis on quality in the capture, then a lot of the plans are in vain.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.22] The challenges of data at an enterprise level.</p>\n<p>[14.32] How to make data actionable.</p>\n<p>[17.26] Why it’s so important to have a trusted partner to help you manage data and create a strategy around it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The value of the data is dependent on that partnership and how you work together through it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.57] What utilizing data can look like in real terms to customers, especially when it comes to managing stock.</p>\n<p>[21.51] Why a greater understanding of data and analytics is what’s going to define the next generation of supply chain professionals.</p>\n<p>[24.16] The future, and why Fastenal plan on getting even closer to their customers.</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Fastenal’s <a href=\"https://www.fastenal.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

We’ll be talking about their successful partnership and the topic of glocality – what it means, why it’s so important and exactly how Fastenal deliver it across the world.</p>\n<h3><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h3>\n<p>[01.09] Sam’s career at Fastenal, his current role and why the percentage of Fastenal’s customer-facing staff might surprise you.</p>\n<p>[02.22] PGT’s history, and Jim’s current role.</p>\n<p>[03.40] What is glocality, and what does it mean for Fastenal and its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It allows the team to be creative… to achieve the objectives of each customer.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[05.33] Why PGT chose Fastenal as a trusted partner.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We take partnership seriously – we like to grow together.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.30] Fastenal’s lean solutions, and how they helped PGT with their onsite needs.</p>\n<p>[10.39] The challenges PGT were seeing which led to their partnership with Fastenal.</p>\n<p>[11.55] The benefits that PGT have seen from working with Fastenal.</p>\n<p>[13.35] How Fastenal were able to help PGT through the COVID-19 crisis, ensuring their supply chain.</p>\n<p>[16.29] Why it was so important to PGT that Fastenal could pivot quickly and continue to meet their needs in testing times.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Fastenal were able to preserve our glove allocation, which was critical.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.29] A closer look at how Fastenal were able to support their customers through the crisis, and continue to supply much-needed PPE.</p>\n<p>[20.44] Jim’s take on the future of PGT and Fastenal’s partnership.</p>\n<p>[21.34] The future of that partnership from Fastenal’s perspective.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Ultimately, we need to listen, as Jim’s business continues to evolve.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.49] From cost to response time, Jim explains why businesses should choose Fastenal.</p>\n<p>[25.07] The future of supply chain and how Fastenal will be innovating     "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16835039/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the second episode of Let’s Talk Supply Chain’s brand-new show, Blended.</p>\n<p>Blended is all about opening up conversations and giving the mic to all of the underrepresented voices in our industry – women, the LGBTQIA community, people of color, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden, and many more.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, ‘Story of my Life,’ we’re going to be delving into our guest’s personal stories: the experiences that made them who they are today and the impact, both positive and negative, that those experiences have had on their lives and careers.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[03.23] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Madison Mobley – Senior Account Executive at Fairmarkit</li>\n<li>Lamont Robinson – President and CEO at Robinson LaRueCo Consulting, LLC</li>\n<li>Claudia Freed – CEO and President at EALgreen</li>\n<li>Martin Stark – IT Strategic Sourcing Lead at University of Sydney and Founder and CEO World Gay Boxing Championships</li>\n<li>Angie Reno – Director of Procurement, Government Services at Crowley</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[09.35] Martin’s story; from serious ill health to harnessing his courage, finding his voice and following his own path.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our experiences propel us forward.” <em>Martin</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.18] How minorities can find themselves the butt of the joke and often find themselves joining in, in order to fit in and not rock the boat.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Why we need to keep sharing in order to move the dial of what’s appropriate.</li>\n<li>How inappropriate humor, and using jokes to demean, is not particular to one community.</li>\n<li>How we can use these incidents as opportunities to educate and ask questions.</li>\n<li>How jokes can often be a repeated turn of phrase, learned from previous generations, used without truly thinking about or understanding the meaning.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m a black Mormon (which is rare!) so I’d get a lot of those ‘jokes;’ and if I don’t stand up and speak out, I’m doing not only myself a disservice but also anybody else that’s at a disadvantage.” <em>Lamont</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.40] Madison’s experience as a black woman growing up in the suburbs, and the panelists reflections on language.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Forums such as this, where we’re telling stories and educating each other around all the different flavors of humanity, are so important. And the more we do this, the more visibility we have into one another’s real life experiences – and then you can begin to adjust how we speak to one another.” <em>Madison </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.37] Claudia’s story, the boardroom experience that opened her eyes and the groups reflections on the power of words.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It said to me that women are not valued in financial transactions.” <em>Claudia </em></p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>The implications of words, and the intent behind them.</li>\n<li>The proliferation of casual discrimination in the workplace.</li>\n<li>English as a second language, and understanding nuance and phraseology.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[30.03] Madison’s story, how it led to her passion for humanitarianism and the panelists reflections on background, privilege and self-improvement.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Taking a hard line vs a soft line.</li>\n<li>Using your privilege for good.</li>\n<li>Being an example to others.</li>\n<li>Calling each other out when you need to.</li>\n<li>What it means to fit in, or not fit in.</li>\n<li>The danger of labels and assumptions based on issues like gender, race, religion or sexuality.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[51.55] Angie’s story, facing misogyny in the workplace and the groups reflections on behaviors and encouraging change.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>How do you take your experience and learn from it or change it?</li>\n<li>How do we think about gender bias?</li>\n<li>How our experiences impact us and/or change our behavior.</li>\n<li>Our reactions to our experiences, and other people’s perceptions of those reactions.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“As women we’re in a dichotomy: on one side we have to be assertive and confident, and on the other side we have to be very mindful that we’re being watched, in terms of our reactions.” <em>Claudia</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[70.13] The one piece of advice the panelists would share from their personal stories:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>If you’re not aligning, get out! – Angie</li>\n<li>Follow your passion – Lamont</li>\n<li>See color, and seek to understand – Madison</li>\n<li>Have courage, fear nothing and live your life for yourself – Martin</li>\n<li>Believe in yourself – Claudia</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>You can connect with all of our amazing panelists on LinkedIn – <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/madisonmobley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Madison</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/claudiafreed/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Claudia</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lamontrobinson/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Lamont</a>, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/martin-stark-he-him-his-8a3807179/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Martin</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/angiereno/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Angie</a> – if you’d like to find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16793048/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>As a maverick in the freight forwarding industry, <a href=\"https://www.shipglobalgateway.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Global Gateway Logistics</a> believes in the creative persistence of deep analysis, learned experience and exceptional customer service. No matter the obstacle, operational challenge or budgetary constraint, Global Gateway Logistics will work tirelessly to support businesses supply chain and logistical needs.</p>\n<p>A committed and forward-thinking freight forwarder and NVOCC, Gateway Global Logistics provide insights and recommendations through data analysis and experience to create game-changing solutions for your business operations.</p>\n<p>Today, Caitlin Murphy, Founder &amp; Managing Director of Operations, joins me to talk about Global Gateway Logistics, her approach to business and how exactly we go about creating transparent, strategic and successful supply chains.</p>\n<h3><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h3>\n<p>[08.57] Caitlin’s background and how previous job dissatisfaction led to her founding Global Gateway Logistics.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I had confidence that I could make an impact – and that confidence, coupled with my passion, outweighed the fear.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.29] Exactly what Global Gateway Logistics does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We are determined to simplify global logistics, and we do that through customer service and technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.39] What makes Global Gateway Logistics different, and its focus on diversity and creative thinking.</p>\n<p>[22.22] Combining the power of data and technology with the power of people.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The more that we’re all interconnected through technology, and can utilize it with a boutique customer service: that’s truly the future of freight forwarding.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.47] The importance of talking about business on a global scale, partnerships and the benefits of global export.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We have a duty to promote global trade.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[37.14] A real life example of how Global Gateway Logistics helped a key customer.</p>\n<p>[40.01] Growth, growth, growth – the future of Global Gateway Logistics.</p>\n<h3><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></h3>\n<p>Head over to Global Gateway Logistics’ <a href=\"https://www.shipglobalgateway.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

do and how they’ve evolved to become a global company, with a local focus, who are much more than just nuts and bolts.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, ‘Bring Us Your Problems,’ we’re chatting with Kris Van Dalen and taking a closer look at Fastenal’s onsite solutions, their response to the COVID-19 crisis and how we can prepare our businesses and supply chains for the future.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.05] Kris’s career at Fastenal, and how the scope of their offering might just surprise you.</p>\n<p>[02.47] Fastenal’s comprehensive COVID-19 response – which became far more than simply delivering PPE.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The problem became much more than just the availability of an item.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.37] How the COVID crisis has taught us why it’s so important to have trusted supply chain partners in place <strong>before</strong> a crisis happens.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Our evolution is hinged on relationship-building, and the management of those relationships.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.00] What Fastenal’s on-site model looks like and how it changes to meet customer needs.</p>\n<p>[17.44] How Fastenal’s local presence and decentralized decision making helped to keep customers afloat during the COVID crisis.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Their success is what drives ours.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.19] A closer look at Fastenal’s ‘last mile’ system and why they do it differently.</p>\n<p>[28.55] How we can future-proof our supply chains.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Supplier integration, tighter How Loadshop helps shippers to break out of their comfort zone by opening up a wider breadth of supplier choice.</p>\n<p>[21.04] The role that platforms like Loadshop play in modern supply     "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16565312/height/360/theme/standard/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>From an early interest in engineering and logistics, going all the way back to education-level, Carolina has gone on to have an exciting and varied career in the industry. Now, as a logistics leader at top IT company Lenovo, she’s channelling all that incredible insight and experience into creating robust and effective logistics operations across Latin America.</p>\n<p>Today Carolina will be talking to us about her career so far, her many inspirational achievements and her long-standing love for logistics.</p>\n<h3><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></h3>\n<p>[07.52] Carolina’s background, her interest in international business and culture, and the variety of experiences that have led her to where she is today.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Those experiences were the ones that opened my eyes and allowed me to see the different roles you can perform within supply chain – that has been, and still is, the most exciting part.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.54] How Carolina has followed her heart during the course of her life and career, and her passion for giving back to the community.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“My driver is ‘do everything with passion – do and learn new things!’”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.30] The challenges, excitement and growth that Carolina discovered whilst living in China.</p>\n<p>[15.55] How experience, and destiny, brought Carolina to Lenovo.</p>\n<p>[18.34] How Lenovo’s support helped Carolina to find her voice and drive her forward in her current role.</p>\n<p>[22.07] Carolina’s passion for logistics, and why women need to take advantage of the momentum happening in diversity right now.</p>\n<p>[25.35] How women need to advocate for themselves, to change their own bias and make the discussion around diversity and inclusion a two-way conversation.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re on the first step of a marathon.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.21] The challenges that Carolina has faced over the years, including being the only woman in the board room.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We need to create the sense that we belong there – and that we’ve earned it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.57] From personal and professional growth, and her new project WEL, what the future holds for Carolina.</p>\n<p>[35.31] Follow your passion and work hard, Carolina’s advice for women following in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/carolina-de-la-paz-22608751/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with Carolina and find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16565165/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the fourth and final show in our “What Does Intermodal Mean to You” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">IANA</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode, ‘The Technology,’ I was joined by Phil Shook, Vice President at C.H. Robinson, to talk about exactly what kinds of tech is used in the industry; the importance of connectivity and partnerships; why technology companies themselves are attracted to the intermodal industry – and the role IANA thinks tech will play in the industry moving forward.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, ‘The Workforce,’ I’m joined by Mark McKendry, Vice President North American Intermodal at NFI, to shine a light on workforce development: the trends, the skills, the challenges – and what the future will look like for people in supply chain.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.14] Mark’s role at NFI and a key misconception about intermodal.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The perception of intermodal is that it’s a minor player compared to truck.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[02.19] e-commerce acceleration, a major supply chain trend affecting the workforce right now.</p>\n<p>[03.57] From smaller, local warehouses to staff who work remotely, the current trends in decentralised workforces.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The pandemic has brought us 10 years into the future, to show us what decentralised work can really look like.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[5.15] From truck driving shortages to curiosity and a willingness to learn, the skills that are needed in intermodal right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Being curious can get you into a leadership role in this industry.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.12] Technology within intermodal – its impact, and current gaps.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There are far too many pieces of proprietary technology – there’s no real dominant player”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.57] The challenges to entering intermodal, and the benefits of being a generalist.</p>\n<p>[18.09] What is an IMC, and their benefits.</p>\n<p>[19.33] Developing workforces for the future.</p>\n<p>[23.10] Whether a certain level of education is needed to enter supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s a strong argument for not needing college degrees for many of the roles in our industry.</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to IANA’s <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
