    "post_id": 11632,
    "title": "151: Digital Business Plans include Blockchain",
    "slug": "151-digital-business-plans-include-blockchain",
    "date": "2020-10-26T19:40:43",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16480856/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Jon Trask founded Digital SCM over 12 years ago and as the industry changed, he kept up. He went on to found ETA Guru and Identity Guru, which ultimately came together with Digital SCM to create <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210506211358/https://blockchainguru.ca/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Blockchain Guru</a>, the powerhouse company we’re talking about today.</p>\n<p>Blockchain Guru is working at the forefront of emerging tech, blending tested technology with modern advancements to deliver tangible results.</p>\n<p>Today, Jon and I will be chatting about artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency and their benefits; how Blockchain Guru is making big changes in supply chain, and how emerging tech will help to shape the future of, not just logistics, but the world.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[07.51] What exactly is blockchain.</p>\n<p>[08.55] The benefits of sharing data.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“People are generally reluctant to share their data, but [sharing data] gives you the ability to have a better, more robust process in improving your business.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.21] From reducing third party dependency to creating immutable data, the benefits of blockchain.</p>\n<blockquote><p> “In a world where we’re always worried about data security, blockchain changes what data security looks like.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.34] The relationship between blockchain and bitcoin.</p>\n<p>[15.33] The idea of data as currency.</p>\n<p>[16.40] An overview of AI and machine learning, and its benefits.</p>\n<p>[20.55] The balance between people and technology.</p>\n<p>[24.41] An overview of Blockchain Guru, and ETA Guru.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We help an organisation to define a problem, and then solution that problem.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.31] A closer look at Digital SCM, and how the industry has changed since its inception 12 years ago.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Historically, a lot of our work was around helping companies who are struggling with their existing technology. So, the mission hasn’t changed, but what’s changed is the technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.32] Examples of how Blockchain Guru has helped customers to make efficiencies and save money.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s amazing how much value is hidden in the data.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[40.54] When, and why, you should get in touch with Blockchain Guru.</p>\n<p>[43.58] From problem-solving to a unique solution for cattle-tracing, the future for Blockchain Guru.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Blockchain Guru’s <a href=\"https://blockchainguru.ca/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

Robinson to talk about exactly what kinds of tech are used in the industry; the importance of connectivity and partnerships; why technology companies themselves are attracted to the intermodal industry – and the role IANA thinks tech will play in the industry moving forward.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.20] Phil’s 20+ year career at C.H. Robinson, how much he’s seen the industry change over that time, and his current role in staying abreast of technology so he can make the right decisions for their intermodal business line.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Collaboration is why the change has been so quick, and so successful.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.41] From track and trace and cargo sensors all the way to AI and machine learning, the key technology defining the intermodal industry right now.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s starting to get more integrated – and smarter.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.40] The chain of custody in intermodal and how advancements in technology are helping to deliver a much higher degree of confidence for clients.</p>\n<p>[08.25] The importance of data to consumer buying habits, and how key industry problems can be solved with data driven insights.</p>\n<p>[12.39] How data drives connectivity and transparency, allowing businesses to measure up against best in class, create efficiencies and collaborate to drive better outcomes and solutions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Presenting data in a non-threatening and fact-based way opens up conversations, and customers are willing to change behavior because of it.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.18] Why tech companies are focusing on intermodal, and supply chain in general.</p>\n<p>[23.46] From growth in AI and machine learning to investment in railroad, the future of intermodal and supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We need to make sure we’re developing the technology to keep up with an ever-changing consumer buying habit.”</p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to IANA’s <a href=\"http://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

Through their years of industry experience, they’ve helped businesses across Canada to manage risk, secure finance and establish themselves on a global platform.</p>\n<p>Today, we talk to Zeeshan Fazal, Senior Account Manager – Technology Group at EDC to talk about helping SME’s achieve global success, how COVID-19 has affected the nations’ industry and the huge role EDC plays in supporting the Canadian economy.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[08.08] An overview of EDC, how they began and how they can help.</p>\n<p>[10.39] EDC’s financial solutions, and their focus on managing risk.</p>\n<p>[13.45] EDC’s non-financial solutions, and how they help Canadian businesses to navigate the international market.</p>\n<p>[19.26] How EDC’s Global Trade Team find and facilitate opportunities, by analyzing the global market and ‘matchmaking’ with Canadian businesses.</p>\n<p>[24.15] The importance of championing SME’s, and their benefits over big business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The world is asking for innovative solutions, and flexibility.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.43] A real life success story, and the EDC solutions that facilitated it, including risk management, and secure credit lines.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Try to protect yourself as much as possible when you’re beginning a new relationship.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[38.13] EDC’s integrity and commitment to social responsibility.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re all learning, but it’s important to start off with a robust approach to ensure we’re living in a fair world that promotes peace and justice.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[42.24] The impact of COVID-19 and how EDC pivoted to support Canadian business in their time of need.</p>\n<p>[47.01] Ambition, growth and innovation, the future for both EDC and Canadian business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Canadian companies have proven on the global scale that they’re innovative and have the capabilities to respond to global demand.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to EDC’s <a href=\"https://www.edc.ca/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer     "post_id": 11640,
    "title": "148: What Does Intermodal Mean To You – The Equipment",
    "slug": "148-what-does-intermodal-mean-to-you-the-equipment",
    "date": "2020-10-15T18:47:32",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16343111/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the second show in our “What Does Intermodal Mean to You” series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">IANA</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘The Industry,’ we spoke to Jim Newsome President and CEO of the South Carolina Ports Authority in Charleston. We found out more about what the intermodal industry is, how it works and how ecommerce has changed the landscape of the industry. We learned more about IANA and its role within the industry, and about the impressive investment in infrastructure that Jim has been overseeing over at the South Carolina Ports Authority.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, ‘The Equipment’ we’re talking to Frank Sonzala, CEO of CIE Manufacturing. We’re going to explore what equipment is key within the intermodal industry, what role it plays in keeping freight moving, why maintenance is so important – and we’ll be having a little bit of fun with a maintenance horror story, to remind you why paying attention to the details can make or break your supply chain.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.01] Frank’s impressive 37 years in the industry, and how he moved from vendor to in-house with CIE Manufacturing.</p>\n<p>[02.45] From containers to cranes, the various components that come together to make up the intermodal industry.</p>\n<p>[07.29] The improvements Frank has seen in road safety.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In 2010 when CSA came in, the chassis really started to blossom into a maintenance machine that was taken care of on a timely basis instead of on a breakdown basis.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.33] A maintenance horror story – why pro-active maintenance and repair is vital.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Quality and safety mean so much!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.31] IANA’s maintenance and repair committee, and the benefit it brings to the intermodal industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re all about preventative maintenance now.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.21] How IANA established best practice for the industry and have so successfully connected its disparate elements.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The future is bright for intermodal and it needs bright young people to carry on the torch.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.29] How technology has changed the face of intermodal.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to IANA’s <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/?utm_source=LTSC&amp;utm_medium=referral&amp;utm_campaign=RECRUIT\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> and<a href=\"https://ciemanufacturing.com/about/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\"> CIE Manufacturing</a>‘s website now to find out more and discover how they could help you   {
    "uuid": "38517da5-c4c3-4327-9cb9-f97301ce18bc",
    "episode_number": 147,
    "post_id": 11642,
    "title": "147: Blended Episode 1: What’s In A Word",
    "slug": "147-blended-episode-1-whats-in-a-word",
    "date": "2020-10-14T18:52:12",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16385276/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Welcome to Blended! This is a brand new show for Let’s Talk Supply Chain and it’s going to be a little bit different to what you’ve heard before.</p>\n<p>We talk a lot about the challenges facing our industry as a whole – changing technology, network complexity, surprises like COVID-19 – but what we don’t talk as much about is the people. The people that really drive our industry forward. And specifically, the under-represented people in our industry.</p>\n<p>I’ve been flying the flag for Women In Supply Chain™ for a few years now, through the podcast and some of my other endeavors, but Blended is going to go much further than that. Because it’s not just women who are a minority – we need to be thinking about the LGBTQIA community, people of color, those with disabilities, whether they’re visible or hidden.</p>\n<p>As minorities, we need to join together to support each other and be each other’s allies – to ensure we ALL have a seat at the table to make our industry the absolute best it can be.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, ‘What’s in a Name,’ we’re going to be talking all about the language we use when discussing minorities – what do these words mean to us, and to others; are there right or wrong words to use, and what are the subtexts of those words; and what does diversity, inclusion and identity mean to us.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[03.29] Introductions to our Blended panelists.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Prakash M Radhakrishnan – Courier Operations at Toll and award-winning YouTube producer with a focus on disability and mental health.</li>\n<li>Holly Qualman – VP of Marketing and Client Solutions America for Apex Logistics and adopted Korean-American woman, flying the flag for multi-racial unity.</li>\n<li>Matthew Hernandez – General Manger for North America at Xenata and representative of both the LatinX and LGBTQIA communities.</li>\n<li>Hope White – Founder and CEO of HD White Logistics, Founder of Hope White Consulting and Logistically Speaking Online and proud black woman.</li>\n<li>Greg White – Founder of Blue Ridge Global, host of Supply Chain Now and father of daughters, with native American heritage.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[11.23] The word ‘minority’ and its connotations.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s time to think about the world on a global scale.” Greg.</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Is it a beneficial or derogatory term?</li>\n<li>Does it perpetuate the feeling of being ‘other’ or ‘less than,’ since its technical definition is less than half the whole?</li>\n<li>How does the insistence on labelling people affect mental health and self-esteem?</li>\n<li>How does being a minority affect your goals and ambitions – are they personal to you, or are they developed so you can conform to a societal norm?</li>\n<li>Are we designed to keep each other at arm’s length; is the tendency towards segregation a result of evolution – how do we push the reset button on human nature?</li>\n<li>Are labels necessary at all, or are we all just people?</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s another stage of evolution – before we develop the language for it, we need to understand how we got here.” Matthew.</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.20] What words should we be using specifically for the disability community?</p>\n<blockquote><p>“There’s no rulebook – and the disability community feel the same.” Prakash</p></blockquote>\n<p>[36.10] The impact of upbringing.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Why the way that we’re raised is so vital – prejudice is learnt, or tackled, at an early age.</li>\n<li>Why we need to support everyone to succeed, and make sure that those at a disadvantage get equal if not greater support.</li>\n<li>The danger in not taking on board peoples experiences and viewpoints because of preconceptions.</li>\n<li>How the use of incorrect labels muddies the water and creates confusion.</li>\n<li>Assumption is ignorance: the importance of being able to continue to interpret and learn.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[44.12] What words should we be using specifically for the LGBTQIA community and people of color?</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Why it’s important to take the time to listen.</li>\n<li>How some words have traditionally been used to separate minorities and make them ‘an other.’</li>\n<li>Why education is so important.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[55.28] The importance of identity.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s not what you’re called, it’s what you answer to.” Hope</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>Why we all need to be in charge of our own identities.</li>\n<li>How descriptors have changed over time and the impact that those changes have had.</li>\n<li>Why it’s OK to ask, as long as you’re asking for the right reason.</li>\n<li>Why we need to pay attention to the nuances of individual identities.</li>\n<li>The responsibility of minorities to educate others.</li>\n<li>The importance of open and honest conversations, that come from a place of empathy and understanding.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>[69.09] Today’s buzzwords: diversity and inclusion.</p>\n<blockquote><p>So many of us minorities have to jump through so many hoops just to get a small slither of the pie.” Hope</p></blockquote>\n<ul>\n<li>What do these words mean to us?</li>\n<li>Can you have one without the other?</li>\n<li>How the meaning of diversity and inclusion can be influenced by how we’re raised, or what we’re exposed to on a long-term basis.</li>\n<li>Why diversity and inclusion also need to include processes to build the foundations for education and understanding and promoting acceptance.</li>\n</ul>\n<blockquote><p><em>Often in the corporate world, we know there’s a problem, but we very seldom have the opportunity to talk about it openly.” Matthew</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[80.16] Our summaries of ‘what’s in a name.’</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Keep an open mind – Holly</li>\n<li>Everyone has a story – Hope</li>\n<li>Don’t be scared to ask the question – Prakash</li>\n<li>Take some time to self-reflect – Matthew</li>\n<li>Seek first to understand – Greg</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
    "categories": [6550],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-600x534.png 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png 741w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16326908/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Pallet Alliance takes a holistic approach to pallet program management that’s far more than just quoting pallet prices. Through managing cost drivers like sourcing, design and implementation, they deliver comprehensive solutions tailored to fit operational requirements, whilst investments in Iot-based logistics, customized reporting, and industry-leading expertise continue to drive their ongoing improvement.</p>\n<p>And Tyson Steffens plays a key role. After holding positions at General Electric and United States Gypsum, he initially joined Pallet Alliance in 2003 as a business development manager. But now, after nearly 20 years with the company, Tyson and the team are transforming pallet program management with new technology, tailored solutions and a fresh outlook.</p>\n<p>Today Tyson will be sharing his thoughts on the importance of partnerships, championing industry improvement, and how Pallet Alliance can help you to optimize cost, quality, and efficiency through their unique collaborative approach.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[08.50] How Tyson’s background in engineering, and at United States Gypsum, led him to the pallet industry.</p>\n<p>[10.59] Exactly what Pallet Alliance does and how it helps its customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re coming in as a cross functional team of speciality buyers.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.37] The variety of options available in the pallet market, and how Pallet Alliance helps guide customers through them to find the right solution.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re material, design and program agnostic – our goal is to help the customer.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[17.33] The hurdles that companies often face when trying to source the right pallets for them, and Pallet Alliances’ holistic approach to problem-solving.</p>\n<p>[20.21] How teamwork and sourcing the right product can save time and money down the line.</p>\n<p>[22.13] Some real-life examples of the positive change and value that Pallet Alliance has delivered for its customers.</p>\n<p>[27.23] A look at Pallet Alliance’s ideal customer.</p>\n<p>[29.55] Why partnership is so important, both technically, and culturally.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Nobody can do everything by themselves – we really do need each other.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.25] Pallet Alliance’s commitment to social issues.</p>\n<p>[38.25] From organic growth to a focus on de-risking, the future for Pallet Alliance.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re the people to marry the pallet world with technology.”</p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Pallet Alliance’s <a href=\"https://tpai.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "24617a1f-1d25-480e-a79e-4e83d1715c2a",
    "episode_number": 145,
    "post_id": 11648,
    "title": "145: What Does Intermodal Mean to You – The Industry",
    "slug": "145-what-does-intermodal-mean-to-you-the-industry",
    "date": "2020-10-08T19:12:19",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16249673/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This is the first episode of our latest mini-series in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">IANA</a>: The Intermodal Association of North America. Over the next four episodes, our “What Does Intermodal Mean to You?” series is going to take a closer look at the intermodal industry and its benefits, the equipment and technology that serves it, and all of the different people involved.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, The Industry, I’m talking to Jim Newsome President and CEO of the South Carolina Ports Authority in Charleston. We’ll be finding out exactly what the intermodal industry is and how it works; looking at how ecommerce has changed the landscape of intermodal in recent years; learning more about IANA and its role within the industry; and finding out about the impressive investment in infrastructure that Jim has been overseeing over at the South Carolina Ports Authority.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.25] Jim’s background, his role with the South Carolina Ports Authority and a closer look at what the intermodal industry is.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“To me it’s the confluence of modes of transportation to provide an efficient product.” </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.52] From 3PL’s to container shipping, the key intermodal supply chain players.</p>\n<p>[06.51] The benefits of intermodal transportation.</p>\n<p>[10.09] The need for better infrastructure and the challenge of planning for growth.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our port, by the end of next year, will have invested over 2 billion dollars in infrastructure.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.55] Why global businesses, like BMW, set up home and invest near ports.</p>\n<p>[15.12] The possibility of re-shoring manufacturing post-COVID.</p>\n<p>[17.28] A closer look at the South Carolina Ports Authority’s recent investment projects.</p>\n<p>[19.49] Exactly what an Inland Port is, and its benefits.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s been a winning concept for us. We’ve quadrupled the volume of moves per day in the last decade.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.34] What the next 5 years might look like for the industry.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We’re seeing a renaissance in retail distribution.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.30] The future of technology and automation in intermodal.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to IANA’s <a href=\"https://www.intermodal.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "tags": [],

  {
    "uuid": "556f1043-a194-417f-86d9-6b0fb06b6ddf",
    "episode_number": 144,
    "post_id": 11651,
    "title": "144: Women In Supply Chain™, Michelle Livingstone",
    "slug": "144-women-in-supply-chain-michelle-livingstone",
    "date": "2020-10-05T19:14:56",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16235075/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>From gaining her degree in Business, with a concentration in transportation, Michelle has gone from strength to strength. Her career has seen her achieve leadership roles within large organizations from Kraft to JC Penney, move all around the USA, and now sees her helping to shape the whole future of transport and supply chain, as the Vice President of Transportation for The Home Depot.</p>\n<p>She’s also actively engaged within the industry and serves on the boards of a host of different associations, advising the industry and championing female leadership.</p>\n<p>Today Michelle tells us all about her impressive career, her love for, and commitment to, the industry and the importance of supporting Women In Supply Chain™.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[06.44] How lively conversations with her trucking Father brought Michelle to supply chain, despite wanting to be a teacher in her early years.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Never underestimate the power of a dinner conversation with your children!</p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.28] How a part-time job at a burger restaurant in her early teens helped Michelle to find her voice, through a focus on customer service and communication with management.</p>\n<p>[10.17] The importance of mentorship and how, on reflection, the pressure of being a woman in a male-dominated industry meant Michelle didn’t always use her voice the way she now feels she could, or should, have.</p>\n<p>[13.10] How The Home Depots’ ethos matches with Michelle’s; and the challenges as well as the positives of working for the company.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If you enjoy fast-paced, high-energy, challenging, thought-provoking workload, being in supply chain and transportation is a great area to be in.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.50] How COVID has affected supply chain, and the benefits it’s brought along with it, from improved technology to more flexible communication.</p>\n<p>[15.50] How an understanding of data is going to be key for the next generation.</p>\n<p>[17.30] The benefits of engaging with the industry and taking seats on boards, from networking to giving back.</p>\n<p>[20.11] How organisations like AWESOME are changing the game for women in business, and the importance of continuing to champion female voices.</p>\n<p>[21.37] An overview of AWESOME.</p>\n<p>[23.22] The challenges and benefits of the industry, particularly for women.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The benefits far outweigh the challenges I’ve experienced.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.51] Why Michelle now serves on the board of the Supply Chain Academy at Indiana University, the same institution where she gained her own degree.</p>\n<p>[28.45] Michelle’s passion for working with people and helping them to achieve their own sets of goals and dreams.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It keeps me energised every day.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.39] Michelle’s advice for up and coming women in supply in chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Just do it! If you don’t allow it to intimidate you, you will be pleasantly surprised at all the wonderful things you too will accomplish.”</p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/michelle-livingstone-3470577/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> to connect with Michelle and find out more.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5388, 5345, 5515],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-600x534.png 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png 741w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "8836c45d-6433-45df-a549-00ee100df54d",
    "episode_number": 143,
    "post_id": 11653,
    "title": "143: Making an Impact: Global Health Supply Chains",
    "slug": "143-making-an-impact-global-health-supply-chains",
    "date": "2020-09-28T19:18:20",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16127852/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.parsyl.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Parsyl</a> is on a mission to improve the quality of goods we all rely on; from the foods we eat to the medicines we need. They provide insurance products as well as GPS tracking technology, with cell phone monitoring and data analytics through their web platform, to allow companies to take control of their supply chain. And they’re also utilizing that commercial technology to solve major global health challenges, making them a unique player in the supply chain industry.</p>\n<p>Today I’m delighted to be joined by Ben Hubbard, co-founder and CEO of Parsyl, to talk all about the company’s amazing offering, including their game-changing software and insurance products, and the future of supply chain. Not to mention their partnerships with a range of organizations, from governments to ministries of health, to innovate and strengthen global health supply chains and improve lives.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[07.29] Ben’s background in economic and global health development, an overview of Parsyl and why Ben founded the company.</p>\n<p>[09.29] How Parsyl is helping in the current pandemic with its international partnerships, risk management and insurance solutions.</p>\n<p>[11.31] A closer look at what Parsyl does, from technology to data.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We’re really focused on the data insights – it’s great to understand what happens on a particular shipment, but the deep insight comes from understanding what’s happening across lots of shipments.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.50] The changing face of insurance, including risk, cost and why it’s so important.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We have the widest, best temperature sensitive insurance coverage at Parsyl.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.16] The global health side of Parsyl and its incredible impact across the world.</p>\n<p>[24.46] A few real-life examples of how Parsyl have helped clients, with challenges from insurance to vaccine transportation.</p>\n<p>[28.56] Parsyl’s ideal customer, and why it’s so important to help all links in the supply chain to better understand and use the data Parsyl can provide.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Often data loggers are thrown in the trash, and it’s a tragedy. We love data at Parsyl, and we want make sure it gets up to the cloud, analysed and integrated.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.29] The future of supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The dividend from being strategic about data collection and use is going to create a real delta between the winners and the losers.”  </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.39] How Parsyl’s software differentiates them from the competition.</p>\n<p>[35.38] From a focus on COVID-19, to rolling out insurance and delving deeper into the seafood industry, what the future holds for Parsyl.</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Parsyl’s <a href=\"https://www.parsyl.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "0c96c21b-3ec4-4f56-884f-649732405a4f",

    "post_id": 11655,
    "title": "Episode 142 – Lessons Learned From Crisis: Collaborate To Success",
    "slug": "episode-142-lessons-learned-from-crisis-collaborate-to-success",
    "date": "2020-09-24T19:20:48",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16097102/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>We’re back with Episode 4, which I’m sad to say is the final episode, of our “Lessons Learned from Crisis” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tealbook</a>. Over the course of these four episodes I’ve really enjoyed talking to some of the leaders from Tealbook; getting to understand their platform, how they work and their amazing ethos. And, of course, I’ve loved being able to dive into some important discussions around the challenges in our industry right now and the lessons we can take from them, to help us to create robust strategies for the future. I hope you’ve enjoyed the series just as much as I have and don’t forget, you can still catch up on any episodes you might’ve missed <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘Diversity Matters,’ we were joined by Tealbook’s COO Ian Woodbury to talk about the importance of diversity, what the COVID crisis has taught Tealbook about resilience and innovation and how, as a company, they continue to evolve to support a rapidly changing industry.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 4, Collaborate To Success, I‘m joined by Tealbook’s VP of Customer Success Kate Hands to talk about the importance of easy communication and collaboration to the future of supply chain, Tealbook’s many and varied benefits and their top 3 tips for surviving a crisis.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[01.07] Kate’s background, why she was drawn to Tealbook and her role within the company.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“After hearing more about the Tealbook offering, it was too compelling not to be able to help other clients with their procurement and supply chain transformation journeys.” </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[02.58] Why empathy is key to surviving a crisis.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The very nature of a crisis is that it’s unexpected, so it’s so important for companies to be agile and be able to adapt quickly.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[04.18] How the Tealbook platform has helped its customers pro-actively engage with suppliers, from giving loan relief to small businesses to supporting minority business in light of Black Lives Matter.</p>\n<p>[05.37] A typical relationship between Tealbook and their customers.</p>\n<p>[08.18] How Tealbook encourages collaboration, from innovating with clients to sharing the creative ways different companies have used their platform.</p>\n<p>[09.37] A closer look at Tealbook functionality and client-supplier collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Having this data, immediately, at your fingertips: you just can’t put a price on that.”  </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.28] Why communication and collaboration are so vital in the current climate.</p>\n<p>[14.43] Kate’s role in customer success, what that means, and the benefits that come from a customer-centric approach.</p>\n<p>[17.09] From cost savings and operational streamlining to supply chain continuity, the many benefits of the Tealbook platform.</p>\n<p>[23.30] How data has been neglected and how the COVID crisis has helped to shine a light on just how important good data is.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The pandemic has kick-started a lot of data-review initiatives, but data has been neglected for far too long.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.03] Tealbook’s top 3 tips for helping clients in crisis.</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Tealbook’s <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "Episode 141: Breaking Glass Ceilings in Supply Chain",
    "slug": "episode-141-breaking-glass-ceilings-in-supply-chain",
    "date": "2020-09-21T19:23:39",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16048373/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Hope White is the Founder and CEO of HD White Logistics, Founder of Hope White Consulting and of Logistically Speaking Online. Having previously worked for The Home Depot in various capacities, including inbound/outbound operations, EDI and vendor compliance, inventory control, and transportation, Hope had gained all of the knowledge and experience she needed to build a successful business of her own.</p>\n<p>Now, in her various roles as CEO, logistics consultant and trainer, Hope helps companies to improve operations, develop their skill-sets and strategize, and deliver, cost-effective solutions for their supply chains.</p>\n<p>Today, we’ll be taking a closer look at Hope’s businesses – how they came about and what problems they’re solving for their respective clients – her strategy for spinning so many plates at once, and why women are the future of the trucking industry.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[09.00] How Hope’s experiences working for The Home Depot, and assisting her husband with his own business, helped her to identify a niche and go on to found HD White Logistics.</p>\n<p>[11.20] Exactly what HD White Logistics do – and an exciting announcement!</p>\n<p>[12.48] Hope’s second business, Hope White Consulting, which specializes in training for start-ups; and her ‘baby,’ Logistically Speaking Online – a comprehensive e-learning course.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We give our students an opportunity to learn, from A-Z, everything there is to know about how to establish your company the right way.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.33] UPS, one of HD White Logistics key clients; from the challenges of working with a big-name client, to the advantage of being a small company with the ability to pivot quickly and collaborate.</p>\n<p>[18.04] How Hope came to realise the importance of diversity certification and why business now comes to her, as one of the first certified minority woman-owned cross docking facilities in the Georgia Port Authority area.</p>\n<p>[22.16] Hope’s industry advocates, including sponsorship from Coca Cola.</p>\n<p>[24.32] How Hope’s roles and responsibilities vary across HD White Logistics and Hope White Consulting, and how that consulting itself varies, from established businesses to start-ups.</p>\n<p>[26.53] Hope’s ideal customers for HD White Logistics, including coming full circle and partnering with The Home Depot, several years after she left her role with them.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“I have an affinity for retail, and groceries.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.20] How Hope balances her extremely busy life, schedules and sets goals for the future, both on a professional and personal level.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“I balance with the Law of Attraction.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[32.38] Why women are the answer to trucking’s problems.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“A woman coming in can provide the trucking industry a refreshed view of the future.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.02] Hope’s mentor, a true female success story.</p>\n<p>[36.12] The future for HD White Logistics, Hope White Consulting and Logistically Speaking Online.</p>\n<p><strong> </strong></p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to <a href=\"https://www.hdwhitelogistics.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">HD White Logistics</a>, <a href=\"https://www.hdwhitelogistics.com/logistics-consulting\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Hope White Consulting</a> or <a href=\"https://logisticallyspeaking.online/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Logistically Speaking Online</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/16019372/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>We’re back with Episode 3 of our “Lessons Learned from Crisis” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tealbook</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘Stay Ready,’ we talked to Tealbook’s VP of Strategy Matt Palackdharry to talk about the importance of good data, the value to be found in transparency and collaboration and why, despite only being founded in 2014, IDC recently ranked Tealbook as the #4 procurement platform tool currently in use today.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 3, Diversity Matters, I‘m joined by Tealbook’s COO Ian Woodbury to talk about the importance of diversity, what the COVID crisis has taught Tealbook about resilience and innovation and how, as a company, they continue to evolve to support our rapidly changing industry.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[00.58] Ian’s background, his role at Tealbook and why diversity is close to his heart.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“I saw this incredible opportunity to improve the way businesses are approaching diversity.” </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.25] Why diversity in supply chain is so important.</p>\n<p>[07.47] Tealbook’s quick and easy Supplier Diversity Self-Certification process.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“I’ve timed it – from start to finish, it will take you 30 minutes.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.16] Tealbook’s Tier 2 Diversity Program and its benefits to both big businesses and small suppliers.</p>\n<p>[16.35] Why it’s so important for suppliers to participate in these kinds of programs, and really embrace a new world of diversity.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“A key part of this transformation is for suppliers to see the change, embrace it and get the benefit of it.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.20] Why technology needs to continue to evolve, and businesses need to continue to innovate so, as an industry, we can meet rapidly evolving requirements and achieve our goals.</p>\n<p>[24.48] How Tealbook invests in, and leverages, technology to stay ahead of the game and support that innovation.</p>\n<p>[26.55] How Tealbook builds trust, reduces cost and lowers risk for companies who want to work with diverse suppliers but are nervous about taking the leap.</p>\n<p>[28.51] The biggest lesson Tealbook learned from the COVID-19 crisis, and how it helped them find their niche.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We will keep innovating to provide the tools to respond to the next unknown unknown – and we all know there’s always a next one.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Tealbook’s <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "d69182c7-4e5c-4912-9e07-722996931995",

    "title": "Episode 139 – Getting Back to Basics; Change, Grow and Share",
    "slug": "episode139",
    "date": "2020-09-14T16:06:12",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15978572/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>After spending 16 years in management at Bimbo, part of the Sara Lee Bakery group, focusing on supply chain and purchasing, as well as sales and operations planning, Miquel combined his knowledge, experience and passion to found <a href=\"https://solutionsdecisions.cat/en/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Solutions &amp; Decisions</a> in 2009.</p>\n<p>Their mission is to make operations more efficient, reducing costs and creating a clear global company vision. Through his three pillars of ‘Change’, ‘Grow’ and ‘Share,’ Miquel aims to simplify the complexity of supply chain, so that clients can see real operational and economic results.</p>\n<p>Today, we’re talking about what led Miquel to found Solutions and Decisions, his wealth of experience, how he applies what he’s learned to companies both big and small, and why he’s championing people and talent as the future of supply chain.</p>\n<p><strong>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</strong></p>\n<p>[08.22] Miquel’s career history, how he came to found Solutions and Decisions and the amazing story behind the name.</p>\n<p>[12.01] Exactly what Solutions and Decisions do for their customers.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We’re like supply chain doctors!”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.30] Miquel explains his three pillars: change, grow and share.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Supply chain is about the capacity and flexibility to adapt to what’s going on, on the outside.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[20.20] How Solutions and Decisions approach supply chain, breaking down its complexity to deliver results.</p>\n<p>[22.52] What Miquel has learned from working with both SME’s and large organizations, and why companies are more similar than they think.</p>\n<p>[27.33] Why communication can be difficult in business, but why it’s critical to get it right.</p>\n<p>[29.31] A real-life example of how Solutions and Decisions helped a key customer.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“There was not an alignment between the different departments, because they had conflicting goals – there were no common goals aligned to the business strategy.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[34.52] An ideal customer’s approach: Solutions and Decisions can work with a business of any size, in any industry, as long as they’re committed to the ‘decisions’ piece, as well as the diagnostic ‘solutions’ one.</p>\n<p>[36.53] Why Miquel became a coach.</p>\n<p>[40.32] From constant learning to talent development, the future for Miquel and Solutions and Decisions.</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Solutions and Decisions <a href=\"https://solutionsdecisions.cat/en/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. You can also connect with Miquel over on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/miquelserracanta/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>We’re back with Episode 2 of our “Lessons Learned from Crises” mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tealbook</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘<a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode-136-lessons-learned-from-crisis-bad-data/\">Bad Data</a>,’ we talked to Tealbook CEO Stephany Lapierre about the impact of poor supplier data, some of the biggest lessons learned from the COVID-19 crisis and exactly how Tealbook can help to revolutionize your data systems.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 2, Stay Ready, I‘m joined by Tealbook’s VP of Strategy Matt Palackdharry to talk about the importance of good data, the value to be found in transparency and collaboration and why, despite only being founded in 2014, IDC recently ranked Tealbook as the #4 procurement platform tool currently in use today.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[01.05] Matt’s background, and how his experiences led him to Tealbook.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The number 1 reason that these technology platforms were failing was never the software or the integrations themselves – it’s actually the data going in that compromises everything downstream.”     </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[04.03] Exactly what good data is, and why it’s so important.</p>\n<p>[07.03] The challenges of data, and the potential for success when you get the data right.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“The amount of data that’s being created in the space is increasing tenfold year after year, and we’re still trying to make sense of that data with the same amount of staff.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[09.02] Tealbook’s Autonomous Data Enrichment – what does it mean, and how does it help.</p>\n<p>[12.38] How Tealbook deliver accuracy and transparency in their supply chain data to ensure they are a trusted industry partner.</p>\n<p>[15.30] How transparency builds trust and community and facilitates successful industry collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We do not promise perfect data: what we promise is that we’ll give you all of the data at your fingertips so you can make informed decisions and that our data, through our mechanisms, will get better over time.”  </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.30] Why IDC recently ranked Tealbook as the #4 procurement platform tool currently in use today.</p>\n<p>[22.33] How COVID-19 highlighted some key industry flaws and the high-profile customers Tealbook were able to help steer through the crisis.</p>\n<p>[29.28] The key lessons Tealbook learned from the COVID-19 crisis.</p>\n<p>Head over to Tealbook’s <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "Episode 137: Women In Supply Chain™, Jenti Vandertuig",
    "slug": "episode-137-women-in-supply-chain-jenti-vandertuig",
    "date": "2020-09-07T19:43:09",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15886154/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This week’s episode of our Women In Supply Chain™ series features Jenti Vandertuig.</p>\n<p>Born in India, Jenti got her degree at Madras University in Chennai, one of the oldest and most well-respected universities in India, before moving to the USA and pursuing a career in government. After more than 25 years spent transforming public sector procurement through designing and delivering pioneering new solutions, it was time for a change. Now she’s a trailblazer showing the sports and entertainment industry how important supply chain is to their organizations.</p>\n<p>Today Jenti will be sharing her fascinating life story with us, from scared but ambitious girl growing up in India, to the woman who decided to take control of her own destiny. She’ll be talking about her successful career in government and what made her switch industries; overcoming challenges, and all about how she found her voice along the way.</p>\n<p><b>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</b></p>\n<p>[07.54] Jenti’s background growing up in India, and the early experiences that began to shape her as a woman.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“I sum up my life as a struggle for victory of owning my own life, even if it meant starting from nothing.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.41] How an arranged marriage bought Jenti to California at the age of 21, the home of her ‘riches to rags’ story.</p>\n<p>[12.57] How a volunteering opportunity, a lucky break and a good mentor launched Jenti’s career in the City of Sunnyvale.</p>\n<p>[15.57] How a strong mentor gave Jenti the courage to learn, and to succeed.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“That encouragement truly gave me the passion to excel, to take some chances and go further than what I’d anticipated for myself.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.13] After dipping her toes in the private sector, and the dot com bust, Jenti moved on to bigger and better opportunities as a contractor at the County of Santa Clara.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“When opportunities came my way, I ran with it!”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.15] Some of the challenges Jenti faced along the way, and the persistence she found to overcome them.</p>\n<p>[26.19] How Jenti found her voice.</p>\n<p>[30.28] The importance of communication, how Jenti found herself moving from government to the San Francisco 49ers and the new excitement and passion it has brought her.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“It’s like a brand-new life for me.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.34] The lessons that Jenti has learned along the way.</p>\n<p>[38.04] Jenti shares her advice for girls and women looking to follow in her footsteps.</p>\n<p>Keep up to date with the amazing Jenti by connecting with her on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jentivandertuig\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15842528/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Our new mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tealbook</a>, is called “Lessons Learned from Crisis” – it’s a timely look at how individual businesses, and our industry as a whole, need to learn, adapt and use our findings to inform our shared future.</p>\n<p>Over the next four episodes, we’ll be taking a closer look at the importance of data, managing risk, technological advancements, what COVID-19 has taught us about weathering the storm – and how Tealbook can support your business, through good times and bad.</p>\n<p>Today in Episode 1, Bad Data, I‘m joined by Tealbook CEO Stephany Lapierre to talk about the potentially devastating impact of poor supplier data, some of the biggest lessons learned from the COVID-19 crisis and exactly how Tealbook can help to revolutionize your data systems.</p>\n<p><b>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</b></p>\n<p>[01.30] Stephanie’s thoughts on many companies’ cynical approach to data management, and how it highlights the need for a simple, effective and comprehensive solution to harnessing, unifying and synchronising data.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“It’s not as hard as you think to have good data!”     </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.24] How Stephanie’s experiences, and the problems she observed, inspired her to found Tealbook.</p>\n<p>[09.45] The importance of data-first digital transformation and how Tealbook enhances visibility, identifies opportunities for supplier consolidation and encourages collaboration to simplify data and create ‘a single source of truth.’</p>\n<p>[16.08] Bad data, and why it’s so harmful to business.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“93% of supply chain and procurement executives claim to have negative impact on their business on a regular basis because of misinformation and poor data quality.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.49] How Tealbook allows companies to take charge of their data, keeping it up-to-date, accessible and accurate, eliminating bad data.</p>\n<p>[24.08] Tealbook’s amazing community spirit: how they helped over 170 business in the first 3 weeks of the COVID-19 crisis to access key data that enabled them to pivot quickly and effectively, and Tealbook’s mission to help minority businesses in response to the Black Lives Matter movement.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We offered the market the ability to provide a supplier list for any organisation, in the private and public sector, that had a disrupted supply chain.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.10] From operating a strong data strategy to employing supplier data platforms, what Tealbook has learned from the COVID-19 crisis and what the industry can learn for the future.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Don’t hope technology will solve your data problem!”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>Head over to Tealbook’s <a href=\"https://tealbook.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "related_episodes": [],

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15784607/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Tax – for many of us, it can be a word that strikes fear into the heart of our businesses! Global tax is a complex area of expertise, that often isn’t linked as closely as it should be to operations and decision-making.</p>\n<p>Enter <a href=\"https://globaltaxfocus.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Global Tax Focus</a>. Their goal is to help you see the global landscape of an enterprise by focusing on the intersection of operations and tax. They partner with an international team of deep technical business and tax specialists, bringing the latest in global thought leadership, to help you to identify where business and tax efficiencies can be achieved, by focusing on cross-border transactions, business structure, and reducing both tax and operating costs.</p>\n<p>Today I’m joined by Jim Dawson of Global Tax Focus to talk more about the implications of tax on many different areas of business, why being pro-active with tax is so beneficial, and why tax and supply chain professionals need to collaborate to ensure their voices are heard.</p>\n<p><b>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</b></p>\n<p>[9.22] Jim’s background in international tax, and the tax implications on supply chain.</p>\n<p>[11.20] How Jim helps owner-managed or family-owned middle market companies to understand and manage their tax implications, now and in the future.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“If you start making decisions to move assets, people and risk around the world, those aren’t decisions to be entered into lightly.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[16.02] How recent tax changes disrupted the market, and the impact of that on nearshore and offshore investment, income and processes.</p>\n<p>[24.15] Jim’s top 5 pieces of advice for the supply chain community on exactly how taxes should feature within their strategies.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“For most companies, taxes represent 20% of the cost reported on an income statement – so it’s very important that, in order to reduce that amount, supply chain professionals work collaboratively with the accounting/tax department.”    </em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[29.18] The benefits of free trade zones.</p>\n<p>[31.58] A real-life example of how Jim is helping a client navigate current challenges and market changes.</p>\n<p>[35.55] Jim’s thoughts on the idea that tax advantage is a business solution rather than a supply chain solution.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Tax should never way the dog’s tail – it should be what’s best for the company from an operation perspective, and then overlay tax on top of it.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[38.17] An overview of transfer pricing.</p>\n<p>[43.09] The future for Global Tax Focus</p>\n<p>Head over to Global Tax Focus’ <a href=\"https://globaltaxfocus.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too, or connect with Jim Dawson on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/public-profile/in/james-dawson-06070513?challengeId=AQGlR_nVYwwKzwAAAXQrV0dYdD_p5NZf7-TgzW1VS2-YWlxBpGHUoZo_UfceXFgGsDRrqUY8B1HsxxhY4WRBpS81GEFqAZ0FUA&amp;submissionId=269c9f6e-54da-2e16-2802-0bf6bd52e30c\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">LinkedIn</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "uuid": "659ee3dc-ff0d-4e1c-8289-59f928999ba9",
    "episode_number": 134,
    "post_id": 11673,
    "title": "Episode 134: You Won’t Believe What We’ve Seen: Beauty Secrets",
    "slug": "episode-134-you-wont-believe-what-weve-seen-beauty-secrets",
    "date": "2020-08-27T19:51:35",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15770330/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>I’m so sad to say that this is the final episode in our ‘You Won’t Believe What We’ve Seen’ mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">SQA services</a>. But over the course of these four episodes we’ve had a blast! We’ve chatted to some inspirational people, learned a lot and heard some amazing stories – we really can’t believe what they’ve seen! I hope you’ve enjoyed the series just as much as I have and don’t forget, you can still catch up on any episodes you might’ve missed <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘<a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode-132-you-wont-believe-what-weve-seen-high-stakes/\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">High Stakes</a>’, we were joined by father and son team Jim and Mike McKay to tackle the ever-changing landscape of technology. We talked about the latest technological advances in the industry and really did a deep dive into the importance of quality, right from the outset, and how it’s achieved through honesty, communication, collaboration and partnership.</p>\n<p>And today, last but <em>definitely</em> not least, we’re headed to the multi-billion-dollar world of beauty. Mike McKay is joining us one last time alongside the incredible Ashley Goldberg, Executive Director of Quality and Operational Excellence at Merz North America. We’re taking a closer look at the changing face of the beauty industry, the rise of social media and the impact of influencers, and why quality is more important than ever.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[01.03] Introducing Mike McKay.<br />\n[02.19] Introducing Ashley Goldberg.<br />\n[03.46] SQA’s key beauty industry partnerships, from Estee Lauder to Colgate-Palmolive.<br />\n[04.18] An introduction to Merz.<br />\n[05.32] How SQA’s early partnership with Colgate-Palmolive helped the business take off.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I went from zero sales to several hundred thousand, by employing two or three hundred people in three different cities and shipping over 38,000 tubes of toothpaste!” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[11.40] The importance of relationship-building in every stage – from raw materials to manufacturing to supply chain – to ensure quality, particularly in the start-up space.<br />\n[15.26] The relationship between Merz and SQA, and the importance of teamwork.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“They’re going to come in as an honest partner… to support it, augment it, and ultimately make sure you have the ability to build a robust supply chain.” (AG)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.36] Why it’s essential to ensure quality at source.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Ensuring that your entire supply chain and all of your partners have the same values and integrity you have for your product is so important, because ultimately your customer is what matters.” (AG)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.14] Why cost-cutting strategies aren’t always the best approach, particularly for quality.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Is the risk really worth it? What’s the cost of customer dissatisfaction?” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[26.25] How consumer behavior is driving supply chain optimization.<br />\n[29.30] How social media, communication speed and influencer impact can have a very positive, or negative, effect on your brand – making quality even more important.<br />\n[31.29] SQA’s ‘Quality Is’ campaign and how it helps customers to ensure quality is an accessible and better understood topic.<br />\n[35.08] Why designing quality into the supply chain from the beginning is going to be vital to the future of the beauty industry.</p>\n<p>You can connect with Mike on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mike-mckay-11a022a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or head over to SQA’s <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more, meet the team and discover how they could help you too.<br />\nYou can also connect with Ashley on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/ashleygoldberg/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or find out all about the different facets to <a href=\"https://www.merzusa.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Merz</a> on their website.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a></p>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 7203, 5388],

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15739949/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Development of the Omnae Platform began fairly recently, in 2016, with a small team and a big vision. Harnessing over 30 years of deep industry experience, Omnae’s mission was to build a network and service that was bigger than just manufacturing; to create a technology that was both industry and country agnostic, with the goal of connecting every facet of global production.</p>\n<p>Omnae’s founders saw the potential – and necessity – for a global supply web, and knew they had the know-how to build it. And it’s safe to say Omnae has gone from strength to strength, proving that their mission, and unique approach, is spot on.</p>\n<p>Today I’m joined by CEO Dan Lionello to talk more about the global supply web, the need for improved transparency, resilience and communication in supply chain and how Omnae’s platform has the potential to transform supply chain for everyone.</p>\n<p><b>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</b></p>\n<p>[00.25] How and why Omnae was founded, and the variety of needs it meets.</p>\n<p>[05.21] A closer look at what Omnae does.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“Our vision is very clear: to create trust and transparency in the global supply web.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[08.26] How Omnae facilitates vital collaboration, as well as supplier analysis and relationship management.</p>\n<p>[12.28] The supply web, and how Omnae’s system allows businesses to improve the resilience, efficiency and scale of their supply chains.</p>\n<p>[15.08] An overview of supply chain resilience and how Omnae can help.</p>\n<p>[19.34] Omnae’s unique approach to transparency in supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We’ve created a dependency tree, a way of linking dependent orders as they go through the supply chain.”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[25.19] A recent case study of how Omnae revolutionized one company’s supply chain processes.</p>\n<p>[28.35] Omnae’s ideal client.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“94% of global manufacturers are still using email and Excel spreadsheets as their two major technologies to run production…. I want that 94%!”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[30.47] Omnae’s typical on-boarding process.</p>\n<p>[32.11] What the future holds for Omnae.</p>\n<p><strong>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</strong></p>\n<p>Head over to Omnae’s <a href=\"https://omnae.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too. Or, download their amazing <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210506215752/https://resources.omnae.com/en-us/strategies-for-supply-chain-resilience-download-free-ebook-omnae\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">free e-book</a> <strong>‘A Definitive Guide to Future Proof Supply Chains, Optimize Operations, Grow Relationships and Scale Businesses in the next normal.’</strong></p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "date": "2020-08-20T20:23:58",

    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15662165/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>We’re back with Episode 3 of our ‘You Won’t Believe What We’ve Seen’ mini-series, in partnership with <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">SQA services</a>, and I’m sure you’re enjoying it just as much as I am.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘<a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/episode-130-you-wont-believe-what-weve-seen-saving-lives/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Saving Lives</a>’, we were joined by SQA founder and President Mike McKay, as well as the President &amp; CEO of Civica Rx Martin VanTrieste, to talk about supply chain and the importance of quality in the life sciences industry. We explored the dark world of counterfeit drugs and shadow factories, the impact of COVID-19, drug shortages and ultimately the importance of supply chain in saving lives. Don’t forget to check it out if you missed it!</p>\n<p>Today, we’re taking on the complex world of technology and Mike McKay is joined by his Father, Chairman of SQA, Jim McKay.</p>\n<p>They’re going to be exploring some of the latest technological advances in the industry and explaining how quality is so closely linked to honesty, communication, collaboration and partnership. And how, if you don’t have a focus on quality from the beginning, the impact on today’s technology-driven and dependent society is potentially devastating.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[01.03] Introducing Mike McKay.<br />\n[02.08] Introducing Jim McKay.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The more things change, the more they remain the same – and that applies to what we’re doing at SQA.” (JMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[03.46] SQA’s key partnerships in the technology industry, from Apple to Google.<br />\n[04.41] Finding the right experts and building customized teams to meet customer challenges.<br />\n[05.56] How SQA bring their expertise to help their customers save time and money on vital audits and inspections.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our product is our people.” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[10.20] The origins of Intertek, which lead Jim to partner with Mike and found SQA.<br />\n[13.50] Mike’s background, his perspective on working with his Dad and pivoting the Intertek approach to find a new path for SQA.<br />\n[16.49] The challenge of the ‘hard sell’ and encouraging customer investment in up-front strategies for quality.<br />\n[20.27] Why SQA are constantly striving for quality, and how they work in partnership with their customers to continue to deliver it.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a relentless task!” (JMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[24.54] How a focus on quality from the outset, alongside choosing the right partners, can reduce future defects and recalls.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We got out to one service supplier where the address didn’t even exist!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[27.46] The rise of cyber audits and the importance of quality in security and data.<br />\n[30.56] The importance of partnerships in an ever changing technological world.</p>\n<p>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</p>\n<p>You can connect with <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mike-mckay-11a022a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Mike</a> and <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/james-mckay-30297832/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Jim</a> on LinkedIn, or head over to SQA’s <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more, meet the team and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

    "title": "Episode 131: Forget Surprises! In Transit Visibility Is Here",
    "slug": "episode-131-forget-surprises-in-transit-visibility-is-here",
    "date": "2020-08-17T20:37:17",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
