    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15604751/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Founder and CEO of <a href=\"https://tive.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tive</a>, Krenar Komoni, has what can only be described as an impressive career, with more than 10 years spent in the wireless industry gaining expertise in chip design and business development. He worked with BitWave Semiconductor, where he developed the world’s first 2G+3G+LTE radio in a single chip, Eta Devices – an MIT-based start-up developing the world’s most efficient cellular base stations – and consulted for Fortune 500 companies launching new wireless products.</p>\n<p>But it was a simple conversation with his father in law, who was complaining of the challenges of supply chain, that sparked Krenar’s entrepreneurial spirit, helped him identify a vital niche, and go on to establish <a href=\"https://tive.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Tive</a>. Designed to help companies take the surprises out of their supply chains through true end-to-end visibility, their innovative solutions are taking the market by storm.</p>\n<p>Today, we’re talking about the importance of understanding how the modern supply chain works and providing rounded solutions, accuracy and data, sustainability and how Tive are changing the face of supply chain visibility.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[06.37] How Tive was founded, and the story behind the name.<br />\n[09.30] What Tive and its product trackers do for manufacturers and logistics suppliers.<br />\n[11.15] An overview of the Tive product offering, including multi-use and single-use trackers.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We are the first in the industry to release the first single-use tracker that doesn’t contain lithium batteries.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.53] The benefit of using trackers at pallet level.<br />\n[15.26] How Tive helps to bring visibility to supply chain.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Visibility has become a must-have, and one way to achieve it is by getting data from the assets that are moving the goods.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.38] The interplay between hardware, software and service in supporting visibility.<br />\n[22.11] Tive’s top 3 trackers, what they do and why they’re so special.<br />\n[26.25] The future of 5G.<br />\n[27.50] From security to perishable goods, some real-life examples of how Tive has supported customers and saved them time and money.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“They were able to use the data, reports and analytics that we provided to reduce the number of shipment rejections by 90%.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.15] Tive’s ideal customer.<br />\n[32.27] Krenar’s best advice for other supply chain start-ups and entrepreneurs.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Every start-up has ups and downs, but the key is to really believe in your goal.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[35.08] What the future holds for Tive.</p>\n<p>Head over to Tive’s <a href=\"https://tive.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast\">HERE.</a></p>\n",

    "date": "2020-08-13T20:39:12",
    "video_id": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15572603/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span>http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_SQA_3_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3&#8243;&#8221; theme=&#8221;custom&#8221; custom_color=&#8221;0083b6&#8243; libsyn_item_id=&#8221;15572603&#8243;&gt;</iframe></p>\n<p>I hope you’re enjoying our fascinating ‘You Won’t Believe What We’ve Seen’ mini-series, in partnership with SQA services.</p>\n<p>In last week’s episode ‘Mission Control’ (insert link), we talked to SQA founder and President Mike McKay, and industry professional and advisor to SQA Jeff Luckey, and delved into the incredible world of aircraft and aerospace.</p>\n<p>And we have an equally amazing podcast for you today, with episode 2 ‘Saving Lives,’ as we dive into the life sciences. Mike McKay joins us once again, alongside President &amp; CEO of Civica Rx Martin Van Trieste, one of Modern Healthcare’s ‘100 Most Influential People in Healthcare’ and the #2 leader on The Medicine Maker’s ‘Power List of Industry Influencers.’</p>\n<p>They’re going to be exploring the dark world of counterfeit drugs and shadow factories, sharing their passions and experiences after many years at the top of their industry, and reinforcing that all-important topic of Quality. You don’t want to miss it!</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[00.58] Introducing Mike McKay.<br />\n[02.18] Introducing Martin Van Trieste.<br />\n[04.28] SQA’s key partnerships in the life sciences industry, from Pfizer to Johnson and Johnson.<br />\n[05.01] Martin’s long-standing relationship with SQA, and why he came to rely on their services.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Over 20 years, I’ve become enamored with their business model. But more importantly, I grew to respect Mike and his team so much – I trust them – and that’s something that takes a long time to build.” (MVT)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.15] The importance of working as an extension of a customer’s team, being flexible, efficient and meeting customized needs.<br />\n[10.21] How saving time and money through using a team of specialists like SQA, means customers are freed up to work on the important things – saving lives.<br />\n[12.02] Why working with SQA is not simple out-sourcing: it’s all about information sharing, communication, honesty and collaboration.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“It’s a very interactive process.” (MVT)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[14.27] Shadow factories, their impact on the industry, and on saving lives.<br />\n[16.52] Show factories, and Mike’s eye-opening industry experiences.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our auditor walked over to a drum, lifted up the top and saw the laminate still inside – no product had been made there!” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[19.12] Supply and demand during COVID-19.<br />\n[23.15] SQA’s passion and pride to be doing their part in developing vaccines and saving lives.<br />\n[26.06] Why there are drug shortages, ‘Just in Time’ vs ‘Just in Case’ and how/why Martin’s company Civica Rx are moving towards shorter, more robust supply chains.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Not all industries are the same: you can’t apply every solution to the same problem in a different industry.” (MVT)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.45] Why quality is so important, both on a business and a personal level.<br />\n[33.41] How SQA’s ‘Quality Is’ campaign helps to keep quality at the top of everybody’s agenda, both internally and with customers too.<br />\n[35.53] Why without quality, you don’t have safety – and you can’t save lives.</p>\n<p>You can connect with Mike on <a href=\"//www.linkedin.com/in/mike-mckay-11a022a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">LinkedIn</a>, or head over to SQA’s <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> now to find out more, meet the team and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>You can also connect with Martin on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mvantrieste/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a> or find out more about <a href=\"https://civicarx.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Civica Rx</a>‘s pioneering work on their website.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a>.</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "7cc4ddd3-db09-41e9-9cf5-e842bb492c02",
    "episode_number": 129,
    "post_id": 11686,
    "title": "Episode 129: Stabilize Your Supply Chain",
    "slug": "episode-129-stabilize-your-supply-chain",
    "date": "2020-08-10T20:44:09",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15511079/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Back in 2001, Optessa Founder Srinivas (Vasu) Netrakanti identified an important but poorly served niche: to provide high quality planning and scheduling solutions that truly addressed industry needs. And as a management graduate and highly successful serial entrepreneur, he had the knowledge, experience and courage to deliver it.</p>\n<p>Vasu partnered with Founder and CEO Ashok Erramilli, who brought his own incredible skills – including an Electrical Engineering Ph.D. from Yale, years of experience as a consultant to engineering and networking corporations, and from his role as Research Manager at Bellcore (now Telcordia) – to the mix.</p>\n<p>The ambitious and highly skilled duo built <a href=\"https://www.optessa.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Optessa</a> with the vision of helping complex manufacturers optimize their production plans and schedules, utilizing intelligent solutions. Their Advanced Planning and Scheduling (APS) software creates complete, optimal, even quality solutions, and their software can model any manufacturing requirement, with speedy deployment.</p>\n<p>In today’s episode Ashok discusses current industry challenges in light of COVID-19, the importance of evaluating supply chains by criteria other than simply cost, achieving balance and stability in supply chain and the power of data-driven analytics.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[06.30] The story behind Optessa, and how they continue to deliver and evolve.<br />\n[10.50] How Optessa uses data optimization to allow customers to match supply with demand and stay efficient.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“We help manufacturers answer these three basic questions: what do I make, where do I make it and when do I make it?”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[13.15] How COVID-19 has hung a question mark over the industry, the challenge of trying to be prepared for everything, and how the crisis has highlighted a need for more robust supply chains.<br />\n[16.20] From risk to stability, flexibility to responsiveness, the need to evaluate supply chains by criteria other than simply cost.<br />\n[19.05] How the current crisis highlighted supply chain vulnerabilities companies didn’t even know they had, and the importance of readily available good data, to allow companies to use predictive analytics to be proactive rather than reactive.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“You can have the most efficient supply chain, but when you have a disruption like this one, that could be the end of your business.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[21.01] The art of trade-offs – how you can use optimization to reconcile contradictory elements and achieve the best balance for your business.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Given your comfort level, your priorities – it will tell you the best trade-off.”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.57] The story behind the name Optessa.<br />\n[25.11] What whole new software suite, by interpreting, anticipating and so minimizing change.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“In the real world, as soon as you make a plan – things change!”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[33.20]     "episode_number": 128,

    "title": "Ep 128: You won’t believe what we have Seen: Mission Control",
    "slug": "ep-128-you-wont-believe-what-we-have-seen-mission-control",
    "date": "2020-08-06T20:46:38",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15525269/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/yes/direction/backward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>I’m incredibly excited to bring you a brand new 4-part series, in partnership with <a href=\"https://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">SQA Services</a>. SQA Services has over 25 years’ experience and is now widely recognized as a flexible global resource and a proven solution provider for today’s complex supply environments. I’ve gotten to know them over the past few months and their industry knowledge, passion – and amazing stories – demanded their own platform.</p>\n<p>Inspired by their experiences and anecdotes, I’m proud to introduce the aptly named ‘You Won’t Believe What We’ve Seen’ mini-series. Over the next 4 episodes, we’ll be bringing you stories that showcase the importance of quality in supply chain and the fascinating places it’s taken SQA.</p>\n<p>So, grab a coffee and find a quiet spot to enjoy Episode 1, ‘Mission Control.’ Featuring SQA founder and President Mike McKay, and industry professional and advisor to SQA Jeff Luckey, this episode takes us into the incredible world of aircraft and aerospace.</p>\n<p>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</p>\n<p>[01.26] Introducing Mike McKay.<br />\n[02.46] Introducing Jeff Luckey.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I know a thing or two, because I’ve seen a thing or two!” (JL)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[04.28] SQA’s key industry partnerships, from Boeing to NASA.<br />\n[08.29] Jeff’s relationship with SQA, their introduction to Boeing and the importance of quality.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Unless quality is actually built in at the beginning… you’re likely to have quality issues at the end of the chain.” (JL)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[12.14] The responsibility, pride and pressure that goes hand in hand with being a part of supply chain for space missions.<br />\n[15.34] The sheer scale of Aeronautic production, which really puts the importance of quality into perspective.<br />\n[18.53] How Mike’s son, who is a pilot, brings a personal angle to quality and safety.<br />\n[21.04] How getting to know customers, as well as inspiring and trusting your staff, combines to build a great team.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’m like the owner of a sports team: you hire your head coach and then let them go to work!” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[23.44] Jeff’s Boeing projection figures and the future of aircraft.<br />\n[28.57] How SQA will adapt and support the automation of the future.</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The only constant is change.” (MMK)</p></blockquote>\n<p>[31.28] SQA’s ‘Quality Is’ campaign.<br />\n[35.52] Our expectation for excellence, and how that demands quality.</p>\n<p>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</p>\n<p>You can connect with Mike on <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/mike-mckay-11a022a/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">LinkedIn</a>, or head over to SQA’s <a href=\"http://www.sqaservices.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a> to find out more, meet the team and discover how they could help you too.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a></p>\n",

    "uuid": "89992034-574d-4daa-8efc-3c23ff0949c8",

    "title": "Episode 127 – Women In Supply Chain™, Martha Lumatete",
    "slug": "episode-127-women-in-supply-chain-martha-lumatete",
    "date": "2020-08-03T20:51:54",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15416672/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>This week’s episode of Women In Supply Chain™ Series features Martha Lumatete.  Inspired by both her grandmother, who began her own construction supply business, and her father, an accomplished lawyer in Kenya, Martha Lumatete always had her sights set on success. In today’s episode, she discusses her incredible journey so far, from those initial aspirations to the woman she is today.</p>\n<p>After graduating law school, she took a role at Pepsi working in data and analysis and became fascinated with the supply chain process – how a product works its way through manufacture and distribution, and the consumer behavior behind it. Driven by her natural curiosity, bravery and thirst for knowledge, Martha worked in a number of different industries and areas, gathering new skills and experiences along the way.</p>\n<p>Currently working for Southwest Airlines in software acquisition, Martha brings her own unique blend of integrity, passion and positivity to the table, reminding us that good business is not just about making good deals, it’s all about nurturing great relationships.</p>\n<h3>IN THIS EPISODE WE DISCUSS:</h3>\n<p>[06.20] Martha’s background and her journey to success<br />\n[14.28] Her current role and responsibilities for Southwest Airlines</p>\n<blockquote><p>“They lead with love, but they have a warrior spirit”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[18.58] The importance of building strong partnerships</p>\n<blockquote><p>“If there’s no partnership, you’re going to have a company that is struggling”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[22.25] Martha’s inspiration and the quote she lives by. <em><strong>“Be generous and expert; trustworthy and clear; open-minded and adaptable; persistent and present.”</strong></em><br />\n[25.25] Personal courage and risk-taking, and how that links to the importance of agility in business: continuing to learn, grow, support others and grasp opportunity</p>\n<blockquote><p>“The one thing that’s constant is change”</p></blockquote>\n<h3>RESOURCES AND LINKS MENTIONED:</h3>\n<p>Head over to LinkedIn to <a href=\"https://l.facebook.com/l.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fin%2Fmartha-lumatete-0bb2871%3Ffbclid%3DIwAR2I9wMUbJXLdyt9jzR07HXFeXecPSuIxAfte4-P9GEtPtX1Ux4GUnyKNKU&amp;h=AT3Ff3o8jNiIaEZGq7D7ifZIvg45M8lfL9zyw8frvPso38YZhyGPFpjfrRVAUiDjSNIuNq_LGVEloV26NWD6JF-ArcN7QdWKDTwSuDZcxkJLpmebFNn-l5G3hSoPhDJYgRA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">connect with Martha</a> and continue to follow her inspirational journey.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a></p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe style=\"display:block;\"  src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15343073/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" scrolling=\"no\" class=\"podcast-class\" frameborder=\"0\" placement=\"top\" primary_content_url=\"http://chtbl.com/track/744833/traffic.libsyn.com/2babestalksupplychain/Lets_Talk_Supply_Chain_with_Wes_v2_MIXED_AND_MASTERED.mp3\" theme=\"custom\" custom_color=\"0083b6\" libsyn_item_id=\"15343073\"></iframe><br />Like his Father and Grandfather before him, Founder and President of Logistics Titans Wes Streubing has supply chain in his blood. And he’s on a mission to bring that passion, history and industry knowledge together to bring a new and innovative approach to supply chain.</p>\n<p>As the largest specialized and asset-based carrier in the US, Logistics Titans aim is to empower their clients with new possibilities through their commitment to seeking out the latest technologies, providing data-driven insights and bringing a customized, holistic approach to every client.</p>\n<p>In this episode, Wes discusses the challenges we’re currently facing in supply chain and how the industry needs to continue to be creative and agile in its approach. And innovative industry leaders who continue to learn and grow are a vital part of this, especially in unprecedented times as we continue to face the impact of Covid 19.</p>\n<p>But, as Wes looks to the future, he’s sure that Covid 19 is &#8216;a short-term discomfort, not a long-term problem&#8217; and that the future for supply chain is bright.</p>\n<h3>In this episode we discuss:</h3>\n<p>[00.38] The history behind the Logistics Titans brand<br />\n[02.08] Industry complexity and challenges, from accurate forecasting to predictive analysis<br />\n[03.27] The importance of data</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>“We’ve gone from just being people who provide transportation services and warehousing services to being someone who provides meaningful data back to business”</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>[06.33] Working with partners and Wes’s core philosophy in life and business</p>\n<blockquote><p>“I’ll be in your life as long as I can make it better”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[07.42] Growth and self-awareness in leadership<br />\n[10.01] Content consumption, and how Covid 19 has brought supply chain content all the way to the board room<br />\n[12.45] How their holistic approach makes Logistics Titans different</p>\n<blockquote><p>“Our mission is to facilitate our client’s agenda”</p></blockquote>\n<p>[15.56] The impact of Covid 19 and the importance of creative strategy and problem solving within supply chain<br />\n[21.32] A real life example of how Logistics Titans revolutionized their customers’ existing process<br />\n[24.38] The process of working with Logistics Titans<br />\n[27.23] How the future of logistics will marry people and technology<br />\n[30.32] The future for Logistics Titans</p>\n<h3>Resources and links mentioned:</h3>\n<p>To find out more about Logistics Titans, or to book a free call to see how they could help you, visit their <a href=\"https://logisticstitans.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">website</a>.</p>\n<p>Check out our other podcasts <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">HERE</a></p>\n",

    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15259628/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Ram is the founder of SKUteam, a company that provides globalized supply chain with localized supervision. They help companies working in the apparel, furnishing and fashion accessories industries take control of their supply chain and cut out unnecessary middlemen.</p>\n<p>Ram explains that when it comes to production, 70% of processes happen in a factory. But brands have no idea what happens in the factories: they can’t tell if workers are paid fair wages, if working conditions are at the right standard or whether the product is manufactured according to the specific requirements. SKUteam help brands track every section of the supply chain works by offering a whole range of services including accounting and finance, inspections, audits and inventory planning.</p>\n<p>With trends such as globalization and events such as Covid-19, brands want to move away from China and manufacture products elsewhere – but they aren’t sure where to go next. SKUteam helps brands find the appropriate factories and sample inventory. They then manage the audits, inspections and factory management. As Ram says, the future of supply chain is about removing human involvement. With SKUteam’s product, brands can be at the forefront of their industry simply by reducing costs and sourcing effectively.</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[6.48] What influenced Ram to create SKUteam</li>\n<li>[11.51] What SKUteam does</li>\n<li>[17.48] How SKUteam helps customers throughout Covid</li>\n<li>[31.29] What their ideal client looks like</li>\n<li>[37.57] The future for SKUteam</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.skuteam.com/#Hero\" data-et-has-event-already=\"true\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">SKUteam</a></li>\n<li>Promo: refer Lets talk supply chain when you reach out to SKUTEAM!! First two Purchase orders, free!</li>\n</ul>\n",

    "title": "EP 124 – Powering the Resilient Supply Chain",
    "slug": "ep-124-powering-the-resilient-supply-chain",
    "date": "2020-07-13T20:57:46",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15170027/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Ranna is a supply chain professional who works for <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/season2-episode6/\">Resilinc</a>, a supply chain risk management company that offers data analytics and insights on supplier performance. With their patented technology, Resilinc can produce simulations of potential catastrophes and help customers and suppliers mitigate risk.</p>\n<p>What is supply chain mapping? Ranna explains that supply chain mapping is about knowing who your tier 1, tier 2 and tier 3 suppliers are. Mapping is about knowing the full flow of your supply chain and therefore being able to successfully identify any points of failure. Large scale events such as Covid and have proved the importance of knowing how your entire supply chain works and being proactive rather than reactive.</p>\n<p>Ranna has worked in supply chain for 20 years, and says the industry has come very far. Thanks to advances in technology, companies can use data to prepare and handle risk efficiently. With more natural disasters happening every year, this is more relevant than ever. She also explains that the future of supply chain will involve more transparency and an even greater ability to connect directly customers with suppliers. Ranna loves her job as supply chain manager and she highly recommends it to anyone who wants a career that involves building strategic relationships, understanding how cultures work and international travel.</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.30] Who is Resilinc?</li>\n<li>[2.55] What is supply chain mapping?</li>\n<li>[11.28] What Ranna loves about supply chain</li>\n<li>[16.55] How supply chain has changed in the past 20 years</li>\n<li>[27.14] Advice to young women interested in supply chain</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.resilinc.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Resilinc</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/15084086/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Melody is a supply chain professional who works for Alloy, a platform that offers in-depth data analytics for consumer good companies. For our Women In Supply Chain™ spotlight for July, sponsored by <a href=\"https://alloy.ai\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Alloy</a>,  Melody tells us what her journey in supply chain has been like, what keeps her motivated and her plans for the future.</p>\n<p>Supply chain is constantly changing and advancing – yet many companies are sticking to manual processes. Although they recognise and understand the need for analytics, companies still use spreadsheets and adopting technology at a very slow pace. As Melody says, it’s almost like companies don’t believe the right tools are out there and that manual is more efficient. As someone who works in commercial software, Melody knows there is still a lot of work to do.</p>\n<p>What does success mean to Melody? To her, it means being in control of her destiny and being in a position to help others. She is driven by being surrounded by intellectuals who are eager to solve problems by tinkering and continuously testing. To others who are looking to get into a career in supply chain, Melody says: figure out what gets you motivated in the long haul and make sure to try as many different parts of supply chain as possible: after all, you won’t know what you like unless you try it!</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[8.14] How Melody fell into supply chain</li>\n<li>[14.48] What success means to her</li>\n<li>[15.43] The conversations she’s having in supply chain tech</li>\n<li>[25.20] Advice to people looking at supply chain as a career</li>\n<li>[34.04] A moment when Melody had to take a leap of faith</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://alloy.ai\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">Alloy</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00W3SYQFC/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&amp;btkr=1\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Dynamic Supply Chain Book</a></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Stay Connected with the Podcast:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Find us at <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/\">Let’s Talk Supply Chain</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/women-in-supply-chain/wisc-podcast/\">Women In Supply Chain™ Series</a></li>\n</ul>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "ba78867f-8a42-4eff-92ea-abe36ccef500",
    "episode_number": 122,
    "post_id": 11698,
    "title": "EP 122 – The first mile is everything",
    "slug": "ep-122-the-first-mile-is-everything",
    "date": "2020-06-29T21:09:54",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14994914/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Robert and Lee are the founders of Mercado, a platform that aims to bring together every section of the supply chain from sourcing, to legal, to sales and much more. Supply chain still needs to be properly disrupted, and Mercado believes a marketplace is the key forward.</p>\n<p>Why is supply chain not disrupted yet? Rob explains that the complexity of supply chain is daunting and the combination of various processes makes it difficult to innovate as a whole. Many companies that claim to resolve an issue using tech only solve one specific piece of the puzzle. With Mercado, Rob and Lee want to fix the problem by transferring the entire “puzzle” online.</p>\n<p>Rob believes that the best place to fix an issue is at the beginning: the purchase order. The first mile is what needs digitizing first – and it’s often the most inefficient part of the process. Imagine if every time you ordered a burger at McDonald’s the workers had to go back and forth between you and the kitchen to get your order right? This is what is currently happening in the supply chain world. In 5 to 10 years, Rob hopes we’ll look back on this period like we currently look back on taxis (thanks Uber).</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[19.25] Where they got the idea of Mercado</li>\n<li>[26.05] The journey to launch</li>\n<li>[37.23] Why supply chain is not yet disrupted</li>\n<li>[43.20] Why digitizing the first mile changes everything</li>\n<li>[51.50] The future for Mercado</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://mercadolabs.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Mercado</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/sea-2-ep-58-shining-light-into-the-dark-corners-of-supply-chain/\">EP 58</a> – Shining light in the dark corners of supply chain</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Stay Connected with the Podcast:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Find us at <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210121195712/https://letstalksupplychain.com/\">Let’s Talk Supply Chain</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "8b901651-6d14-4b55-97c9-53ff18e1b08b",
    "episode_number": 120,
    "post_id": 11700,
    "title": "EP 120- Eliminating risk across your supply chain",
    "slug": "ep-120-eliminating-risk-across-your-supply-chain",
    "date": "2020-06-15T21:14:14",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14813669/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Jason is the CEO of MacGregor Partners, a supply chain solutions provider that uses IT and software to help companies work faster, smarter and more efficiently. What does their process look like? They ask a lot of questions, build a bespoke solution and then train every stakeholder that’s part of the operation. They live and breathe digital and are revolutionizing the relationship between drivers, paper and staff.</p>\n<p>According to Jason, the top three challenges in supply chain are data, systems and analytics. As a supply chain solutions company, MacGregor Partners knows how hard it actually is to implement data correctly, and how to build systems that don’t end up siloed. For this reason, they focus on Warehouse Management System (WMS) combined with analytics and visibility. MacGregor Partners’ typical clients are companies that are interested in technology and are looking for ways to implement software to optimize their distribution center.</p>\n<p>At MacGregor Partners, Jason and his team are “dethinkers”: they don’t overthink data and focus on the journey. Their design process is very hands-on, with the team only moving onto the next functional area once the previous one has been completed and confirmed by the customer – this allows them to be much more agile and adaptable to unexpected shocks, such as Covid-19. In the future, MacGregor Partners will be focused on delivering better products, more experiments and an even more cost-efficient methodology.</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.35] MacGregor Partners, where it all began</li>\n<li>[12.15] The nitty-gritty of what they do</li>\n<li>[17.55] Top 3 challenges in supply chain</li>\n<li>[23.15] How does the customer benefit?</li>\n<li>[33.25] The future of the company</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://macgregorpartners.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\" data-schema-attribute=\"\">MacGregor Partners</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

    "uuid": "cde68ec9-4f69-4a80-aeda-29ddff1d9d9b",

    "title": "EP 119 – Super Trend #4, Start up Mentality",
    "slug": "ep-119-super-trend-4-start-up-mentality",
    "date": "2020-06-08T15:01:40",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14728223/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Today Sarah chats with Scott and Greg from Supply Chain Now about the last in their super trend series: Start up Mentality. The Covid crisis has brought a pivotal moment on Earth for everyone, and therefore an opportunity to accelerate important trends.</p>\n<p>As Greg says, necessity is the mother of innovation; with the crisis, supply chain is on everyone’s mind and companies are now serious about changing. As Scott declares, now is the time to seize the moment. Organizations are now more willing to challenge norms and be disruptive. As Scott and Greg explain, companies need to embrace the startup spirit: taking action, being disruptive (instead of disrupted) and giving authority to the people on the front line. The old way of working is slowly dying out, and those that resist change will die out with it.</p>\n<p>Greg believes that what’s most important is being humble enough to learn something new every day and being patient. Scott says that it’s important to remember that passion is not enough, that what entrepreneurs really need is obsession. In order to make a company work, you need to be willing to risk it all. Finally, Sarah reiterates that in order for effective collaboration to take place, large companies need to bring down barriers and make it easy for startups to work with them. And of course, at the end of the day, the most important is understanding what it is that a customer wants from you.</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[4.01] How to stay innovative</li>\n<li>[13.10] Embracing the startup spirit</li>\n<li>[21.40] How to really rebrand</li>\n<li>[38.37] The importance of failing</li>\n<li>[54.52] Main takeaways</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://supplychainnowradio.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Supply Chain Now</a></li>\n<li>Upcoming Twitter Chat Follow #SCSuperTrends from 2pm to 3pm EST <a href=\"https://twitter.com/LetsTalkSChain\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">@LetsTalkSChain</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://supplychainnowradio.com/episode-307/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Super Trend #1</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/ep-111-end-to-end-supply-chain-dead-or-alive/\">Super Trend #2</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://supplychainnowradio.com/episode-355\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Super Trend #3</a></li>\n</ul>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5632, 5387, 5388, 6000, 5429],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"267\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-300x267.png 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1-600x534.png 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Diseno-sin-titulo-6-1.png 741w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

    "slug": "ep-118-women-in-supply-chain-diane-sullivan",
    "date": "2020-06-01T15:08:43",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14635667/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Diane has worked in supply chain for 25 years. Her career has taken her from Ireland, to Australia, China and finally California. She started her work in travel management and eventually fell in love with designing business systems, logistics and leveraging technology to improve supply chain.</p>\n<p>Thanks to her upbringing, Diane isn’t someone who shies away from making her voice heard and being a leader. Early on in her career she worked hard to create a culture where the team provided regular feedback which in turn helped her become a better leader. Her objective has always been to find someone to replace her position once she moves on, so the team can thrive without her.</p>\n<p>To Diane, success is her client’s success. This is what gives her a sense of fulfillment and encourages her to keep working. Her advice to other leaders is to hire people who have initiative, who are ambitious and inherently curious. She also places a lot of emphasis on being able to admit mistakes, and knowing that one cannot grow without first making mistakes. Finally, on diversity, Diane believes in picking the right candidate rather than scoring “diversity points”. Instead, she focuses on fostering open communication with other women.</p>\n<p><b>In this episode we discuss:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.52] Diane’s goes global</li>\n<li>[4.40] How she adapted to working in different countries</li>\n<li>[6.44] Finding your voice</li>\n<li>[18.42] The importance of feedback</li>\n<li>[24.07] Advice for other leaders</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Resources and links mentioned:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.omnichains.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Omnichain</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/women-in-supply-chain/wisc-podcast/\">Women In Supply Chain™ Series</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

    "date": "2020-05-25T15:15:39",

    "summary": "NA",

    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14546948/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">We are finding that a lot of supply chain software takes a lot of time for on boarding and our guest today is here to tell us about their solution that can be implemented in days! Thats right Chris from Right Sized inventory is here to tell us all about how they make that happen and what they are doing for warehouses everywhere,</span></p>\n<p>Chris is the Vice President of Right Sized Inventory, an optimization software that helps companies eliminate inventory imbalances through real life simulations. By gathering the correct <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210307014256/https://letstalksupplychain.com/season-2-ep-2-adventures-in-big-data-w-chris-lee-logistical-labs/\">data</a> all in one place, RSI helps companies get started with predictive analytics and supply chain optimization.</p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">With safety stock being questioned these days because of Covid and organizations are looking at different solutions to help diversify their inventory such as just in case instead of just in time, Chris tells us how his clients are using the data RSI provides them with differently, and they are seeing requests they have never seen before.</span></p>\n<p>The unique selling point with RSI is that they help companies manage their inventory more efficiently at an affordable price. How? They use their own patented technology that gathers and synthesizes data in a couple of hours. By using their software, clients are able to manage their inventory surplus and excess, helping them save them millions of dollars as well as improve customer service levels.</p>\n<p>Since RSI is affordable and based on tech, they are able to work with companies of all sizes. Using one real life example, Chris explains how they decreased a client’s inventory levels by 20% and helped them save over 6 million dollars. With the Covid-19 pandemic, they are still able to help businesses prepare for when demand increases and any other what-if scenarios. For the future, RSI is focusing on growing their organic approach, partnering up with consulting firms and embedding their patented technology into their systems.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.40] The story behind RSI</li>\n<li>[5.30] Data and real life simulation</li>\n<li>[14.53 manage your inventory</li>\n<li>[19.12] decrease inventory levels by 20%</li>\n<li>[24.20] The future is collaboration</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.rightsizedinventory.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Right Sized Inventory</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "50eb3836-6fd7-4c1f-807e-b48d7f64deea",
    "episode_number": 116,
    "post_id": 11716,
    "title": "EP 116 – 150 Million Pieces of PPE and Counting",
    "slug": "ep-116-150-million-pieces-of-ppe-and-counting",
    "date": "2020-05-18T15:21:08",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14454875/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Mike works for Apex, the third largest freight forwarder in the world and number one forwarder transporting products from China. In 2019 they flew 500 charter flights, and have grown by $1 billion in 10 years!</p>\n<p>Apex transports all types of products, from high tech, to retail, to ecommerce. They have charters that transport over 100,000 kilos and their planes can reach every corner of the planet. How have they adapted to the current crisis? Apex has been instrumental during the pandemic: they’ve offered space on aircrafts to government response teams, have transported PPE products to many countries and played a big role in protecting front line workers.</p>\n<p>Do they have a secret to success? Mike says that Apex focuses on growth by adding <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210414104713/https://letstalksupplychain.com/what-is-the-importance-of-chemistry-among-people-in-the-workplace/\">talent</a> that shares the same vision as them. From the words of their customers, this is what makes them a company that “always finds a way to get things done” and are able to find unique solutions to problems. Having invested in tech early on, Apex has been able to pivot more easily than other forwarders, giving them an even bigger competitive advantage. Although the future is unclear on how Covid will impact supply chain, Apex’s ambition is still to become the major freight forwarder across the globe.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.42] Who is Apex?</li>\n<li>[10.40] 150 Million pieces of PPE and Counting!</li>\n<li>[15.00] Their secret to success</li>\n<li>[24.05] How Apex will be helping customers post-Covid</li>\n<li>[29.39] What’s next for Apex</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210414104713/https://www.apexsupplychain.com/gb/about-apex/history/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Apex Global Logistic</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "b43a7e14-cd64-4915-b40f-e494f9b4b0b0",
    "episode_number": 115,
    "post_id": 11707,
    "title": "EP 115 – Industrial Manufacturing",
    "slug": "ep-115-industrial-manufacturing",
    "date": "2020-05-11T07:07:58",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14349467/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>The biggest challenge in industrial manufacturing is customer acquisition and retention. When it comes to <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/sea-2-ep-52-marketing-supply-chain-for-the-business-win/\">marketing</a> in the traditional world of Industrial manufacturing many companies see marketing as a cost center rather than an investment. This means marketing budgets are given low priority, especially during a recession when in reality marketing should be at the forefront of any strategy because it will set you apart from your competitors and keep your brand top of mind. In the long run, this ends up being more expensive, since companies need to start from ground zero when the market picks up. Only some companies are realising that marketing is the key to future success – especially when trying to get through a revenue plateau.</p>\n<p>Christopher realised this was an issue and started helping more industrial companies with their marketing. His system focuses on creating momentum, producing value and building a community before launching a product or asking customers to buy. Consistency and the long play is what sets one marketing strategy apart from the rest, marketing should work hand in hand with sales to keep the leads flowing in. Sales should be encouraged to showcase their thought leadership online with the help of the marketing team and together the business will have a winning strategy.</p>\n<p>Christopher is a big believer in social and uses social media such as Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn (3 hashtags!) as a platform to educate, entertain and build up a consistent brand image. As consumer behaviors keep shifting, more industrial companies will have no choice but to turn to more effective marketing in order to gain a competitive edge.</p>\n<p>Christopher is also the leader in the profile rings you see on Linkedin, he gave back to the supply chain community by doing this for professionals for free to stand out, in a time of so much noise its efforts like these that will be the most rewarded</p>\n<p>In this episode we discuss:</p>\n<p>● [0.35] Industrial Manufacturing<br />\n● [4.46] Top challenges in the industry<br />\n● [11.59] Winning marketing strategy<br />\n● [16.35] How different platforms provide communication opportunities<br />\n● [23.00] The carbon footprint of manufacturing companies</p>\n<p>Resources and links mentioned:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.nesbitmarketing.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Nesbit Marketing</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-nesbit/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Christopher Nesbit</a></li>\n</ul>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 6167, 6761, 5388],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627.jpg",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627.jpg'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-300x300.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-300x300.jpg 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-150x150.jpg 150w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-768x768.jpg 768w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-60x60.jpg 60w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-600x600.jpg 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627-100x100.jpg 100w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/LTSC-IMG_1627.jpg 828w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "5ce98106-798b-45bf-87ff-dba31979872a",
    "episode_number": 114,
    "post_id": 11865,
    "title": "EP 114 – Women In Supply Chain™, Anju Gupta",
    "slug": "ep-114-women-in-supply-chain-anju-gupta",
    "date": "2020-05-04T07:18:45",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14251133/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Anju is the product manager at Coupa Software, an all-in-one business spend management platform. In today’s Women In Supply Chain™ series, Anju tells us how she got into supply chain, the valuable lessons she learnt from failure and why it’s important to put a focus on diversity.</p>\n<p>Anju moved from working in the corporate world at Oracle to a fast paced beauty startup. She was passionate about understanding the various pieces, solving business problems and growing both as a person and in her career. She says it’s important to be flexible, say yes to opportunities and be willing to take a leap into the unknown; this is what got her to where she is now.</p>\n<p>Our world has never been so diverse and inclusive, and yet there is still a lot of work to do. Anju explains why it’s important to have role models to look up to, and that in order to move the needle of diversity we need to encourage more discussions, be aware of our biases and lead with empathy. Her advice to other Women In Supply Chain™: think about what you want out of your career and be willing to pursue your dream. Women are sometimes afraid to verbalize who they want to be – Anju urges them to take risks and not be afraid to change.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.38] Anju’s journey</li>\n<li>[7.32] The importance of being courageous</li>\n<li>[11.50] Valuable lessons from failure</li>\n<li>[19.33] How to move the needle of diversity</li>\n<li>[22.23] Advice to other Women In Supply Chain™</li>\n</ul>\n<h4><strong>Sponsored by: COUPA and GWPP</strong></h4>\n<p>Global women procurement professionals (GWPP), is proud to have coupa as a platinum sponsor for our community. GWPP’s focus is to promote women in the procurement and supply chain industry and to have them grow. Coupa is an amazing example of how to be a thought leader within procurement and supply chain – we are grateful to have a community partnership together.</p>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.coupa.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Coupa</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://globalwpp.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">GWPP</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/women-in-supply-chain/wisc-podcast/\">Women In Supply Chain™</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "04314581-8b1d-45d2-aa8f-05cf58b39119",
    "episode_number": 113,
    "post_id": 11868,
    "title": "EP 113 – RFID your way to better inventory",
    "slug": "ep-113-rfid-your-way-to-better-inventory",
    "date": "2020-04-27T07:29:03",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14148662/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>How does replenishment work in your <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/season2-episode32/\">warehouse</a>? It is probably very manual, lots of paperwork and different stakeholders involved making it impossible to be be agile and efficient. Because of that I thought it was important to introduce you to a company that is revolutionizing this. Andrew is the CEO of ShelfAware, a company that helps suppliers see in real-time what is on their customers’ shelves through hardware tracking RFID technology. This technology allows companies to see the exact moment a customer takes an item off the shelf, how many items they take and how much is needed to replenish stock.</p>\n<p>Using RFID technology together with real-time software means that suppliers can easily replenish stock without worrying about waste, workers don’t have to waste time counting items and companies can gather data on their customer habits. From a cost effective standpoint, everyone wins. ShelfAware works as a 3rd party SaaS (Software as a service), so they don’t need to touch the product at any point in the supply chain. The software connects with a tracking code that can easily be printed by the supplier and is put on the product itself.</p>\n<p>Who is ShelfAware’s ideal client? As Andrew says, he keeps discovering new industries this system could be useful for. They started with industrial suppliers and manufacturers, but anyone from a dentist to a large scale conglomerate can make use of their product and software. Andrew has helped businesses drastically lower inventory without losing the rate at which they replenish items. Once again, this is proof that collaborating with other companies can make them stronger together.</p>\n<p>Lastly we get a sneak peek into Andrew’s new show on The SC Supply Chain TV on Youtube called <a href=\"https://web.archive.org/web/20210414102838/https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFKDRuq7tnIpqbOeCBIARjzneFTRlXAF8\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">From the Frontlines</a> where he brings us into the frontlines of business, entrepreneurship and supply chain!</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.37] The story behind ShelfAware</li>\n<li>[6.50] Why RFID is so under-utilized</li>\n<li>[17.10] Who should consider RFID</li>\n<li>[21.17] Does it actually work in real life scenarios?</li>\n<li>[30.20] From the Frontlines</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://shelfawarevmi.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">ShelfAware</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

    "tags": [],

  {
    "uuid": "3265d440-876c-4c72-bfd8-32c5488220cd",
    "episode_number": 112,
    "post_id": 11872,
    "title": "EP 112 – The Answer? Data Sharing &#038; Collaboration",
    "slug": "ep-112-the-answer-data-sharing-collaboration",
    "date": "2020-04-20T07:37:43",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/14049824/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Alloy was founded 4 years ago when Joel and his co-founders realized there was a huge lag between supply chain and the retail industry. From the very beginning, the company focused on customer centricity and invested most of its resources into R&amp;D. Now, Alloy helps everything from small companies to Fortune 500s optimize their supply chain by connecting their data to customer demand. Focusing on customer experience for not only their customers but their customers, customer has been their key to success in this very competitive landscape of supply chain technology.</p>\n<p>The main challenge when it comes to retail supply chain is the huge shift in consumer habits, partly due to e-commerce. Nowadays, consumers expect a seamless customer experience, an infinite amount of stock and personalized offers. However, realizing that that there is a direct mis match between customer demands and retail distribution, Alloy were really able to dive deep into this challenge and come up with solutions that are not seen on the market yet, that is why they have a growing base of some of the biggest names in retail. Alloy really wants to make sure that their clients supply chains are giving them a competitive advantage and they do that by helping retailers coordinate all the different moving parts of their supply chain.</p>\n<p>The landscape and technology is constantly evolving, so how does a startup like Alloy adapt? You guessed it: <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/podcast/\">collaboration</a>. Right from the beginning Alloy was partnering with companies and made sure to be grounded to real world problems. As the number of partners and clients increased, the more they were able to take a holistic approach to resolving their clients’ pain points. Alloy’s future involves more effort on the data side through R&amp;D, and more specialization of every element of the supply chain.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.29] Who is Alloy?</li>\n<li>[9.45] Consumer Habits driving supply chain</li>\n<li>[18.09] A customer success story</li>\n<li>[25.18] Data and Collaboration</li>\n<li>[30.10] The future for Alloy</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://alloy.ai/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Alloy</a></li>\n</ul>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5632, 5388, 5429],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384.jpg",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384.jpg'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"297\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-300x297.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-300x297.jpg 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-150x150.jpg 150w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-768x760.jpg 768w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-60x60.jpg 60w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-600x593.jpg 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384-100x100.jpg 100w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-IMG_1384.jpg 828w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

  {
    "uuid": "7ce32ccb-6842-4198-8309-667ea2669ff3",
    "episode_number": 111,
    "post_id": 11876,
    "title": "EP 111 – End to End Supply Chain, Dead or Alive?",
    "slug": "ep-111-end-to-end-supply-chain-dead-or-alive",
    "date": "2020-04-13T07:45:38",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13956785/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Today’s special episode features Scott and Greg from Supply Chain Now! Scott, Greg and Sarah have a lively discussion about whether we are seeing the death of the end-to-end supply chain. You will also hear about how the circular economy and supply chain is the answer plus how the role of sustainability will play out with consumers and the future of consumerism.</p>\n<p>Organizations have spent a lot of time and money trying to perfect their <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/the-time-is-now-for-retailers-to-future-proof-their-supply-chains-with-a-cohesive-approach-for-end-to-end-replenishment-planning/\">end to end supply chain</a>, but Greg says the circular supply chain is here to stay. The circular supply chain consists mainly of turning waste into opportunity. As the world’s resources become increasingly limited, companies are having to look for other ways to source and distribute their products and services. This, together with a huge shift in consumer behaviour towards sustainable practices, means companies will soon have no other option but to adopt a circular mindset.</p>\n<p>How can companies adopt a more sustainable supply chain? Sarah talks about collaborating with startups in order to find innovative solutions and challenge the status quo. Scott and Greg talk about the importance of changing mindsets and focusing on customer experience. This includes encouraging suppliers to take on more responsibility and looking for materials that are economically viable, sustainable and convenient for the customer (like 3D printing, for example). Companies should put more effort into building a brand and communicating their concept and vision, as well as identifying specific ambitions and building business cases. Some best practices include educating employees, finding the right KPIs and being willing to “do good” and talk about it.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[1.15] End to End has been costly</li>\n<li>[12.26] Consumer behavior pushes for circular</li>\n<li>[26.40] Circular mindset shift</li>\n<li>[30.11] The key drivers to success</li>\n<li>[36.55] Best practices for a circular economy</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://supplychainnowradio.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Supply<u> Chain Now</u></a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "053ee1ee-5ee2-460a-81c8-b046a384314a",
    "episode_number": 110,
    "post_id": 11880,
    "title": "EP 110 – Women In Supply Chain™, Angie Reno",
    "slug": "ep-110-women-in-supply-chain-angie-reno",
    "date": "2020-04-06T07:56:40",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13860347/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>Angie has worked in supply chain all her life, with her earliest career memories involving a master thesis and meeting Ted Ruhly, the CEO of Maersk. Since then, Angie has continuously sought career growth and built extensive experience within the industry. Featuring Angie in our “<a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/women-in-supply-chain/wisc-podcast/\">Women In Supply Chain™</a>” series has a personal significance to Sarah and is a career highlight for Angie with all her hard work in helping to close the gender gap. In this episode, Angie talks about the guidance she received from her father, why she is passionate about this industry and how the people make all the difference.</p>\n<p>Angie’s main challenge in supply chain was the pushback she got from colleagues and coworkers when she advocated for change and innovation. Angie knows that disruption is what encourages progress, but it can be difficult to implement when leaders are being pulled in so many different directions. As a woman in supply chain she has worked hard to challenge the status quo at all times in her career in order to encourage more diversity amongst male and female leaders.</p>\n<p>What’s her advice for the younger generation? She explains that it’s worth exploring the different partnerships your universities may offer. Be willing to go to conferences and reach out to leaders, look for ways to optimize the supply chain ecosystem and consider getting into cyber security. As she says, there is a shortage of talent and therefore many opportunities for students looking to get into the industry. For Angie herself, the future is focused on finding a healthy work balance and driving innovation forward.</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[2.41] Sweats and the CEO of Maersk</li>\n<li>[7.53] Taking some major risks</li>\n<li>[11.30] Overcoming challenges thats career throws at you</li>\n<li>[16.24] Diversity in the industry</li>\n<li>[25.18] Next Gen of Supply Chain, what you need to know</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.crowley.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Crowley</a></li>\n</ul>\n",

  {
    "uuid": "160ec41f-6768-4f8c-a98b-b40a8b99c938",
    "episode_number": 109,
    "post_id": 11884,
    "title": "EP 109 – Leave the nuisance expenses to us!",
    "slug": "ep-109-leave-the-nuisance-expenses-to-us",
    "date": "2020-03-30T07:58:45",
    "video_id": "NA",
    "summary": "NA",
    "main_points": "NA",
    "recent_news": "NA",
    "related_episodes": [],
    "guest_highlights": "NA",
    "web_content": "<p><iframe class=\"podcast-class\" style=\"display: block;\" src=\"https://html5-player.libsyn.com/embed/episode/id/13756511/height/90/theme/custom/thumbnail/no/direction/forward/render-playlist/no/custom-color/0083b6/\" width=\"100%\" height=\"90\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><span data-mce-type=\"bookmark\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;\" class=\"mce_SELRES_start\">﻿</span></iframe></p>\n<p>With <a href=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/ep-107-social-2-0-the-dawn-of-micro-communities/\">procurement</a> departments finding themselves lean and mean these days, where are you spending gaps? Are you leaving money on the table? You might be, so what are you going to do about it. Some of your biggest savings lie within your nuisance expenses like uniform, waste disposal and pest control services and you may be like many other procurement departments that only review these expenses every few years. Rich Ham from Fine Tune is here to tell us why we should reconsider that strategy and how his company helps companies save money by optimizing those difficult-to-understand expenses.</p>\n<p>The current challenges of procurement professionals are that expense categories are segmented, some requiring much more management than others. This means that many business strategies leave money on the table, waste time and energy and don’t allocate resources adequately. With Fine Tune, companies can outsource all the complex, confusing expense management processes and focus on their core competencies and as Rich says “offloading headaches”.</p>\n<p>How does Fine Tune do this? They partner with the right people and focus on collaboration amoung all parties. This is very apparent when Rich shares with us a real life example of a client who had 14 different suppliers with several different contracts. Fine Tune helped that company reduce their suppliers to 4 through consolidation and that resulted in a huge cost savings of 35%. Rich goes on to say that their true speciality is removing friction from procurement and operations. The result? Companies invest in the Fine Tune management program because they don’t want to let go of Fine Tune!</p>\n<p><strong>In this episode we discuss:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>[0.30] Where are your biggest savings</li>\n<li>[5.56] Where are you leaving money on the table?</li>\n<li>[24.15] Reducing costs by 35%</li>\n<li>[28.07] Removing friction from procurement</li>\n<li>[35.58] The future is bright</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Resources and links mentioned:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.finetuneus.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" target=\"_blank\">Fine Tune</a></li>\n</ul>\n",
    "categories": [5446, 5388, 6197],
    "tags": [],
    "media_link": "https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109.jpg",
    "media_description": "<p class=\"attachment\"><a href='https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109.jpg'><img fetchpriority=\"high\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"300\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-300x298.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium\" alt=\"\" srcset=\"https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-300x298.jpg 300w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-150x150.jpg 150w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-768x762.jpg 768w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-60x60.jpg 60w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-600x596.jpg 600w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109-100x100.jpg 100w, https://letstalksupplychain.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/LTSC-EP109.jpg 828w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" title=\"\"></a></p>\n"

    "uuid": "4b822bf1-fbc3-4d4b-adb4-d2db0ab9ba75",
